We would have no hesitation about using them again for any sort of trip. (And given the highly competitive and sometimes obnoxious environment of Moroccan tour companies, this is saying a lot.) Great work,folks, and thanks!

It wouldn't have been the same without them. My friends and I spent the last week of January in Morocco. We would not have traveled there without a local tour company we could trust to take care of everything for us. That is what Morocco Explored did! From her office in Canada, Robbin was our first point of contact. She was always timely in asking our questions and very helpful in every way. From the moment we landed in Marrakech, we were in good hands too. Our drivers, Salah and Miloud, were easy to talk to and very open to our many questions about the country and the culture. The hotels selected to accommodate us were well located and comfortable. Local guides were always personable and knowledgeable. Spending a week in the country was a blast for we three "junior seniors". We still can't believe that we were able to ride a camel in the Sahara and sleep in a camp under the stars. What an experience!

What a difference the right tour company makes!. What a difference the right tour company makes!Morocco Explored provided an excellent tour tailored just for us! From the correspondence to arrange the trip, coordinate payment and deal with logistics changes (thanks to the unexpected weather - flooding!) with Robin and Salah, and on the ground experience with our assigned guide and driver Khaled Ezzai, Morocco Explored made everything easy and enjoyable! I can’t say enough good things about Khaled, if you book a tour through Morocco explored I highly recommend you ask for him to be your guide. To give you an example, we were in Morocco in late November/December 2014 just as the country was hit with torrential rains that caused widespread damage to roads and buildings. We tried the normal roads to get out of Marrakesh and through to Skoura only to find them blocked as the road along the Tichka pass has been damaged and had been closed by the authorities. We heard from other tourists later on whose guides eventually told them they would have to turn back to Marrakesh and they lost days of their trip waiting for the pass to open. But not Khalid, he came up with a plan to go by an alternate route that took us further north, and while it would require driving late into the evening, it would get us to our destination and still allow us to cover all the items we wanted to see in the next 4 days. This is just one example of what a great problem solver he is and how he thinks outside the box. We had 4 people in our group, two vegetarians, one person with gluten allergies, and one person sick with a stomach bug caught earlier in Marakesh before we started the tour. He helped us make sure that wherever we stopped everyone had food options to meet their needs. In another event he went out of his way to contact a hotel we had booked independently of Morocco Explored in Ait Benhaddou (where he was supposed to leave us) and found the hotel had been damaged by the rains and tourists were not being allowed into the old Kasbah where the hotel was and Khaled quickly helped us arrange for an alternate hotel (and sure enough when we got to Ait BenHaddou the entrance was blocked off by local police who would not let any tourists go in ). Khaled helped us tailor the daily itinerary based on things he could see we liked and didn’t like and was very flexible if we asked to change something on the fly. We found Khaled to be a very personable and friendly guide and with his patient demeanor and ready smile (not to mention witty sense of humor) he is easy to be around. It felt like he really wanted us to see and get to know Morocco and he provided local perspective on Moroccan history and current events, and challenges facing Morocco. I hope we have the opportunity to return to Morrocco again and when I do I will definitely use Morrocco Explored and ask for Khaled Izzay as our guide !

Day trip to the Atlas Mountains. We went on a private trip to the Atlas mountains. Our guide, Said was well educated & knowledgeable - we learned a lot about the Berber way of life. We passed through stunning qvalleys & mounains, up to 2000 metres with beautiful,views & past many villages.We stopped for lunch at a Berber house; this was large & ramblingq; 13 people spanning 3 generarations lived there + some animals. We had a nice lunch of salad, meat, veg & coucous, followed by nuts, fruit & mint tea.We then drove down to another valley & back to Marrakesh.RMR

Very good time. We had a great time with our tour guide although if you want a really good experience you need to book a few days worth of trip with camel rides. For day trips you better hire a car and drive your way.

3 generations with good times and bad. We took the 4 day/3 night camel tour from Marrakesh to Fez as a family of 6, 2 over 70 years old, 2 in their 30s and 2 tweens. We were met by our driver at our Riad in Marrakesh and walked to the main square where we met the Marrakesh manager and got into our van. We had a long day of driving and saw many nice sights. Our driver took us to one Kasbah and encouraged us to look around, which we did. After we started looking around he told us that it would cost us 20 MDH per person. We paid this as we left but as we drove away I looked up the Kasbah in our guidebook and it said there was no fee. We then continued on to Ait Ben Haddou and got to our hotel there which had been booked by Morocco Explored. The rooms were quite cold but otherwise nicely laid out and they provided plenty of blankets to keep us warm. We were told at dinner that our driver was being replaced for the next day. We met the new driver and talked a bit about what to expect. The second driver, Miloud, spoke better English and excellent Spanish. He was very helpful throughout the rest of our trip. We had a beautiful drive on both day 2 and day 3 and got the the desert in time for the sunset. Unfortunately, throughout our adventure the oldest member of our group was feeling unwell. Miloud kept track of this and helped us explore other options as we needed them such as finding a pharmacy, or letting him stay in the van while the rest of us went exploring. When we went into the desert, the combination of the camel walk and the sickness were overwhelming for our sick member and the camel driver had to manage a difficult situation which he handled quite well and with dignity for all involved. The night in the camp was cold and beautiful. I would highly recommend it. The children loved every moment of the camel ride and camp evening and morning and they barely complained at all about the cold. Day 4 was mostly driving to Fez but was still a good journey and broken up at regular intervals by Miloud to show us interesting villages and forests on the way back. Lunch was fabulous on the last day and we were sad to say goodbye to our adventure.

Great tour with Hisham. Our 4 person family group did a ten day tour mostly of the Atlas Mountains and many other beautiful sites, including the desert dunes where we were lucky enough to see the lunar eclipse and amazing stars. Everywhere we stayed had beautiful accommodations and wonderful staff. The head of the company even took us for a hike on the dunes! You can choose your itinerary, including length of stay, which makes, in spite of cost, for a far superior experience over bus tours. The best thing of all was Hisham, our guide, who was so sweet and so gracious and, being Berber, a real asset to us. We became very close with him and learned so much about Morocco history and culture. In addition, when we tired of tourist restaurants, he found safe quality places where we enjoyed the company of locals. Do your research on the many possible places to see, then consult with the company which has a very good website with excellent photos and accessible contact options. Robbin is the best! She is very generous with her time. We did 10 days on our own to beaches before the tour. Don't miss Legzira! Great body surfing and sweet life guards, I loved swimming with these guys! One other highlight of the tour was the Atlas Studios (the actual studio, covering many hectares) where many English speaking films were made for decades and still are.
Riding a camel. Had a very interesting time riding a camel. Out tour group took this adventure, many others also rode a comel.

Into the Mountains and another world. Great trip to Ait Benhaddou! . We really enjoyed our day trip to Ait Benhaddou with Morocco Explored. Our driver, Mohammad, was excellent. Day trip Ait Benhaddou. Ouzoude waterfalls are amazing. It's a good 2-3 hour drive, but it's worth it to see the slowly unfolding foothills and landscape outside Marrakesh, and then to experience the second highest waterfalls in Africa. Or so,our very knowledgeable and chatty guide told us. His name was Samir, he had studied English literature at the University, was of Berber heritage, and was a mine of information, political, historical, geological, and spoke 4 languages fluently. Take swimming gear, he pools are deliciously cool and there are places to swim and make ridiculous jumps from, which seems to be a local speciality that the tourists also indulge in. It is used by Moroccans and tourists so doesn't feel like it's for Western use only which I really liked. There are cafes all along, so choose the one you like the look of, expect to climb a bit, but there are steps and pathways so you don't need hiking boots- I wore Birkenstocks and was fine. Exploring Morocco with Morocco Explored. We recently spent 12 days on a private “grand tour” of Morocco with Morocco Explored. Morocco being the amazing place it is, overall we were happy with our trip. We were often pleased with Morocco Explored’s service, occasionally very pleased, and, in one very important respect, very disappointed. • Pre-trip: Morocco Explored has a representative in North America, which made communication easy. She answered emails promptly and was very informative. Unfortunately, once we arrived in Morocco we found discrepancies between pre-trip representations and what actually took place in country (see below). • The itinerary: our itinerary was planned to help us explore Morocco. (Casablanca – Chefchaouen – Volubilis – Fez – Camel caravan with a night sleeping in the desert under a nomad tent – Tinehir, Ait ben Haddou, Marakkesh, Essaouira.) It was very comprehensive and allowed us to fully experience the country’s beauty and cultural diversity. Be aware, however, that in order to complete the circuit in a limited amount of time, there will be some long days of travel where you will be able to view the country’s amazing, ever-changing landscape from your car but not spend appreciable amounts of time outside of it.• The accommodations: We were very pleased with the accommodations used by Morocco Explored. They were lodgings of character and charm, clean, comfortable and centrally located.• The pre-arranged city guides: our guide in Fez was fantastic: extremely knowledgeable and a tireless advocate for his hometown. The Marrakech guide was good, but too much time was spent in workshops and stores where we had no interest in buying what was on offer (as we eventually explained to him). The palmery tour was a waste: our guide raced us through fields that were alternately dusty and muddy, then left us at the local rug cooperative (our second of three for the week) for a shopping opportunity.• The driver/guide: staffing is an area where Morocco Explored needs improvement. The quality of the driver/guide during an extended long tour (a week or more) has a direct impact on the quality of your visit. You spend long hours in the car with your driver/guide, who is your primary interface with the land you’re travelling through and the person most available to interpret it for you. It’s important that they have good language skills, are knowledgeable of the area they’re travelling through, eager to share that knowledge with their passengers, know where to stop and what to point out. In my initial inquiries to Morocco Explored I asked whether we would have the same/driver guide throughout and was told that it was “likely” unless they were really busy. Fortunately our trip was scheduled for the low-volume, shoulder season, when demand for drivers was low. Even more fortunately, we immediately struck up a good relationship with our guide, who was more than competent in every respect: a safe and considerate driver, friendly, courteous, thoughtful, accommodating, knowledgeable and passionate about sharing that knowledge with us. Midway through our tour, we were informed that our driver was being replaced. When I called the office to protest, the manager gave several explanations of why this change was necessary. They all worked to the advantage of Morocco Explored’s business interests but took no account of their pre-trip representations nor of their clients’ satisfaction (which you’d think would be an important business interest). As it turned out the replacement guide was clearly second string: on his car door was the emblem of a different tour operator; he spoke extremely limited English (communication between us was carried out in French, which I then had to translate for my traveling companion); he had either limited knowledge of the area or limited interest in sharing that knowledge with us. For example, he tried to rush us out of the World Heritage Site of Ait Ben Haddou without our even setting foot within its famous walls. Then, as we entered the celebrated valley of 1000 kasbahs, we waited expectantly for our driver to stop at one or to at least point out one or two and tell us something about them. Not a peep from him. When I finally asked where the kasbahs were, he replied that we had left them behind along ago. We wonder how much more we missed during the time we spent with him. In summary, we found that Morocco Explored had the knowledge and the resources to provide at the least a satisfactory tour experience. But in our case, the quality of their staffing was not consistent, nor did they provide the continuity of service we had been led to expect.

great day. shops are great but dont point at any thing they will think you want it so be shreud and you will get a bargain

Highly recommend! . We got to see a lot of amazing things we would have never got to ourselves. Our guide Hichem was wonderful. A great driver, very professional but also personal, taking us to have lunch at his family home in a small village along the way. The organisation was very easy to deal with.

Great organisation, great itinerary and a great experience.. Our party of three organised a 14 day circuit of Morocco starting in Rabat and taking in Chefchaouen, Volubilis, Fes, the Sahara Desert, Ait Benhaddou, Essaouira and Marrakech. The organisation from the start was faultless, with Robbin being very responsive and helpful in assisting us devise our itinerary. Once on the road the benefits of the detailed planning were obvious; the accommodation met our requirements perfectly, the drivers were friendly and accommodating, the vehicles were comfortable and clean, and the food, experiences and sights we enjoyed were beyond our expectations. We have no hesitation in recommending this company for your Moroccan experience.

Great Adventure Thru Morocco. Shukran Hicham for making our asventure thru Morocco so great. We did the four-day trip from Marrakech to Fes With Morroco Explored. The sights along the ways were amazing and interesting. The best part of the tour was our driver Hicham. His English was wonderful and he was a saint for putting up with our curiosity and all of our questions. Hicham is a great driver and makes you feel totally safe all along the way. He truly loves the area and knows it well, as coming from a Berber village along the route. Everything from booking to the end of the tour was fast and easy and without a hitch. I'd certainly use Morroco Explored again when visiting Morocco.

We felt really connected. Our tour was truly wonderful and very personable and we really felt connected to your gracious and hospitable country. We saw so much. Our sense were overwhelmed by the beauty of the geography, the architecture, the friendliness of the people, the fine food and the colour, quality and variety of handcrafted goods in the markets. Our driver Miloud was excellent, flexible, and with consultation, made many spontaneous, "non-touristy" stops. We would recommend Morocco Explored very highly.

Morocco Explored - Best Tour Experience. In March, my family (husband, 12-year-old daughter and my in-laws) and I went to Morocco for the break. We had the best experience. Better than we could have imagined. Morocco Explored and our terrific guide Miloud were the reason we did!! Miloud is a very knowledgeable guide who is open to many questions. He takes pride in his job and giving his group an authentic experience. He also took us to the BEST restaurants along the way. Morocco Explored ensures you have the best guides, accommodations and experience.

A week in Morocco. We had a week to spend visiting Morocco and contacted Morocco Explored to put together a customized package for our group of 4. We were very pleased with the response to all of our questions and requests and with the plans that were developed. Our riad in Marrakesh could not have been a better location – just minutes from the Jemaa El Fna. We had a four day excursion into the interior complete with tea with a nomad family, a camel ride at sunset to a camp in the dunes and a visit to a number of interesting sites including Ait Ben Haddou (UNESCO heritage site). Our guide and driver, Hicham was excellent. Because he grew up in the area we were travelling to he was a great source of information. We were well taken care of and always felt safe. We were happy to see that he would also be our driver to Essaouira. We would definitely recommend Morocco Explored.

Highlite of Our Morocco Experience. My wife and I did the 4 day 3 night tour from Marrakech to Fes with Morocco Explored as part of a longer stay in Morocco. The tour included 1 night in a desert camp. The sights along the way were amazing. The old fortresses, casbahs, and berber villages were very interesting, as was an off road journey. All the stays and meals were great [the best dish we had in Morocco was on the tour in Tinehir, a chicken and almond pastilla]. The desert trip on camels to the desert camp was the highlite of our trip [Thank you Said, our camel guide (you can use our scorpion joke if you want)]. The experience was something we will remember forever. But the best part of the tour was the staff. We had a driver and a guide. Mohammed and Khalid were both terrific. They were knowedgeable, professional and simultaneously friendly and cordial. We really enjoyed their company, and the pure driving part of the tour went by quickly. Last, but not least, we want to mention Robbin. Robbin coordinated the tour. She was responsive and helpful and we wished we would have gotten to meet her also. Shukran bzef, thank you very much Morocco Explored.

Wonderful private overnight tour. After booking a 9-day trip to Morocco, my husband and I decided we'd like to venture a bit beyond Marrakech and Essaouira and after several emails back and forth, booked a private overnight trip to the Atlas Mountains, Ouarzazate, Ait Ben-Haddou, and Telouet with Morocco Explored. They were very helpful and responsive by email, and in retrospect, I should have taken their advice to book a 2-night tour so we could have seen and done more with them (but that's my fault -- not theirs!). As we were visiting a bit early in the season, we were provided with both a trainee driver, Abdul, and a guide, Khaled, who met us at our riad in Marrakech and led us to their comfortable Toyota SUV. Khaled was professional, friendly, and spoke very good English. Although his primary role is usually as a driver, he pointed out interesting sites along the way, answered our questions to the best of his knowledge, walked us through Ait Ben-Haddou, and offered to take photos for us. We stopped at several scenic overlooks in the mountains, and whenever the driver heard me turn my camera on, he would slow down or offer to stop so I could get a better photo. The restaurants where we stopped for lunch had decent food and were reasonably priced, and the rest stops were clean.The hotel they put us up in near Ait Ben-Haddou was a bit spartan, but certainly adequate for an overnight stay, and included dinner and breakfast. The second day of our trip was mostly spent in the car driving back towards Marrakech, where we switched drivers before continuing on to Essaouira. This caused a bit of a delay and we didn't have time to stop at an Argan oil cooperative on the way, but I suspect my husband was pleased about that. Essalah, who I had corresponded with by email to organize the trip, surprised us in Marrakech with a box of Moroccan pastries and some fruit for the journey.Both drivers were very good, and apart from one scary moment where a speeding minivan nearly ran us off the road coming around a curve, we felt very safe in the car, even on the narrow, winding roads in the mountains. If I ever have a chance to go back to Morocco, I would certainly book a longer trip with this company.

Unforgettable trip with Amazing Company!. Looking for something fun and exciting to do in Morocco?? Morocco Explored Tour Company is the venue for you!! My friend and me organized our tour via the internet and were immediately impressed with the company’s efficient, friendly and informative communication. We decided to book a 5 days trip with Morocco Explored; we were picked up at the Airport promptly by our the manager Essalah and driver Khalid. The car was extremely comfortable, 4x4. For the first day we were troubled by our missing luggage but Mr. Essalah was so generous to help us contact the airport and had his driver driving us around Marrakesh even though it was not on our tour itinerary. The next 4 days we headed to the desert (erg Chebbi), we stopped at many famous sites along the way, and We enjoyed every single bit of what Morocco Explored had planned for us!! SO MUCH to see and enjoy, we LOVEDDD it!!! Without doubt the whole trip was brought alive by our wonderful driver, Khalid. He was knowledgeable, friendly and funny! he kept me entertained and educated throughout the excursion. We would certainly give Khalid ten out of ten for his knowledge. We saw so many famous sites and Khalid surprised us all by showing us many different sides of Morocco as well as telling us stories about Berber. My friend requested if possible for her to visit one of the schools and he made it happened!! The entire staff was courteous and fabulous!!!! And remember to give Khalid your camera; He took a lot of fabulous photos for us!!! Khalid also a careful driver and we felt VERY SAE in his SUV. Well worth the money and thank you Khalid, Essalah and Morocco Explored for the AMAZING trip!! Highly recommended, my friend is still talking about the trip and wants to come back for MORE!November, 2014.

5 days in Morocco. We did the 5 day, 4 night desert tour from Marrakech and loved it. Our driver, Miloud, was very good and very informative and made lots of stops for pictures. Our camel guide, Said, was very entertaining and took great pictures for us. The accommodations and food were great and the tour company was excellent to deal with, all our questions were answered promptly and the booking process was very easy. Loved Morocco. I would definitely recommend this tour.

Good tour company. We did the Tizi n’Tichka, Telouet, Ait Benhaddou day tour.Nothing to fault with this company. They were very professional, from the email exchanges prior to the trip, to our driver/guide.We were picked up close to our riad and ventured for the Atlas Mountains in a comfortable van with large windows making for easy sightseeing from the vehicle. It was just my girlfriend and I on the trip (private tour).Our driver was a nice guy and would stop for pictures whenever we wanted. He was a very safe driver and took his time on the narrow, windy roads through the mountains. I don't know if he was supposed to, but at each destination he would be our guide, as well. I thought I had read a guide would not be provided, so it was cool he did that, as he was very knowledgeable and spoke very good English.I recommend this tour company.

Great company, fantastic one-day trip to Ait ben Haddou. We recommend this company for a one-day trip from marrakesh through the Atlas mountains to Ait benHaddou! Good reliable car, very nice driver and excellent service. Lots of stops possible for taking pictures or enjoying sights. Lots ot time for visiting the old town and cityadel of Ait Ben Haddou. EXCELLENT!

A wonderful experience. We have a wonderful experience for dessert tour from fes to marrakech. The camel ride and dessert camping is fantastic. Miloud, the driver is very pleasant and helpful. We still have one more day to go, hope it will as fantastic as the first two days.

Amazing Personalized Experience!. From the start the company worked with us in planning all that we wanted to experience. We were in a 4x4 with an great driver, Khaled. He was very punctual, knowledgeable, responsible, and attune to our interests. He catered to our interests and we never felt like we were in a rush. For instance, I love goats. So Khaled pulled over when he saw a nomadic family walking their herd and asked them if i could hold and pet them. Also, I am allergic to gluten. Khaled was on it! He made sure that I was not served gluten; he checked to make sure all soups, etc. had no flour. My husband is very interested in music. Khaled played CDs of traditional Berber music and even took my husband CD shopping! The experiences were surprising and amazing, so many things we did not even expect. Feeding wild monkeys on the side of the road, off-roading and having tea in a nomadic family's cave...to name a few. We learned a lot about Berber life and the culture in Morocco. WELL WORTH IT! I highly recommended Morocco Explored, especially if you like the unique. I also HIGHLY recommend Khaled!

Mislead NYE experience. First of all let me say you have a beautiful country, unfortunately the tour we did with you for the New Year's celebration did not do it justice.It is sad as we based the choice of the tour based on the so well recomendation on TripAdvisor but for us was very unfortunate and we did not expirience any of the service level that we would expect.To start off, we were expecting a 4x4 vehicle with up to 4 people as described by you beforehand, but we end ed up in a van with a total of 6 people. We understand it is Holiday season and you may have more people booking and we were lucky with the people traveling with us so I guess we could get let that go. What we cannot get over though is the fact that our van was always following another van with around 10 other people, becoming apparent that we were following them and that both vans had to be at certain point at specific times. You would agree that means the purpose of having a driver for ourselves in order to enjoy the beautiful sightseeing is completely lost. We were always late and spent pretty much 2 days in the van rushing from a place to the other. Actually even some of the places we were meant to visit had to be postponed to the last day on the way back to Marrakech and we ended up not seeing them at all! The trip back to Marrakech was the most boring and tiring 550km of our lives. The tour itinerary provided claimed that we would be in Marrakech by 18h and we had booked the hotel accordingly.You had advised us about of "morrocan time", but over 4 hours delay is more than anyone should reasonably expect and to be quite honest was a result of lack of planning and organization. Even your driver said that it is impossible to return to Marrakech until 18h as it takes a 10h trip, which for us took almost 13 hours. Prior to the journey back we were told we had to change vans (to an older and less comfortable one) and drivers (to an older, slower and less competent one). We went exceedingly slowly all the way and stopped at driver chosen places for breaks and lunch that were very bad. It is unfortunate that for the price we paid to ensure a trip that sounded personalized, off the beaten path and adventurous, where we would have the time to enjoy the beauty of morocco, we ended up spending 4 days in a van with little to do, few stops to take photos because we were always being schedule, missed defined sites and bunched in a 17 person trip.We are very unhappy and won't recommend your services. I hope the above will help you to ensure you provide quality services to all clients. Sadly it will be too late for us, as we can't recover the hours lost, money spent and enjoyment missed.

Excellent way to see morocco!!. A great experience from start to finish. We did an 8 day tour. Initial email contact was easy, all transfers were good and the representative here was very amenable. The itinerary was amazing as was the accommodation and guides. I felt safe and well looked after and would use them again .

Unforgettable visit!. Many thanks to Morocco Explored for making our tour to the desert one of the most memorable trips of our lives. Special thanks to our guide Meloud who was excellent, not only a professional driver but providing explanations of day to day life onsite, he was also very friendly and always on time!! All places visited during our short tour were amazing. We appreciate the flexibility when some plans needed to change and the additional services provided at last minute (thanks to Essalah for taking us to the stadium on a chaotic day!), you're a company we can count on! Don't hesitate to take Morocco Explored as your first option to travel through Morocco, you will not be disappointed! SHUKRAN!

Morocco Explored. We had a fabulous adventure exploring Morocco for 3 weeks, thanks to our wonderful drivers/guides and the terrific hospitality of the Moroccan people! Our first driver, Hicham, not only shared his knowledge of his Berber culture and customs with us, he also shared his terrific family and their hospitality with us! We enjoyed a delicious meal in his home, cooked by his mother and enjoyed with his mother and father, and two brothers. It was truly special and memorable! He also was the most careful, thoughtful driver I have ever experienced on a trip and that made us extremely comfortable, even on dangerous mountain roads and on very rough, off-road situations.Through the careful planning of the agency, we saw many varied sights throughout Morocco, from the beautiful sea port of Essaouria, to the desert landscapes and mountains of the central and southern part of the country to the fascinating, busy, colorful towns such as Fes, Marrakech and Chefchaouen (where most of the homes are painted a gorgeous blue color). I would totally recommend Morocco Explored and hope to make a repeat visit with them in the future!

highly recomend this fantastic day trip. Whilst on a recent 4 night stay with friends in Marrakesh,we went on a pre booked day trip well into the High Atlas mountains to Telouet and Ait Benhaddou and seeing some stunning scenery along the way, including crossing Tizi n Tichka pass. Although a very long day this is a must do trip and following our fantastic experience I would highly recommend Morocco Explored to take you. The initial booking and payment process is a bit unusual and you have to pay in Canadian dollars but don't be put off as the adventure will be amazing. We where collected from our Riad on time, in a very suitable 4x4 that was also very comfortable and by a very friendly, knowledgable and competent driver. Although it is a fixed route our driver Hicham stopped for us to take in the views and take photographs at every opportunity and to do so very often taking a short detour off road (including to a salt mine). And not forgetting the best bit, Ait Benhaddou, WOW !Just to conclude - A long but fantastic day, seeing some stunning scenery on a private and personal tour and on top of that great value for money. Shukran Hicham and Morocco Explored

Morocco Explored. We had a fabulous trip to Morocco thanks to a small private tour company called Morocco Explored. We are frequent travelers and appreciate value. Their driver Khalid picked us up at the airport in a late model Toyota Land Cruiser and was our devoted and charming driver for 12 days. The hotel selections were riads and other small culturally rich places. Most really wowed us. We included a camel ride and an overnight in the desert which we loved. The secret of Morocco Explored is a Canadian who understands what westerners want/need and runs a very responsive and easily navigated booking service who is linked up with a Moroccan manager who books the hotels and runs the logistics on the incountry end. Simple, efficient and personnal with loads of information and service. We felt that we got a lot for our money and were glad that we gave up trying to organize the trip for ourselves. Morocco Explored is a real find.

Fantastic Day Tour. My husband and I spent a full day with Hammou, our driver and guide, as we drove through the Atlas Mountains, visiting Tizi n’Tichka, Telouet, and Ait Benhaddou in Sept 2014. Hammou was on time to pick us up at our Riad and made us feel comfortable and safe right away. Hammou was knowledgeable, personable, helpful, and humorous! He kept us laughing all day and showed us some amazing sites. I am so glad I found this company and was lucky enough to spend a day with Hammou. Our day trip with Morocco Explored was the highlight of our trip to Morocco. Thank you, Hammou - We will remember our day with you forever!Nathon & Markie, Vancouver Island, Canada

Mountains and Sea. Our small group did 2 day trips with Morocco Explored - one to the mountains and one to Essaouira in 2 4x4's. The trips were perfect. The drivers spoke English, one better than the other but they were so accommodating and pleasant and nothing was too much trouble. As well as entertaining us with music in the vehicles they explained where we were driving, what we would be seeing or were seeing. The trips were booked and paid for before we left England so all we had to do was meet up with the drivers at our hotel. I would definitely recommend this company to anyone travelling to Morocco and wishing to explore more than their immediate surroundings.

Sahara Adventure!. We booked a 3 day/2 night trip from/to Marrakech and had an amazing time! We also spent one night in the Sahara desert, which was the highlight of our trip. The second highlight of our trip was having tea in the home of our guide, Khalid. Khalid's family opened up their home to me and my friends and it was amazing and so special. We loved it so much that we booked a day trip (which had not been planned previously) to Essouaria with Khalid. In my experience, the memories of travel are all about the people you meet and not about seeing sights. That being said, we had the opportunity to meet wonderful Moroccans with Khalid and Morocco Explored. We were four women traveling through the country and we always felt welcomed everywhere we went.

Amazing experience. One of my friends traveled with Morocco Explored for a new year's trip and she couldn't say enough good things about the tour, so when my best friend and I traveled to Morocco in September, it was an easy choice for us. We took the Marrakesh to Fez desert "rush" tour (in hindsight, i wish i had spent more time on the tour and in Morocco). The pre-trip communication was fast and professional, the itinerary was well spelled out and I also got a lot of travel tips in general. We had two drivers, Salah had to leave after the first day when Khalid took over. We were sad that Salah had to leave, but he passed on our travel preferences and our last minute customized plans seamlessly to Khalid, so we can continue enjoying our trip. Both drivers are friendly, helpful and knowledgeable. The best part about traveling with them is that they give you a lot of flexibility to explore and customize, just don't be afraid to ask: we have gone off-road, made frequent unplanned stops and tried various exciting and delicious local foods from local markets.The local guides and the riad they have arranged as part of the tours are all excellent, which really made our whole tour experience tremendous. Not to mention, after we were done with the desert tour and were dropped off in our riad in Fez, they still took an extra step and helped us arrange a guide in Fez. Overall, we felt well taken care of, to the point of being a little spoiled. With Morocco explored, the beautiful Morocco unveiled herself in front of our eyes like a magnificent painting. I would personally recommend the company to any of my friends and to any travelers out there who wants to explore Morocco right.

I highly recommend this company. I travelled solo to Morocco with the help of this company. Everything was arranged before hand so I knew what to expect. Emails and queries were promptly answered. The riads and auberges booked for me were terrific and just kept getting better as the trip progressed. I was on a 14 day tour and though I had requested certain "for sure" sights such as the overnight camel trip in the desert and a visit to Fes, the company arranged the itinerary. It was well organized, just when I needed a break, wow, 2 days in a beautiful riad, or a short stay at a beach. My drivers were very professional, courteous, friendly and I felt safe with them & their driving skills. The city guides arranged for me were also terrific and I learned a lot about Morocco during my visit.

4 day Desert Tour from Fes. We booked a 4 day trip from Fes to Marrakesh with Morocco Explored. This was the single best thing I did during my entire trip to Morocco. We saw many wonderful sites, rode camels out into the Sahara, camped under the stars, had tea with a local nomad family and really developed an good understanding of Berber culture.Our guide Khalid was awesome! I can't say enough good things about him - he was a great driver, very knowledgeable about the history/culture/food of the region, had a great sense of humor and is probably the most patient person I've met in a very long time. He answered our many questions without complaint (even when a few complaints were probably deserved!). He was also very flexible with the itinerary. He accommodated our requests when we wanted to spend more or less time in an area. He also took us to "extra" sites when we expressed interest in something - sometimes, this meant we stopped 3 times in one day to look at goats and sheep on the side of a mountain. Other times, this meant taking us to multiple nomad caves to explore and better understand the Berber way of life. We were definitely never bored!The accommodations provided were all good quality with good service. We had free Wi-fi in all hotels, but in some places, it only worked in the lobby/restaurant/pool area and not in the rooms. I was particularly impressed with the quality of the camp in the Sahara. The tents were large and comfortable. The food provided was delicious and the entertainment was...well, entertaining. And sleeping under the stars was awe-inspiring.I highly recommend the 4 or 5 day tour. The Mid- and High-Atlas region is beautiful and you'll want to take your time to explore it and take everything in. And seriously, request Khalid as your guide! :-)

4-day Trip from Marrakech & Desert Tour. We booked a 4 day trip from Marrakech with a desert tour with morocco explored in July 2014, it was a fantastic trip that I would highly recommend. Our guide Khallid was excellent, really knowledgeable on the whole region, the history, the food and he had some great berber music playing in the 4x4 that set the scene perfectly for the amazing scenery that just kept coming. Like other people have mentioned, try to spend less time in marrakech and more time in the high atlas region, it is such a beautiful place. Mat & Sevgi

Fantastic Morocco Explored!. We took a 10 day tour with Morocco Explored in November 2013. We wanted to maximize what we saw in Morocco, but could not find a tour that matched our dates. Morocco Explored (Robbin) listened to what we wanted to do/see and provided recommendations allowing us to customize a tour based on what we wanted. We needed a vacation after the vacation, but could not have been happier with this wonderful company. We had a couple of drivers during our trip, (Saleh, and Hammoud), both of whom were very professional. With this tour, we did not have to worry about anything. From the moment we landed, we were taken care of until we were dropped back at the airport. Hotels, riads, local guides were all taken care of for us, and the price was very reasonable. Our biggest goal with our trip was to experience as much as possible in a very short time, and our drivers were incredible interested in ensuring we had a great time and showed us as much of the beautiful country as they could. The car was extremely spacious and comfortable, the quality of the accommodations was outstanding, but our favorite part of the trip was getting to experience the local flare like drinking camels milk, eating lunch at the local places, and experiencing a Sunday market. Hammoud truly went out of his way to ensure we had the best customized vacation and thought us a lot about the culture and history of Morocco.Our trip started in Casablanca , went to Marrakesh, Essaouira, Ait Benhaddou, Tinehir, Sahara, Fes and ended back in Casablanca With a lot of stops and visits along the way.

Day Tour to Ait Benhaddou. I booked a day trip with Morocco Explored to go to Telouet and Ait Ben Haddou. We had a great driver, his english was excellent and a good depth of knowledge of the area and the local politics as well. Our first stop was Telouet and we had this place to ourselves. Then onto Ait, our driver organised a guide for us and he picked a well spoken young Berber, although it was about 40c we had a great time as the guide not only had a good depth of knowledge but a great sense of humour. It was a big day made very memorable. Our sincere thanks to Robbin for organizing it all.The only other thing I would like to mention is the cost. I found the price of the day tour to be fantastic value for money

Competent, thoughtful, insightful tour company. My husband and I would like to thank Morocco Explored for our wonderful experience. Salah, the site manager in Marrakesh, and Morocco Explored did an excellent job, putting together a travel itinerary that met our needs and assured us a good experience. It all went smoothly, and we felt in good hands, appreciating a new and different culture. The camel trek was, of course, amazing, and has been the highlight of our adventure. Our whole trip was enhanced by the positive experiences we had with our driver, Khalid. Morocco Explored is fortunate indeed to have him in its employ as he is an excellent driver, always competent and safe on the road and that includes our time "off-road!" Most of all, he is such a fine young man who patiently and kindly answered all my continuous questions. He and I had many an enlightening conversation about our different cultures and countries. He was not just our driver, but our key source of information to understand Morocco, everything from geography to botany and from history to philosophy. He is a terrific guy, and it added immeasurably to our experience to have gotten to know him. Thank you once again, Salah, for introducing us to your wonderful country, and thank you, Khalid, for making our experience so memorable. I recommend Morocco Explored wholeheartedly.

excellent trip. I was fortunate enough to join a group of two for a 5 day desert trip. Khalid was our driver. He was a safe driver who shared his culture with us throughout the wonderful trip. We added an additional day in the desert because we were having such a wonderful time, and he was happy to accommodate our change in plans. It was obvious that he loved his job and loved sharing various facts about Morocco. He answered our endless questions about Moroccan culture, religion, and everything in between. He had a great sense of humor which was an added bonus. Essalah, the owner, was also very easy to work with. He met me in my Riad lobby to start the trip and take me to the awaiting car. I would highly recommend Morocco Explored to anyone and will use them again. I am sure the driver could make or break the trio...so ask for Khalid...he definitely aimed to please--and he did!

Good trip, bad driver. We have just returned from 8 days in Morocco. I arranged all the hotels and airfare and Morocco Explored arranged the desert trip and provided a driver/guide. Robbin was helpful scoping out the trip. The problem was our driver, Ibrihim. On the plus side, Ibrihim was on time each day and knew the country well. He drove carefully, though usually 10 km less than the speed limit which added hours to long day trips. On the negative side, Ibrihim did not speak English well. This lead to much frustration, on his part and ours. He also seemed to have his own idea of what our trip should be like. On the first day in the High Atlas Mountains, Ibrihim kept wanting us to stop to take pictures. When we said we didn't need to, he seemed offended. At 10:30am he pulled over to a mountain restaurant and said we should take pictures. When we said again we didn't need to, he said, 'well I need to stop for breakfast'. As a guide, Ibrihim had no knowledge of the history of Morocco. He didn't know that November 16th was Moroccan independence day. Imagine someone in the US not knowing what July 4th was. His tour guiding comments consisted of such things as 'king has palace here' in Erfoud (he said this twice, once the first time we went through Erfoud and once the second time) and 'bus station' when we passed a bus station. In the end, he pretty much stopped talking to us. When, on the last day, I said we wanted to go to Casablanca (a stop that was on our itinerary) to see the mosque, he became upset. Either he had not been informed about the stop or he just didn't want to drive into the city (traffic is horrible). I think the biggest incident in the trip was when we stopped in a small village so my daughter and I could get some bananas and apples to eat in the car. Nearly everyone in Morocco wants to take advantage of foreigners. When I asked Ibrihim to help me deal with the fruit vendor so I wasn't overcharged (I had no change), he just walked away and laughed in my face, saying, 'everyone charged the same price'. Which of course is a lie.

Sensational trip. I first met Essallah and his team when I travelled to Morocco several years ago. Essallah is now a good friend and recently gave me some very valuable advice and assistance on my latest trip cycling around Morocco. They are not only a company but generous and genuine people who really want to help people, promote their beautiful country and make sure your experience there is the best it can be.The first time I went I didn't go with the intention of taking a tour, and organised it last minute when I arrived and heard about Morocco Explored. It was one of the best tours I've ever been on. I went as a single woman alone, and actually was on the tour alone, and felt very safe and looked after the entire time. I've travelled the world a lot and for me, the scenery in Morocco, particular the areas south east of Marrakech, are absolutely spectacular. The landscape changes very frequently and the colours and natural beauty, along with the local development that blends perfectly with nature, are truly stunning. Sometimes I could not believe my eyes as to what I was seeing. And, being solo on the tour allowed me to change to some extent the journey along the way and take up different recommendations as we went, and I ended up actually extending my trip by a couple of days because it was so fabulous. Having a driver to explain the culture, the history, the food etc was very valuable and they were all very knowledgeable, and made it all very humane and real. The accommodation was always of good quality and the place I stayed in the Sahara Dessert was beautiful, and the breakfast amazing. Sleeping in the dunes in the Sahara Desert is wonderful. These tours are extremely good value - and this is coming from someone who usually sleeps in $5 dorms - and truly I'm not sure you can actually put a value on the experience because it's priceless. One thing I greatly appreciated is that Essallah and his team are very open to feedback along the way and ready to modify things as much as possible as needed, as they recognise that everyone's needs and expectations are different, and want all the people that travel with them to walk away with the best experience possible of their country, and their company.I highly recommend this company to anyone thinking about going to Morrocco, and I thank Essallah and his team not only for the trip they took me on, but their assistance with my recent cycling trip and the valuable advice given. Thank you.

Great 18 days in Morocco. My family of three took a tour of Morocco using Morocco Explored in January 2014. We were so pleased to have used this company. From the start Robbin, the owner, was very helpful in ensuring that the trip suited our purposes. We were staying an extra three days in the country and thought that we would like to make the most of our time there by seeing as much as we could. This was no problem as Robbin added Chefchaouen to the last few days of our trip. We were really pleased that we finished the tour in this beautiful little town.We were travelling with our 20 year old son and we didn't really wish to pay for an extra room for him. This also proved to be of no trouble to Robbin, or all of the Riads/ Kasbahs where we stayed, as he either had his own bed, or a trundle bed provided.When we met the representative Salah on our first day, he tweaked the journey even more to ensure that we saw as much as possible. Hammoud our driver/guide in the car, was informative and knowledgable on all aspects of Morocco. Our guides around Marrakech, Fez and Tenerhir were courteous and knew their subjects too. Maybe, the only thing I could recommend to Morocco Explored was to have these guides ask whether the clients would like to buy carpets, pottery et cetera before being taken into the mandatory shops, because once you are in there, it is very hard not to buy something. To have a car meant that we were able to be taken off the main tourist routes and we got to see some absolutely beautiful scenery and get to try a few things that I would expect the average tourist taking a large bus trip, would not otherwise get to see, or do. I think the favourite thing that our family enjoyed (apart from the whole journey) was having a bbq on top of the Atlas Mountains with the mountains spread before us and the beautiful clean air surrounding us.The only down side of the trip was that our initial driver was sick. On our first day we were taken to Essaouira by Salah and had a great day. When we were then picked up by the next driver, who had very little English as did the next driver. Luckily my school girl French and our son's Spanish got us by for those days, but it didn't help that they couldn't communicate when and where we were to be picked up by the next driver and at what time. This led to some confusion for all involved. This was only a minor thing and really didn't detract from the overall experience. It made for a great tale back home and really made my French improve!Overall, our experience was a fantastic one and we were so glad to put our trust in to Robbin's and Hammoud's very capable hands. It is always a worry when dealing with unfamiliar companies, but we can thoroughly recommend the integrity and help that Morocco Explored gave.

Day trip to the High Atlas mountains. We had an excellent day trip with our driver/guide Essalah taking us to the High Atlas mountains.Our driver gave us much information about the region and drove safely and with care in a good 4 wheel drive car. He was always friendly and responsive.He was aware of our needs and expectations and fulfilled all of them.The trip was planned so that we had adequate time to see the region. The place we stopped for lunch had very good food and at reasonable prices.We felt lucky to get such a good english speaking guide as we booked at the last minute by calling the office in Marrakech. We found the price fairWe highly recommend this company

Round trip from Casablanca to Casablanca. On 19 April we commenced our 14 day adventure through Morocco, there were 5 in pur party. Robin was very informative and helpful in preparing our trip. We had nights in Meknes, Fes (2) Tinehir, Hotel Jasmina in the desert and a night in the desert camp which was the true highlight at the foot of the huge sandhills in nomad tents and we ate the best targine we have had there and were entertained by our Berber friends and slept under the brightest stars. The camel ride to get to the camp was an adventure in itself! Hammou our driver was fantastic and took us looking for nomads during the day and we were lucky to be invited into their tents for mint tea. Back on the road to Marrakech, we visited the Todra Gorge, Dades And Rose Valleys and did some amazing off road driving, we stayed at Ait Ben Hadou and explored the great Kasbah then onto the exciting and chaotic Marrakech for 3 nights. We thentravelled to Essourira on the coast for 2 nights. The old town is charming and a lot less chaotic than Marrakech and also for purchases a lot less expensive, so save your shopping for here! Our last day and night we where back in Marrakech a place which you could never forget. All of or 4 nights here we ate with the locals in the Jemaa el Fna and the food delicious. You can also buy large vlasses of freshly squeezed orange juice here for about 4 dirhams. Hammou was with us all the way from Fes and was a great driver and wonderful guide giving us so much information about the country and its . Also every riad/hotel was unique in its own way and most the locations were right in the centre of the old towns. We were very well looked after and would highly recommend Morocco Explored to anyone wishing a true adventure in Morocco. Thank you again Robbin, Hammou and Essalah in Marakech.

Fantastic 6 day tour. We had an amazing week in Morocco with Morocco Explored. Robbin was very helpful in tailoring a tour to our needs. The team in Marrakech made sure we were very well looked after from the moment we arrived at the airport until the end of the week.Full marks - A big thanks Robbin, Salah and Driss.

Once in a Lifetime Experience. Morocco Explored was recommended by friends who had used them a few years back. It was wonderful to be guided by Hammou, a very knowledgable person on every aspect of Moroccan and Berber culture. Two highlights of our 4 day 3 night trek were having tea in a nomad Berber family's cave home and our camel ride through the desert. The best part of the desert trek was sleeping under the stars in the sand dunes if the Moroccan desert. Our guide for this part of the trip was Sayeed, a very jovial person who made us laugh a lot. Morocco Explored is the way to go if you are interested in an authentic Morocco. Our driver, Hammou, is a very easy-going person who is willing to accommodate any request. We were sad to leave him! When Hammou heard that we were interested in fossils, he took us to a museum and shop where they display amazing giant fossils from every period. Then he took us to a spot in the black desert where we could search among the rocks for our own fossils - and we found a bunch! We started our trip to Morocco with this tour and then finished with 3 relaxing days in Marrakech. So glad we planned it this way. **One caveat - if you upgrade to the 4 star riad for one of your nights, dinner is no longer included for that night. This was not clear to us from our email correspondence.

Morocco. Morocco Explored put together a fantastic itinerary for us. Every day was wonderful. A special note of thanks goes to their drivers Abdul and Hammou - they were both amazing and taught us much about the people and the land. Thanks for everything!
An amazing day trip with the most beautiful views.. Best part of our trip to Morocco. No trip would be complete without adding one of these great day trips outside the city. Beautiful!

Exceptional in every way. We spent one week in Morocco. Morocco Explored suggested a possible itinerary which we booked. We spent our first night in Marrakech and then spent the next two nights traveling to the Sahara making stops along the way and sleeping in the desert for one night. We knew it would be a lot of driving but it was well worth it. Our driver Hassan was knowledgable, accommodating, his English was impeccable and most of all his driving exceptional. The trip back to Marrakech was long and the roads winding and narrow and I never once felt afraid (this was so important for me because I can be very nervous). All details of our trip were arranged by Morocco Explored which made the traveling effortless. I could not imagine doing this trip any other way!!

Great day excursion. We had an excellent day excursion with Morocco Explored in January. Our driver/guide was Salah. We travelled south of Marakkesh covering areas such as Ouirgane, Imlil, Asni, Ourika Valley, Setti Fatima. First great thing was that there was a flexibility to propose where exactly we want to go and to discuss it with Salah, who also provided with great ideas. For us that we are a family with two small children of 3 and 7 this was essential. This particularity was taken into account by Salah, who proved to be an excellent company and guide. A nice open-minded person, very friendly, more than great with the kids: highly recommended! Salah proposed also nice places for eating and having coffee, without imposing his proposals, being at the same time discreet and kind. In that way we had the chance to take a flavour of the country in a relaxing way but also covering most of the places that we wanted to visit in one day. Thank you and have a nice year. Bona, Lambis, Nikolas, Ion

Great tour!. We traveled to Morocco for two weeks in December 2013. We spent a week on our own, and then booked a 5 day/4 night tour with Morocco explored that took us from Fes to Marrakech, and landed us in the desert for New Year's Eve. Overall it was a great experience. It was nice to be on a tour that was still flexible, but made it easy for us to navigate the country. We really liked both of our drivers Abdul and Hammou. Hammou, who we were with for three days, was especially helpful and gave us great information along the way about Morocco history and culture. There was not a question he didnt have an answer for! He even showed up one day with a fishing poll because my boyfriend is an avid fisherman. While we never really found a good place to fish, we really appreciated his effort. The places we stayed were decent and what we expected. We really loved the desert camel trek on New Year's Eve. The trip is also flexible and they accommodated our every request, even changing our accommodations one night at the last minute to make our new schedule work. Our group did not like the touristy spots, so Hammou took us to many local villages, a nomad family and local food places. We were paired with another couple from Canada who had similar interests which really added to the fun. I appreciate all of Robbin's help in making a memorable time for us in Morocco.

Superior service. We just returned from our 3 week trip with Morocco explored. Their expertise in coordinating everything flawlessly made this the trip of a lifetime. Robbin did an amazing job with our pretrip questions, Essalah became a great friend (and dune buggie driver) and Hammou was super knowledgable. We appreciated the flexibility with optional stops for our longer driving days. Some days we just wanted to sleep in the car and others we wanted to explore the towns we were driving through. Morocco explored offers off the beaten path adventures where you get to interact with locals. We will never forget our time spent in a cave home having tea with a nomad family. From the hustle and bustle of the Marrakech markets, a night spent in the Sahara dunes to our relaxing time in Essouira this was a trip of a lifetime. Thank you Morocco Explored! <3 Jen, Jess, Brittany, Cody and Jeremy

Morocco Explored - Extended Tour. We travelled to Morocco August/September 2013 for an extended tour all across the country. A truly amazing holiday. So many special memories of an interesting country, and to a greater extent our tour guide/driver, Salah, who made the trip. It is as simple as that. We were shown the country from the perspective of a native, and that is something you cannot get doing it alone. One criticism: We had a different driver for a couple of days, and he wasn't of the same quality in terms of being a tour guide. If we had travelled with the second driver for the whole trip, it would have been a very different experience. The first had a real passion for his job and for Morocco, and that made it a very special trip. However, if people have the same experience my family did, I would wholeheartedly recommend it!

excellent day trip!. I took a private tour through to ait benhaddou and to a berber villange in the atlas mountains. I travelled solo. I travelled in the 4WD. The driver was on time, the 4WD was clean and modern. The drive is quite long, however driving through the mountains is quite rewarding. Beautiful mountains! Worth the trip! The driver was nice and pleasant. However when I got to ait benhaddou, there was a local tour guide that guided me into ait benhaddou, and to the top. He wasn't the best tour guide (he spoke to me in spanish, english, french... not sure why). If I knew I had the option to decline the tour guide, I would have, and just walked up there myself, by following the crowd. H charged me about $11USD for the tour. I would not recomend the tour guide at ait benhaddou. However this is not a bad reflection on morocco explored. they did an excellent job. Just make sure you budget for the tour guide, or mention to the driver you prefer to walk in ait benhaddou without a guide. The driver is not allowed to take you on a tour through ait benhaddou. Apart from that, everything else was fine! well worth it!

Morocco, the friendly way. We have a preference for independent travel, but, with our lack of time - or, I have to admit, inclination - to research the intricacies of finding our own way around marvellous Morocco, we found Saleh, Hammou and the Morocco Explored team perfect for our needs on a private tour. Having flexibility in the itinerary and being able to stop for meals, photo stops etc. whenever it suited was quite a luxury that came at a price comparable to group tours we had researched. A really friendly group to deal with and if we were ever to travel to Morocco again, I couldn't imagine travelling with anyone else.

Great way to explore Morocco. Great service, fabulous/friendly/knowledgeable team, safe/comfortable and efficient transport – that’s what Morocco Explored consistently delivers. We can highly recommend.

Great tour operators. We used Morocco Explored for our Morocco Tour. Their price was comparable to the usual small group tour - for a private tour we adapted to our needs.The driver was excellent and spoke good english, although a few times there was a little misunderstanding. He was happy to talk about general Morocco life and history, although the company was clear that he was a driver, not an official guide.Pre tour info was excellent, and itinerary planning was flexible to meet our needs.The offical guides were very good, with excellent knowledge about their city and it's history.We would recommend Morocco Explored to anyone wanting to tour Morocco with support, but without the need to travel in a mini-bus on a pre-programmed tour.

Book this tour and ask for Hammou!. We booked a ten day tour from Marrakech into the mountains and desert and back. It was amazing. We asked for the two/three star level and we're not disappointed. You spend so little time in each room that it was perfect for us. All of the riads or Kasbahs we stayed in (except for the one in Marrakech which was noisy and not so great although we were moved to a truly fabulous one the second night) were quirky and lovely and in many we were the only guests! We have to say that what made the tour for us was Hammou. What an amazingly clever, kind, intuitive man. He was so knowledgeable about the flora and fauna, about the history and knew really interesting small wonderful places to take us with people he knew such as a private show at a music school or drinking camel milk in a large stable or having a private tour of a stonemason yard which was actually closed for day. Going with him to tour a market in a small town was amazing as there were no other tourists there. It would not have been the same without him and he had the patience of a saint to answer all questions we had about the culture, religion and politics of Morocco. The desert camel ride and camp was exquisite and made more special by the fact that there were only four of us. The communication and organisation of the tour company was good and the pre tour pack was so useful. We enquired about this tour because of the great reviews and then having received quotes from various companies, picked it because it was great value. We really really recommend it - just ask for Hammou!

Morocco Explored. “We traveled through the Atlas mountain, Sahara Desert and ancient Moroccan cities with Morocco Explored. Our guide/driver, Salah, provided a unique perspective of the history, social context and cultural dynamics of this ever-evolving country. The highlight was the overnight camel trek from Merzouga where we watched the sunrise from the top of a sand dune. I would recommend this company for any/all transport/tour needs in Morocco.”

Highlight of our Moroccan Adventure. Three friends and I decided to use Morocco Explored for the Desert Trek. It was extraordinary. The trek in the desert was beautiful and fun. Furthermore, we had the desert camp all to ourselves. The food was extraordinary. Our guides were funny, smart, patient, and kind. After dinner, we played the drums with our Berber guides before resigning for the evening in surprisingly comfortable tents. The bathrooms shocked me. I honestly felt as though I had stepped into a regular bathroom while I was in the middle of the desert. The trip was well worth the price. I would recommend it to anyone who wants to have a fun, comfortable, exciting experience in the Sahara.

Fantastic Experience. We have recently returned from the most wonderful 16 day tour with Morocco Explored, and would recommend it to anyone wanting to see the real Morocco (as indeed I already have to a number of friends!). We wanted to understand more of the Moroccan culture, see the mountains, desert, and the major cultural sites and cities; to go somewhere that our university student sons would enjoy, and it did all this and more. Essalah, our driver, and one of the managers in the company was simply marvelous - spoke excellent English, gave us a tremendous amount of information about the culture and country. He paid great attention to detail, smoothing the way throughout the trip, and even arranging an unexpected upgrade in our final riad at the end of the trip (and rearranged transfer day to allow us an extra day in Essaouira). His driving was excellent, smooth, and 1 of our sons who usually doesn't travel well had no problems throughout he trip. We were all very comfortable throughout the tour in his air conditioned Toyota Landcruiser Prado.The tour was put together by Morocco Explored, but we were asked both before arrival and during the tour whether we wanted to make any changes. The company was very flexible. All the Riads were very comfortable, air-conditioned, many with pools, beautifully decorated but very individual - not the "glitzy" tourist hotels - very much the "real" Morocco that we wanted to see.The company arranged English speaking guides in a number of places including Marrakech, Fes and Merzouga, all of whom were excellent. I now just want to go back!! Well done Morocco Explored

Fantastic Experience. My sister and I opted for this tour as a middle ground between the security and hassle-free experience of a package tour, and an immersion, hands on experience; this mostly because we were travelling as two young women and were uncertain of the reception, but we also wanted to feel as though we were doing our own thing. The result was perfect! We chose Morocco Explored because of their wealth of information on the site, their quick and informative communication and their flexibility in tours. Our driver (Hammou) was great, speaking good English, great source of information and being very flexible and suggesting amendments to our tour itinerary as he got to know us better. Great value for money, and great way to see Morocco - an amazing country. Would recommend this company and experience 100% and without a hesitation!

Unbelievable Desert Trek.... We did the 3D/2N Desert Trek starting and ending in Marrakesh. Amazing trip...Our drive Hassan spoke great English and was attentive to our needs. He drove a 4x4 Land Cruiser with air conditioning which was quite comfortable for the two of us.High Atlas Mountains were gorgeous, as was most of the landscape along the journey. Stopping off at Ait Binhaddu where many films and TV (including Game of Thrones) were filmed was very cool. Nothing was as cool as the actual camel trek across the dunes and sleeping outside under the stars in the camp.Wonderful trip, would recommend to anybody. Hassan picked us up and dropped us off at La Mamounia in Marrakesh where we were staying before and after the trek.

Very Scenic!. Our guide was Salah, and he was a great guide in many ways. We chose the 4 days/3 nights package. From the start he catered to whatever type of road trip we wanted, acknowledging that different clients had different preferences. My brother and I didn't want a very touristy trip. We wanted to see what the locals enjoyed, yet still hit the big sites. He was definitely able to give us that experience. I think the two major surprises for me were the yummy foods we got to try (we would have never known about some dishes if it wasn't for our guide), and secondly, the most amazing scenery we got to experience! I generally do not enjoy road trips, and these 4 days went by so fast. Each day, got better than the prior in regards to what we saw. Just when I thought I saw something so beautiful, the next day would beat it out in some shape or form! Thank you Salah and thank you Morocco Explored for creating such great memories for my brother and I!

Best tour ever!. My husband and I took a trip to Morocco through morocco explored in June 2013. After researching multiple companies we decided to book our tour with this company. We booked a private tour with them and it was the best decision we ever made!!! We had the trip of a lifetime and it was a great journey. Extremely good price for what you are getting.Robin was our contact person before the trip and she was very helpful and planned the perfect itinerary according to the number of days we travelled and according to our budget. Every single detail was taken care of but we had the liberty to choose what we were interested in and what we wanted to spend our time in while making the most of our time.Our diver, Hammou, was absolutely amazing and a very special human being. Our trip would not have been the same with out him. He took us to really unique places and we felt we were able to see parts of the country and understand the culture in a very special way because of him. I very rarely write reviews after my trips but this company deserves every recommendation. You will not regret booking with them, they are truly excellent. Thank you so much for making our trip so special and unforgettable!

Cascades Ouzoud. My sister and I researched various day trips from Marrakech as part of a birthday trip we arranged for our Mum. We eventually chose Cascades Ouzoud with Morocco Explored and had a really great day. Whilst it was a long drive to the Falls, they were absolutely worth it and more spectacular than we had imagined. We hired a local guide once we got there (not included in the price) and he was excellent and allowed us to make the most of the trip, we would definitely recommend getting a guide to take you round. It is also possible to take a short boat trip right up to the bottom of the Cascades and we really enjoyed this but again costs extra, although only a few pounds. We would definitely recommend this trip, it was lovely to enjoy the landscape of Morocco outside the bustle of Marrakech!

three legs of a wonderful trip. My husband, our two adult daughters and I spent three weeks in Morocco in April. Some of that time was independent travel, but because one of our daughters could only spend 10 days with us, I decided to hire a car and driver for a five-day portion, from Fes to Marrakech. Being four also made the cost per person very reasonable. I chose Morocco Explored in part because, like me, the co-owner Robbin lives in Canada, so I could easily talk to her by phone; moreover, paying by interbank transfer was very easy and secure. Morocco Explored also offered an itinerary which included a night in the desert and a second night in a hotel beside the dunes. We didn't want to feel rushed on our first trip to a desert so this itinerary suited us. Our driver, Hammou, was excellent and very willing to explain the things we were seeing on the way. He obviously had done this trip many times before and knew the places to stop to take good pictures, to eat local food safely, to taste camel's milk and, importantly, to find clean washrooms. He was very attentive and always seemed to reappear just when we were ready to leave a spot. We never felt rushed and we never stopped at anything that felt like a tourist trap. Our camel ride into the desert with Ali was wonderful. We were the only four at the camp that night and it was magical. The riads and hotels we stayed at were all very comfortable and had great atmosphere. We always felt we were in Morocco, not the Holiday Inn. Breakfasts and suppers were included and we rated them good to excellent. After the one daughter had returned to Canada, the other three of us spent a few days in Marrakech on our own before leaving for another four-day tour with Morocco Explored. We went from Marrakech back south over the High Atlas to Taroudant, Tafraoute and finally Essaouira for a few days on the coast. Some people had told us that car rental was an option for this part of the trip, but none of us was willing to miss the scenery going over the mountain passes. This road requires constant vigilance and a driver experienced in the Moroccan driving customs. Rachid was our driver for these four days during which we discovered a much less visited part of the country. We stopped at places we certainly would have missed on our own. A highlight was a visit to a collective granary/fort at Imchguiguilne that dates from the 13th century. A truly spectacular site that we never could have seen if we had been on public transport. Morocco Explored booked the hotels (including a former pasha's rural auberge among citrus orchards) and suggested possible activities, but we could set the pace as we chose and it was relaxed. It included a bicycle ride through the countryside around Tafraoute. (I think this may not have been so pleasant in the summer months, but April was perfect.) All the cars we travelled in were comfortable and well maintained. We were so happy with Morocco Explored's services that we booked a transfer by car from Marrakech to the Casablanca airport on the morning of our departure from Morocco. Usually I'm nervous about being far from the airport on departure day, but we had confidence that our driver, Essalah, would get us there on time. This is a 2 1/2 hour drive on very good roads, much preferable to transferring our luggage from taxi to train to Casablanca to another train to the airport, hoping all the time that train service would not be interrupted or delayed. Thank you to everyone at Morocco Explored for making this trip go so smoothly. We could just sit back, relax and know that we were in excellent hands.

Through the Atlas Mountains from Marrakech and beyond.. We were extremely fortunate in booking our trips throughout Morocco with the exceptional "Morocco Explored" who provided great service and value for money. This tour organisation excels at a personal and detailed approach to ensuring that your travel experiences proceed flawlessly and that your tailor made tours are the best Morocco has to offer. We had excellent attention from our highly knowledgeable, friendly and very caring drivers who ensured we saw magnificent scenery, enjoyed remarkable experiences and ate delicious food. The tours and excursions with our professional guides of an essential and captivating Morocco, such as Ait Benhaddou the labyrinthian souk in Fes and the exotic kasbah in Telouet were amazing experiences in themselves. However, I think that coming across places such as the roadside market en route to Quarzazate, the donkey market near Rissani, our time spent in the desert with our amiable camel driver and eating at the roadside stalls were pure magic. We were not always just funnelled into "tourist ready" eateries but on some occasions ate at roadside cafes from a simple stall serving tangine or a bbq. Many thanks are due to the wonderful staff including Salah, Hussein and Hammou (and others!) who, with their local knowledge, made the very best of our travel experiences in this alluring country, amongst some of the warmest and interesting people I've ever met.

Making Morocco Magical. A friend and myself looked into a few different tour operators for a journey from Fes to Marrakech, and Morocco Explored came recommended by colleagues. It was a recommendation we were glad we took.From the start, the pre-trip communication was prompt and thorough. We even received a detailed information pack not only about our tour but tips about traveling in Morocco that we referred to often and found very helpful. Our driver, Salah was perfect! We couldn't have asked for a better person to help us discover this beautiful country. He was friendly, professional and had an excellent command of English. Salah made sure our journey was enjoyable and seamless and while we had an itinerary, he adapted for our pace and interests. Having a local person to accompany us through our adventure and give local insight was such an enriching experience. It really helped us to see a Morocco we might not have experienced on our own, and it was magical.
