We also made him aware that we were sick of eating tagine, and he made sure that our next stop had some other options (specifically, a place where we ordered lamb meat by the kilo, and ate it fresh off the grill).

Marrakesh to Erg Chebbi. My solo 2 night 3 day tour from Marrakech to Erg Chebbi was the best voyage I've ever taken, mostly due to the superlative friendliness of my guide Abdellah. Over three days we shared many stories and many of the magnificent views over Morocco. Abdellah had a strong command of the road and I felt secure in his driving. He was also very accommodating, always willing to stop by the side of the road for me to check something out (note that I was on a private tour) or to buy ice-cream at a shop. The hotels and restaurants that we went to were clean, comfortable and catered to my vegetarianism. Finally, Erg Chebbi is by itself would have been worth the entire voyage to Morocco, even if I saw nothing else. I cannot have been more satisfied with my journey. I learned more from Abdellah than any other guide that I have encountered, and hope to get to go on another tour of Morocco soon.

Review of Authentic tours Marrakech . My Husband and I did a 4-day Marrakech To Erg Chebbi tour. It was simply perfect. Our guide, Abdullah, is the best guide I've ever encountered. He is not only knowledgeable (about everything from culture to politics to geography, you name it!), he shares information with us with so much passion and positivity. As a driver, I felt safe all the time in his car, even though there are roads and situations which can get messy (lots of one way roads with pedestrians and bikes and windy mountain roads). He also makes sure that we are comfortable, plan the day at our pace and is basically a joy to travel with.My favourite part of the tour was the night out in the dessert. Having lived in a city my whole life, that was my first camel ride and first time seeing a dessert. The food served in the dessert camp was crazy good! The entertainment also went on well late into the night. We slept outdoors under the stars and it was amazing. An experience I would remember for life.All in all, couldn't ask for a better tour operator (who was very accommodating and responsive) or a better guide.

Erg Chigaga Tour...couldn't have asked for anything more!. My wife and I were very much looking forward to our 3 day/ 2 night tour from Marrakech to the Erg Chigaga, and this trip, with this company did not disappoint. Mohammed Fadil, our 4x4 driver, was absolutely amazing. He loved showing off the beauty of Morocco and filling us in on the wonderful history, geography, and flavor of his country. Let me break the trip down for you: A) It takes a long time to get there from Marrakech. Within the trip are little built in stops for food and recreation. Now, I guess we should have seen this coming but we didn't. Of course the restaurants were tourist traps, and the sights were places that all of the travel companies had deals with, but all in all they were very nice. We especially liked the small berber collective town where the famous green colored pottery and tile was made. In the end, it was a bit off-putting at first to be "shown" where to eat or what sights to see, but ultimately it is your choice to actually partake in these places. By the end of our journey we simply told Mohammed that we preferred not to stop and that was okay as well. B) The dunes and the desert camp were fantastic. We wished we could have stayed there a few more nights. The dinner and breakfast provided at the camp was more that adequate (beware, there is no water provided, bring LOTS), and the workers even woke us up at the crack of dawn (initially it sucked, but in the end totally worth it) so you can watch the sun rise over the dunes. C) Riding the camels was great, really great, but only lasted for about 70-90 minutes. Again, totally worth it, just know that going in. This whole experience from the company's customer service (we corresponded over many emails), to our driver Mohammed, the excursions, the camping tents, the camels themselves, the food, and the entirety of the scenery was just splendid. We definitely recommend this company and this tour.

Three day desert tour. Our trip through the desert was amazing. Everything was booked ahead of time (via authentic tours Marrakech) and went smoothly. Our driver (Mohamed JP, driver) picked us up from our riad in Fez, took us to the desert, and dropped us off in Marakesh. He was very nice and accommodating - he enjoyed taking pictures of us and with us. Mohamed made the long drive to Merzouga very enjoyable (berber culture & history & politics) and landmarks. He was a very safe driver and the 4runner was clean inside, and knowledgeable with Berber culture (we made an unexpectant stop for roadside couscous by Berber ladies). I would definitely request him as a driver if I were to use them again.

Erg Chebbi Tour. Mohammed Fadli was the best tour guide we ever had. Our original plan was to go to the Zagora Desert for a day, unfortunately due to weather conditions the road to Zagora was blocked. Instead of cancelling the tour, Mohammed was very resourceful in finding other options to make the tour happen for us. We ended up going to the Erg Chebbi desert for 3days instead and was life changing. In those 3 days we got to know Mohammed more personally. Not only did we get to know how generous and genuine he is, but we also learned the brbrs and moroccan culture from him. He ended up becoming like family to us and I could not thank him enough for this unforgettable experience in Morocco. We wish him the best from the bottom of our hearts.

Desert trip and Essaouira trip. We took an overnight trip to the Zagora desert with this company. We liked them so much that we used them for the day trip to Essaouira. They were excellent. Arrived promptly to pick us up. Our guide, Abdullah was fantastic. He spoke excellent English and knew history and culture of Morocco. At the desert camp, the guides and staff were very good. The place was clean and the food was good. They woke us up in the morning to make sure that we did not miss the sunrise (beautiful). Highly recommend this company.

Great time in Morocco with our guide Omar!. My friends and I enjoyed our 3-day tour from Marrakech to Fez with our tour guide Omar. The tour was arranged well, interesting and not intensive. Omar is an awesome guide: brilliant, patient and dedicated. Everything was well organized so that you don't need to bother yourself with anything. Just enjoy the trip. It was a good chance to expose yourself to local people and authentic Morocco culture. This was an unforgettable experience that one can not miss!!!

Mohamed JP and infinite morroco #1. Just wanted to let you know personally how wonderful our trip was. That in LARGE part because of Mohamed. He was wonderful. He made my dad and I feel like family not just a client. I was expecting to just go ride a camel and sleep in the desert but it was so much more. It took to places not for tourists...like having tea or a meal with friends. We will truly remember this trip forever. I hope to bring my husband and children back someday. Paula

Great tour of the Zagora desert. This was such a great experience. Firstly, our guide was fantastic. Mohamed JP helped us out in the morning after some difficultly with our Riad. He was informative throughout the day and his driving was superb, always felt safe. He didn't rush us and allowed us to dictate what we wanted to see. He set us up with a local for a tour of the Ait Ben Haddou Casbah, who was brilliant, showed us round his own home and was really appreciative of the tip we gave.Considering the drive is about 7 hours or so, it was really nice that Mohamed was good company, his English is great and he is a top guy. After the drive we had an hour Camel ride. I was slightly concerned beforehand that the Camels may be mistreated in some way, but our Berber guide seemed to love them like a family member! The camp itself has great facilities and we slept surprisingly well. We woke for sunrise before heading back on the Camels. Would highly recommend this tour, I can certainly see why there are so many positive reviews.

Fantastic trip to Zagora desert!. We did the 2 days/1 night trip to the Zagora desert. Our driver Mohamed JP was brilliant - he gave us lots of information about the places that we visited and organised a local man to take us around Ait Ben Haddou which was very informative and we weren't pressured into giving him a large tip. The camel ride was a great experience and our stay in the desert was brilliant - great facilities and great food, we were really looked after by the staff at the camp. Mohamed JP made our journey very enjoyable and safe. Would definitely recommend this trip to anyone!

Marrakech to Fes - 4 Days - 3 Nights. Three of us split the cost for an adventure across Morocco with our very enthusiastic, cultured, and friendly tour guide, Abdellah. If you want to experience Morocco firsthand, we definitely recommend a tour with this company and with Abdellah. On this tour, we learned about the culture and history of Morocco, several words in Berber and Arabic, and we also experienced so many landscapes from the city to the snow-capped mountains, dry mountains with lush green valleys, and the desert. We definitely recommend the 4 day tour instead of the 3 day because you'll spend much less time in the car, but the drive is just beautiful and you'll have many briefs stops along the way. We chose this trip because we figured it'd be more memorable to see the countryside and learn from a local, than to spend a couple more days in a touristic city and take the bus or train across Morocco for our return flight. If you're wondering was it worth ($) it?? It definitely was--and we are just several english teachers living abroad and a friend from back home that wanted to come along! These guys are professionals (several languages, legit paperwork, quick responses, friendly service, safe driving) and they want nothing more than to share their country with you. Our last advice, read through the entire trip itinerary and understand everywhere you want to go--don't get me wrong, their itinerary is great!--but if you'd rather spend more time walking around a village, then just ask--otherwise, sit back and relax and enjoy Morocco! Cheers! Tip: don't bother sandboarding, even if you're a spectacular snowboarder--you're feet will sit loosely in the bindings and you'll have no control.

Ouzoud Cascades & Waterfalls Day trip. We planned our trip to do the 2 day Zagora trip, but it snowed the previous night and the road was closed. We could have waited between 2 and 6 hours to see if the road would be open, but ask if there was any other tours we could instead. The Ouzoud Cascades & Waterfalls Day trip was suggested by our guide, so we did that instead.I have to be honest, it was not the best trip i have ever had, as it rained loads the previous night, so what we got was a brown waterfall, it was not very pretty ( i think it could look pretty amazing if the water was clear and clean). We walked to all the different points of the waterfall and after a while it got a bit boring for me. The guides was very informative, and what i did notice, was how poor the country actually is. I am from South Africa and we have some poor communities, but this was truly a 3rd world country.So if you want to experience the essence of Marroco, i would recommend you see and experience these trips.Thank you to the team at Authentic Tours, they handled our booking with ease and made the refund from our Zangora trip the same day. This is the best tour operator you could find in Marrakech.

Great experience in the Ourika Valley. We travelled to the Ourika Valley in March with 4 children. Our driver Saadi Mohamed was very helpful and knowledgeable. The highlight of our day was having tea with a Berber family. The tea and homemade bread was delicious. The kids really enjoyed climbing to the waterfalls with our local guide Mohamed. A great day!

Details to prepare you for the Ourika Valley tour with hike. Absolutely amazing day - great company and awesome guide AbdullahFirstly, it was easy to book - they reply promptly with info and took payment easily over the phone (deposit).Guide was punctual, friendly, helpful and fun. He was forthcoming and answered any questions to help us learn about Morocco.We did the private day trip to Ourika valley with hike (paid for guide), Here are some details we wish we knew before!We stopped at 3 Argon oil co ops on the road (helps when you are in a private group to be flexible I guess). here they explain to you how it is made, and give you samples of the oil and mint tea (not obliged to buy their oils but as you can see it being made theres something really appealing about it being organic!)The hike itself was difficult I would say (4 waterfalls), in that some of the rocks are quite big and you can feel unsure where to place your feet. The local guide we had was good, but a bit young I think so he sometimes went too far ahead and left my husband and I to catch up! I will write another review on the hike itself with some tips.We had lunch at the house of the local guide (60 DH extra per person) which was fresh beldi chicken tagine, mint tea, delicious fruits overlooking an amazing view of the valley and mountains - spectacular!great day out, enough time in the car and out. If you cannot do the hike, then I think you can still spend time in the valley- plenty of cafes.shops/restaurants and a beautiful walk along the stream - I would recommend for elderly or ill.

Day Trips to Ouzoud Falls and Essaouira with Omar. This was an excellent, educational day. Omar is a superb guide - a very safe driver, extremely friendly and knowledgeable, passionate about his country and its culture. Despite the drought, the falls were stunning, and a hike around the river with local guide Hassan - arranged by Omar - was marvellous. There was a visit to a traditional berber home which I found fascinating. Omar was full of suggestions and recommendations for the rest of my stay. The trip to Essaouira was equally good and I was very happy to spend another day in Omar's friendly company.

A very nice trip to Sahara desert with a very good guide. I have selected this company for a 3 days tour by looking at the comments at Tripadvisor. They respond to emails very quickly. The tour was slightly expensive when compared with other organizers, but I believe it is worth paying slightly more and taking no risks (good guide, good car, good accommodation). Our guide`s name was Omar. He is a good man, good driver, and of course a good guide. In addition, he is intellectual so that you can talk about anything you want. No worries, go for it and enjoy your time in Morocco!

1 night in the Zagora desert tour - Abdullah is THE best guide!. Wow, to be honest we did not know what to expect. All i had my heart set on was getting on that camel and riding into the sunset! But we go so, so much more! We opted for a joint tour to keep the cost down and we travelled with 4 other people which was great as there was more to talk about and the tour dynamic was fab. We visited famous sites and took a million photos and the camels were all i had hoped for and more. BUT the absolute highlight of the trip was our guide himself. Abdullah was not only informative and friendly - he was witty, interesting and went way beyond any expectations of a tour guide. He was a friend showing us around his home land, taking us to his favourite places to eat and he even helped us haggle for a tajine in one of those side of the road shops so we wouldn't get ripped off at the Fna market! He was fantastic and made what could've been just another tour a truly fabulous experience we have been telling everyone about! So, yes we would recommend Authentic Tours Marrakech but even more than them we would recommend Abdullah. If you're booking a trip - request him as your guide!

Excellenet 3 day tour including Atlas mountains, Dades Gorges and Sahara. The trip really surpassed our expectations. Our guide for the 3 day / 2 night tour was Abdul. He was witty, entertaining, really knowledgable and, above all, an excellent and safe driver. The latter is not to underestimated given the conditions on some of Morocco's roads. Excellent value for money

Day tour to Imlil: Excellent tour guy (Abdullah) and beautiful sceneries. We did a day tour to the Imlil berber village. Everything went very very smoothly and we had the nicest tour gide. Both the driver (Abdullah) and the local tour gide in Imlil knew all the answers to the questions we had and everything we visited (3 old berber villages, Terres d'Amanar and some local shops) was so abnormally beautiful! We did a hike in the mountains when there was a lot of snow (February), so the contradiction between snow and the desert like red hills at Terres d'Amanar was amazing. Also the local gide in Imlil was really kind and took us, after the hike, to his house where we were served tea and some snacks. A trip well worth the money!

Ait Ben Haddou Day Trip with Omar. Omar arrived 10 minutes early to our hotel. He spoke English excellently and is well versed on any topic you'd like to talk about. He knows the history, the architecture and the culture like an expert. I love politics and also engaged with him on some talk on the Middle East, which he was happy to oblige. I highly recommend bringing dramamine, as the serpetine road really can make you woozy. I didn't, but luckily Omar was ready and had some on hand. This really saved my trip.Omar got us some small breakfast to help bring my strength back after the dramamine. Can't thank Omar enough. the trip across the Atlas mountains is half the fun of the trip and could really be viewed as a tourist attraction in and of itself. Ait Ben Haddou was great. We stopped and had lunch later at Ait Ben Haddou (sad lunch didnt have a view on the structure) but we got some good pictures. The best pictures are from down on the river bank, not on the ksar itself. We were given a small painting and Omar is a safe driver, very knowledgeable and a good family man. You will enjoy any trip with him! He also speaks Berber, French, English, Arabic and Spanish. Just amazing an amazing person!

The best tour one could hope for!. We left from Ifrane and travelled through much of the southern part of the country and ended our tour in Marrakesh. Mohammed JP was the best tour guide one could hope for. He was informative, funny, good natured, reliable, honest and all-around fun person to be with for five days. We learned a lot about Moroccan culture, history, family life, and ways of thinking and got a real insiders' perspective on the country. He was an amazing driver and managed to get us safely through all the breathtaking mountains, valleys, deserts, and hairpin turns. Wow! It will be a memory to treasure for a lifetime.

Fabulous Marrakech-Zagora 2D/1N. We had a magical trip through the Atlas mountains and into the desert with our charming driver/guide Abdullah. It was everything we expected and so much more, we were left in awe by the landscapes and the stories and history Abdullah shared with us. Most of all we fell in love with the attitude and hospitality we were shown, the consideration and respect for people and one's surroundings is definitely something we'll carry with us forever. That and the feeling of being a small part of the most beautiful world there could be.Thank you a million times over!(Also: we had the most fabulous little man as our "camel boy", and Abdullah is an insanely good driver to have on the crazy roads of Morocco)

We did several private tours with Authentic Tours Marrakech Day Tours.. From the very beginning everything went smooth and correctly. The reason I choose Authentic Tours in the first place was because they are not brookers and have very good reviews. The response to my e-mail was always very soon. Regarding the tours: The drivers where always on time, very professional and they speak very well english. We where very happy with all drivers and guides: Abdellah, Mohammed en Said.They where very kind, helpful in any way and we had lots of fun too!

superb experience in Sahara!. My mum and I went on a 3 days 2 nights private tour to Erg Chebbi with a super friendly and funny guide Abdullah in December 2015. The overall experience of the tour is excellent! Abdullah is laid- back and very informative! Since we have had enough authentic Moroccan food before this tour, Abdullah made special arrangement on food services which allowed us to have a taste of the traditional Berber pizza. We think it is very tiring for Abdullah, a single driver to keep driving for 7 hours on the final day. But Abdullah is very professional that he could keep us entertained during the long drive. We would highly recommend you to go for this company and have the most excited experience in Morocco! The money is definitely worth for the unique experience! Thank you Abdullah and Morocco!! :D

Day tour to Ourika. We went to Ourika with Omar, and he is a very kind and intelligent person. He spoke a very good english and answered all our questions about his country, culture, religion, etc. with interesting details. We walked to the waterfalls with Mohammed, a local guide, also a great guy. We were a little surprised by the steep climb but it was a very nice trip. Our son at 10 loved it. We had a delicious lunch at a little restaurant by the river. Omar asked us if we wanted to go camelriding so the tour could be adjusted just as we wanted. We had a very nice day, the only minus is that we were a little surprised that we stopped two places, at a ceramics factory and a womens cooperativ with argar oil. It was okay to see those places but it is difficult not to feel any pressure to buy something. It would had been nice to know it in advance. All about the booking and payment is also very smooth. The company send us a mail the day before about the drivers name, the vehicle and the license plate, so we felt very safe.I will recommend this tour to anyone going to Marrakech.

Honest company and honest tour guide!. This tour came highly recommended by a friend, and exceeded our expectations. Our host, Mohamed JP was funny, informative, and most importantly, very honest. We accidentally overpaid thinking the quoted price was per person, and instead it was the total price for the both of us (which was a great deal). Mohamed checked on the price, and gave us back the amount we overpaid. Another important note, while we did some shopping, we did not feel pressured to purchase or to shop in any particular place. I have been on a lot of tours over the years where the tour company has a relationship with a specific shop, and this did not happen here. Instead, I felt relaxed and had a really enjoyable experience meeting and dealing with local artisans.This was a great cultural and historical experience as well, as we had a traditional Berber meal, and learned a great deal about the ways of life surrounding the Ksars of Aït Benhaddou. I highly recommend this tour company and particularly Mohamed JP as your guide!

2 Days and 1 Night Zagora Desert :D. I had the most amazing and surreal experience thanks to Mohamed JP, He went above and beyond to give us the experience we were looking for and more. I could not ask for a better experience if I tried, I would 100% recommend this company for anyone wanting an excursion whilst in Morocco.

2 day Marrakech to Zagora Trek. Our host Mohamed was informative, enthusiastic and could not do more for us. We had an unforgettable, amazing adventure that really was an authentic experience. The company is local and hence benefits the locals. Could not recommend more. Thank you.

An experience we'll never forget!. We did the 3 day/2 night trip from Marrakesh to Mergouza and had an unforgettable experience from start to finish. Jaouad in the office was extremely helpful throughout all of our email communications and answered our questions, no matter what time of day... He organised our trip with only two days noticed and everything was exactly as he had advised.Our driver, Amine, was very welcoming from the moment we met him and it was a pleasure to get to know him throughout the trip... He even let us put our music on in the car! The tour itself was such an experience! Visiting the ancient town of Ait Ben Haddou, Ouarzazate, the gorge and the Sahara camp. So many beautiful places to visit, even just driving past in the car! The hotel we stayed at on the first night was really great and the Sahara camp was unexpectedly comfortable. The camel ride to see the sunset and sunrise was definitely the highlight of the trip, especially as we had a full moon, which made it extra special. We met some other travellers that did a group tour before we went on ours and after talking to them we were so glad that we booked a private tour! Not once we did we feel rushed, or left in the dark about what was happening/where we were going and we felt comfortable to ask to stop whenever we wanted. Every where we went with Amine, we were welcomed with smiles... You can tell that He and Jaouad really love what they do. Thanks again for an unforgettable experience! We would definitely recommend booking with Authentic tours!
Marrakech to Fes. Fantastic experience and fabulous scenery. Trip was great and our driver Abdellah was the highlight, amazing guide!!

Spectacular 2 day trip to Zagora Desert with Abdul. Abdul was a spectacular host- he was infinitely optimistic and patient with us. His easygoing personality, awesome attitude, and sense of humor added a tremendous amount of value to the trip. Talking with him was really educational-there's a lot we learned about Morocco that we wouldn't have been able to without talking with him.It's a trip we won't soon forget.

Wonderfull journey. Took day trip to Ait Benhaddou with our driver Mohammed who was excellent, safe and informative. The trip takes 5 hours there and 3 hours back so do not go if all you want to see is the Kasbah at Ait B. But by going part of the way on the old camel road you really see the country and villages. Strongly recommended

Fantastic Trip to Zagora. We did the 2D/1N trip, Marrakech-Zagora, which was fantastic. A long drive out but well worth it!Very happy with the services from Authentic Tours. Fatima, who helped us with the organisation was very responsive, efficient and provided alot of useful detailed information about & for the trip. Abdullah, our driver/guide was great as well, he did everything to ensure our trip flowed smoothly, was very informative, telling us the history & backgrounds of the sites we saw and shared with us about local cultures & traditions. He was great company. Definetely a must-do trip when in Morroco - the countryside, mountains, landscape, sights along the way (ait benhaddou, black canyon, draa valley, etc) are just superb.If we had more time in Morroco, we would have tried to make it to Merzouga (which requires 3D/2N), as we would have liked to see bigger sand dunes during the overnight desert stay, the dunes in Zagora are very small, but still a pleasure, if you are short of time.

Excellent tours of Marrakech and Ouzoud Falls. The service provided by Authentic Tours Marrakech has been exemplary. Fatima was extremely responsive and helpful. Mohamed (JP), our driver for both day tours was excellent. He was very friendly, accommodating and a very good driver. Yder, our guide for the tour of Marrakech, was very knowledgeable, relaxed and approachable. Hassan, our guide for the Ouzoud Falls day trip, was also very good. He was thorough, covering many details on the vegetation, helpful and happy to answer any and all questions. Overall, I would highly recommend Authentic Tours Marrakech!

Fantastic Tour Service. From our first e-mail, Fatima & her colleagues were so helpful with organising our day trips. My partner & I emailed the night before we wanted to go on a trip & it was no problem to setup, very impressive under such short notice.Once we finished our first day trip to the waterfalls of Ouzoud, our driver Mohammad-JP, had offered if we wanted to go on a trip the next day. As we had expressed interest in visiting Essaouir, Mohammad-JP & Fatima both made booking the trip a breeze. Mohammad-JP was a excellent driver & chaperone, setting up guides for us each day. Hassan in Ouzoud & Achmedc in Essaouir were both fantastic guides & had a vast knowledge of each of their locations. Again, Mohammad couldn't have done more. He stopped at the Argan Oil trees along the way to Ouzoud & even dropped in to where they produce Argan Oil products by hand. Also, making any stops you wished along the way; whether for pictures, coffee stops, bathroom breaks, etc.I couldn't recommend booking both of these trips with this company while staying in Marrakech enough. Good people & great memories. P.s. Tell Mohammad to get 'Big Iron' on while riding the long roads of Morocco.

The highlight of our Moroccan holiday. From the first enquiry emailed to Hasna, to the day we said goodbye to Abdullah, our driver, guide and teacher, this company exceeded all our expectations. They are very professional, the vehicle very comfortable, the accommodation wonderful and Abdullah - well, Mr Popular, we learnt so much from you about historical and modern Morocco. And thanks to you we did sleep out under the stars in the desert. We did a 5 day 4 night tour and had a wonderful time getting off the beaten track. (And they were flexible and added on an extra day for us at the last minute). We highly recommend Authentic Tours Marrackech and Abdullah to anyone traveling to Morocco.

Authentic Tours Marrakesh 3 Day Tour. My husband and I always wanted to see Morocco and the desert. We had a short window for making all the arrangements. Not knowing anything about it, I desperately started surfing the internet. I found some desert tour agencies and sent an email to them to get details. The one that stood out and was horse heads ahead of the others was the Authentic Tour agency. It did not matter what time or day of the week whatever questions I had they got back to me right away. They picked us up from our hotel when they said they would and we paid what they said we would. There were no surprises what so ever. Our driver Omar was exceptional. He was very attentive, polite, professional, and flexible. The desert tour was long but always full of surprises just as you thought you were thinking you weren’t going to see anything special you ran into something awesome. Omar made sure we saw what we wanted and helped us in every way he could. He gave us a full history and showed all the points of interest. All in all it was a fascinating trip. The desert was very special, the camel ride was really incredible, and the camping was fantastic. You really get to see and feel what it’s like. We would most highly recommend the Authentic Tours agency in Morocco and our driver Omar.

One day trip to Ait Benhaddou. Spectacular scenery, comfortable clean vehicle. Our driver Omar spoke great English, was friendly and we had many nice interesting conversations with him. He was a very safe driver and very flexible and accomodating to our requirements. The drive through the Atlas and the visit to Ait Benhaddou was spectacular (though I would recommend sickness tablets if you get car sick as the roads can be windy) and well worth the day trip. Great trip, well worth the visit and great driver.

One day Marrakesch to Essaouria. This was an excellent one day excursion. Mohamed took care of us for the day and he added greatly to the tour. He was a careful driver, something not guaranteed in Morocco and he provided great historical and cultural insights during the tour. He had a great sense of humour that made the tour both informative and fun. The tour was blended to suit our needs and we felt that we spent a day with a friend more so than a day with a tour operator. An Essaouria tour provides a great respite from the heat, hassle and intensity of Marrakesch and is highly recommended. We suggest travellers do this early as Mohamed can provide great tips to avoid the pitfalls of being an ignorant traveller in Marrakesch. Our day with Mohamed and Affinity Tours was the highlight of our time in Morocco. Highly recommended.

Fantastic. Booked 2 trips before from England, this was very easy to do. We booked another trip while we were there and although this trip is not on there list Authentic tours made it possible.Communication from start to finish was good. This is an honest and reliable company who care about the people they serve. We booked day trips to ouzoud waterfalls, Essaouira and Agafay desert (this is a wonderfull place about 1hour from marrakech) which is not on there list but they made possible. What can i say about our driver Abdullah. He is a top cookie, he started the trip as our driver and we departed as friends. He is kind,considerate and will go out of his way to help

An exceptional tour Marrakesh to Marrakesh 4 Days & 3 Nights Desert. Authentic Tours Marrakesh is a reliable, honest travel agency that offers a range of tours in Morocco. I experienced 4days/3nights Sahara Desert Tour. That was really an amazing trip. We saw many unforgettable views travelling through Atlas mountains, Berber villages, gorges, and different types of desert (hamada, erg) including exceptional night on the desert and watching sunrise, riding camels. The tour offered real insight into Moroccan culture and range of places to see. Except one night on the dessert we spent two nights in stunning hotels-palaces surrounded by gorges, palms, with just royal service. Our driver ABDULLAH was an exceptional guide-driver and the agency should be really happy to have such a committed worker. He was fully professional, knowledgeable, and caring about our safety. You can see that he doesn't do his job only because it is his duty only he gets personal satisfaction from making people happy. I will recommend these tours among my family and friends as it is fully safe and enjoyable and I recommend these tours to you if you want to see real Morocco, become speechless with the beauty of this country and be assisted by supportive and professional guide-driver, like Abdullah. Thanks Abdullah, Fatima and all agency. J & C

Great trip.. In spite of the fact that we only had 3 days and 2 nights it was a wonderful tour from Fez to the mountains, desert and Marrakech. Omar our tour guide was wonderful. Would have never been able to see so much of Morocco without this tour. They taylored the trip tpoour needs.

Fantastic . Just did a 3N 4D tour with this company and couldn't be more happier. The places we saw were great and the views were breathtaking. The only thing I would say is that the drives are long however with the views you are surrounded by you don't even notice the time that much! Our driver Abdul was the best we could have asked for. His English was amazing and he really explained to us the history of all the places we visited and allowed us to stop and take pictures wherever we wanted. Lovely lovely man! I would recommend him 100%. The waterfalls were sublime along with the Kaspas we saw on the em way. The gorge was refreshing and the overnight stay in the desert was a fantastic experience. Camel riding during sunset and sunrise is a moment I'll never forget. The road the company put you in are amazing too! (We went for luxury ones)Defo will book again with this company and will ask for Abdul. He made our trip the best!

Zagoura Day Trip. Had a great experience with Authentic Moroccan Tours. Fatima was helpful with organizing everything and Omar was a great driver. He gave me tons of information about Morocco, Islam and all the sites we saw. He also knew what photo spots to stop at along the way. The camel trek and hanging out in the Berber camp in the desert were otherworldly. I wish I had done the longer trip as I'm sure it would've been amazing as well.

amazing morrocan experience. Went on a 4 day tour to the Dades gorge, alt ben haddou , riding camels in the sahara desert and sleeping in a bedoin tent and then back over and through the atlas mountains. We had the best guide and driver called Abdullah , his knowledge was incredible and he gave us a real insight into life in Morocco and showed us some beautiful sites.Our accomodation on each night was first class, my favourite being in the Dades gorge where we stayed in a wonderful terraced hotel where the service and food was excellant.

Marrakech to Fes 3 Day Tour. My 3 day tour from Marrakech to Fes via the High Atlas Range, Aït Ben Haddou, Todra Gorge and the Sahara at Erg Chebbi was a definite highlight of my trip to Morocco. The scenery over the entire 3 days was breathtaking and the overnight camp via camel assess was an amazing experience. Watching the sunrise over the Sahara is stunning! My guide Mohamed was very professional, knowledgeable, accommodating and very fun to spend the tour with. I would say this is a must see for any trip to Morocco as you don't want to miss the landscape, experience and hospitality.

Democratic Price, Democratic tour!. We had pre-booked through the online service the tour of "Marrakech - Zagora 2 days / 1 night Desert Tour & Camel Trek" with this tour operator, for early June. Initially the price was excellent as it provided top notch service both from Fatima who arranged the bookings and was available nearly 24/7 with any changes or queries we had and with from our driver Mohamed. The service was very professional. The driver had arrived very early to ensure a quick and early start to our journey. All the stops we had were amazing with very good explanations from the guide for any attractions we had visited or any questions we had. As for the programme of the tour I will not repeat it as it is explained in a lot of detail on the tour operator's website (http://www.authentic-tours-marrakech.com/marrakech-tours/2-days-marrakech-zagora-desert-tour.html). However in addition to the tour description our guide also took as to a berber family were we had traditional cous-cous for lunch, which was very tasty. Although it is a bit tiring due to the long distances travelled, it is totally worth it. My friends and I do not regret booking this tour as it was a breathtaking experience, especially seeing the sunset and sunrise in the desert. If you are pushed for time this is the ideal tour. We only had 5 days and we believe that if we did not take this tour we would not have felt complete about visiting Morocco. Overall an excellent experience and worth the money and therefore would like to thank both Fatima and Mohamed for their help and services

Authentic Tours Marrakech - 3 days, 2 nights. My friend and I booked the 3days/2nights tour from Marrakech to Fes and it was the highlight of our trip to Morocco! Fatima was a great help organizing our tour by email and very responsive to all my many questions. Our driver, Mohamed was incredible! He truly made our experience all the more enjoyable and we appreciated the time he took to explain the history and culture of the country. He had a great sense of humor and made us feel completely comfortable. The drive through the Atlas Mountains was breath taking and the Berber villages fascinating. But the best part, by far, was our time spent in the Sahara. There are no adequate words to describe the awe inspiring ride through the majestic desert on camels. Having the opportunity to sleep in a tent under the stars is a memory we will never forget. A big Thank You again to Mohamed, he made our trip even better than we could have expected!

Taste of Morocco. My boyfriend and I booked online the 2 days, 1 night trip to Zagora from Marrakech. It was a wonderful experience with a taste of everything! Our driver Mohamed GP picked us up on time and we were welcomed very warmly. We headed straight out of the city and he was ready to answer any questions we had on the history, politics and culture of the country, as well as sharing his own recipes! The car was a large, comfortable SUV with plenty of room and good air con (essential in the summer heat).As we drove through the beautiful countryside and up to the Atlas mountains Mohamed was great at stopping for our photos whenever, as well as recommending good spots and ones we could go back to when they were less busy the next day. We stopped at Ouarzazate to explore the beautiful city known for many films (and Astapor in Game of Thrones!) And got a tour from a friendly local who even welcomed us into his home for tea. Take money for tips and souvenirs as you will want to spend a lot on both, we got some beautiful paintings for only 150 dirham.Then we drove on to Zagora where we climbed on camels to walk to the Berber camp. This was amazing, especially being on a private tour so it was only the two of us and we arrived for the sunset on the mountains.The camp was lovely, very comfortable and welcoming, with soft beds, delicious food and fun songs all night. They wake you up to watch the sunrise as well! Then we were back on our camels and soon in the car.The second day we were so tired so slept a lot but Mohamed was so kind and kept quiet for us. At our request he dropped us at a beautiful Riad for a few hours to eat a lavish lunch and splash in the pool which you should definitely do if you can!Finally we drove back to Marrakech and we were sad to say goodbye! Mohamed was very welcoming and we have him on Facebook and know exactly who we will turn to when we return to Morocco!Even if you only have a fleeting trip like us, this is definitely worth it!

Great Day trip to Ouzarzate and Ait Benhaddou. We had a great day excursion to Ouzarzate and Ait Benhaddou. Mohammed JP, our fabulous tour guide made every possible accomodation for our comfort and took really good care of us. We have some great pictures and some great memories from the trip. We got to speak to the locals who welcomed us into their homes and shared their lives with us. Thank you for making our trip so memorable!

Wonderful!. Our driver and guide, Mohammed, was terrific! He arrived at our riad to pick us up right on time, provided historical and cultural information, had a wonderful sense of humor (likes to tell and hear jokes), and was willing to accommodate all requests made of him during our excursion to Ait Benhaddou and Telouet. The Atlas moutains are beautiful and each of the kasbahs are fascinating. Mohammed's knowledge, wonderful personality, and demonstrated integrity enhanced the experience. In fact, we forgot that we had prepaid a deposit and paid Mohammed the full price of the trip (plus a nice tip) in cash at the end of the long day. When he realized that we had overpaid, he immediately returned to our riad to return the overpayment!!!! We highly recommend this company, this tour, and a wonderful driver and guide named Mohammed.Thank you, Mohammed,jerri and pauline

THE BEST. I cannot say enough amazing things about our experience with this travel agency. We were booked a week long private tour through our travel agent for our honeymoon and we were completely blown away. It was the absolute best way to the see the country and I would recommend it to anyone with a budge to do it. We felt like royalty being driven around the country with our driver Omar (who was INCREDIBLE--sweet, helpful, protective, honest, friendly, open, the lit goes on and on) and all of the hotels, tours (our day trip in Fez with Lasson was amazing), and stops were absolutely breathtaking. My husband and I usually consider tours a bit "touristy," but in a country so exotic and different from our own, I don't think there would be a way to replicate how intimate our experience was. We were able to ask our private guides and driver all of the questions you would never feel comfortable asking in a group setting. Like I said, I could write for hours, but just BOOK IT! you won't regret it.

we'll come back again !!!. We booked 3D/4N trip for 3 pers. Marrakech to Marrakech , including night on the desert. It was a wonderful experience.The car was new and comfortable (Toyota LandCruiser), the hotels were good (Chez Pierre in Dades- to be recommended) , the food excellent and- most of all- our guide & driver (Mohamed Oubaha) was a real added value to our trip.He was with us all the time, ready to help and, still, we had enough privacy. He's friendly, speaks good English and gave us plenty of info about his country.Driving in Atlas mountains is not an easy play (that's why a driver is probably the best option for the beginner Morocco travellers) but we felt safe all the time.All our expectations were fulfilled in 100%.

Super good service. We booked this trip not knowing what to expect, but seeing how there were so many great reviews, we decided to take a chance and book it. Our driver, Abdullah, was also our tour guide, and the reviews lived up to their name. He was indeed as good as it gets. He spoke great English, was very experienced driving up the Atlas mountains with all the curves and difficult roads, and he always asked where we would like to go and how the tour was going. He became more of a friend than just a driver/tour guide towards the end of the trip. He was very knowledgeable and shared lots of information and his own personal experience. He was probably the best tour guide I've ever had in all my experiences traveling. He was super friendly and made the trip superb. The communication with this company was easy, and I believe all the drivers/guides are wonderful and courteous, but if you can, try to book with Abdullah, you will not regret it. I would give him a 6 star rating if I could.

Best way to get introduced to Morocco. My girlfriend and I were going to Morocco for the first time. We have friends who had been there about 6 months previously and they recommended Authentic Tours. I'm so glad they did! Some other friends of ours were somewhat paralleling our agenda, with a different tour company and their experience wasn't as great as ours. Our guide, Amine, is very knowledgeable about Morocco and clearly loves his country. He was always willing to stray (a little) from the agenda, as our moods dictated. We customized an agenda with Jaouad and the main office, and they were very easy to work with and very accommodating. Our schedule was Amine picked us up in Marrakech, then we drove through the mountains to Ouarzazate, making stops in a casbah and at Ait Benhaddou. The next day, we drove through the Todra Gorges, then out to Erg Chebbi for the camel ride into the desert, where we spent the night in tents. From there, after riding the camels back out, we drove to Fez, stopping at a forest to see monkeys in the wild (I actually saw one!). The original plan was for Amine to leave us in Fez and after a couple of days there, we'd take a train to Casablanca. Part-way through the trip, we decided we wanted to extend our time with Amine in Fez so that he could drive us to the airport in Casablanca, as well as show us more sights on the way. Again, no problem getting this taken care of through their office, and through Amine's great generosity with his time! Another essential thing in Fez, Authentic Tours arranged a guide to walk us through the maze of souks, something we couldn't have done without a guide. We never felt like we had to rush along or that we didn't get as much time as we would have liked at particular sites. The highlight of the trip was the camel trek! 90 minutes, through a sandstorm to an oasis camp, then up before sunrise the next morning to see the sunrise over the desert. I can't recommend Authentic Tours Marrakech highly enough!

Two Days Marrakech to Zagora trip. We've booked this trip for two over email two weeks before arriving to Morocco. The communication from the start till the end was of top level and we never felt insecure regarding what was agreed. Our driver/guide, Mohamed JP, picked us up promptly at the beginning of the trip from our Hotel and briefed us on what we would do during this 2 day trip. He was AMAZING. Really friendly and willing to frequently stop for photos. He knew what he was doing and we always followed his advice. The overnight at the tents was absolutely great and left us with plenty of lovely memories and images. I would definitely recommend Authentic Tours and there are no words to express our gratitude for this experience to our fantastic guide Mohamed JP ;D

Marrakesh to Zaggora 2 days 1 night trip. After much consideraton, i booked this trip, ad it turned out to be a great trip. The people were very good with booking and confirming. Our driver Omar was very good guide plus very good driver. i would like to thank him for giving a lovely time. This is a great tour, which takes you out of Marrakesh to very scenic route near atlas mountain, lots of villages also passed through Ait Benhaddou, Ouarzazate ,Draa Valley .Zagora Dunes. the camps at the dunes were brilliant.Bathroom facilities were great

Day trip to the Kasbahs. Hii would like to thank you and our guide Mohamed for the lovely time.I highly recComend this company and the tours they offer.Mohamed was a great driver, person and lovely guide.Please do visit them and u will know what im talking about.Thank you once again.Bonyo-London

I recommend to you, this tour. We booked the tour from Marrakech to Fes, and asked if we could end the tour at Chaouen instead. Jaouad, the tour guy, said yes. He was very quick in replying, and answered a lot of my questions.We met Mohamed at the airport, and the tour started. He was friendly and welcoming. As we drove through the streets of Marrakech, we started to get to know each other and he told us about Morocco, some history (which I liked) and answered questions we had about the country we just stepped into. Thinking I would try to bargain in another language other than English or French, he taught me how to count in Darija, which I only ended up using when he asked me if I still remembered it. The same day we went through the High Atlas mountains, stopped to see Aït Benhaddou, and finally ended in Ouarzazate, where we stayed in a lovely, quiet riad.The next day we went to the Toudgha gorges, on our way to Merzouga. Before going on the camel ride to the tents, Mohamed gave each of us a big bottle of water which was really thoughtful (thanks again, man). The camel ride itself wasn't comfortable, but the view was spectacular. When night fell, it was even more beautiful. The moon bathed the desert with its glow, with stars all around it. Then there was me, lying down, on the desert, alone with my thoughts, and music through my ears. This would have been perfect if not for the wind which was picking up that night, sweeping sand over my face and getting it into my mouth. It still was cool, though. This was definitely the highlight of the tour. I mean the stars. Not the sand in my mouth.On the last day of the tour, we rode through the mountains filled with snow, saw some monkeys and passed through Ifrane, which was very different compared to the other places which we have visited. After stopping at Fes for a short break, we headed to Chaouen. Mohamed, who drove all day, kept his concentration and got us safely to that beautiful town in the north. We arrived at night, and he took us to a nice restaurant, Beldi Bab Ssour. The food was really good and affordable, and the staff were really friendly. We ended up going there three times.If you’re going to Morocco and really want to take in the view, sit next to the driver.And yes, this was worth the money.

Marrakech to Zagora 2 day/1 night tour with camel trek and Bedouin camp stay.. All arrangements worked really well - all booked by email and all arrangements were on time and went smoothly. A really easy company to deal with.We had a fantastic time - and it was made really special by our fantastic guide/driver Abdullah. Abdullah was a very careful driver and we always felt very safe with him. He spoke excellent English. He was very knowledgeable about Morocco and talked to us about everything from the culture, to the economics, trade, politics, history etc. He was also good fun and had a great sense of humour. He was great with the children too. A very big thank you to Abdullah for a very special trip that will stay in our memories forever. We really enjoyed the trip over the Atlas Mountains and the views and scenery were spectacular. We enjoyed the visit to Ait Benhaddou and had a lovely lunch at a Ryad there. (we wished we had taken swimsuits for the kids as they could have used the pool - but they had fun just paddling anyway!)The camel trek and night in the Bedouin camp was truly memorable. The camels were very well behaved - but the ride took a bit of getting used to! A fantastic once in a lifetime experience. The camp has every comfort including solar powered electric lights in the tents and an electricity socket! However, it still feels genuine and gave a a flavour of the culture whilst being comfortable enough for the children (ages 14, 10 and 5) The camp helpers were all great and really helpful. The traditional meal was very nice and there was certainly plenty of food. Breakfast was again plentiful and lots of choice.We had a great trip back and enjoyed the movie studios in Quarzazate (seeing where Cleopatra, Ben Hur, Gladiator and Games of Thrones were filmed) and then had a good lunch there.All in all it was a fantastic trip and we had the best time. Thank you to Authentic Tours (and thanks to Abdullah) very much.

We had great time. Our trip to Zagora was definitely one of the highlights of our Moroccan visit. Abdellah, our english speaking driver was a caring and really nice person. Along the way to Zagora and back he was stopping every now and then for photo shoots, coffee and tea. He never brought us to any overpriced places and he was always concerned about our well being. The berber camp next to Zagora was well organized. Every tent had one double and one single bed with sheets and blankets. Part of the camp was a big tent with modern toilets and hot water showers. I recommend this trip to everyone who doesn't have enough time. If you have more time on the other hand, from what I heard Merzouga is a real desert expirience.

Excellent tour. We took the 4 day/3 nights tour from Marrakesh - which included the Dades Gorge and the Todra Gorge. We had a wonderful driver Mohamed, who gave us a great overview of Berber culture and Moroccan current affairs. When we had problems with the bank machine he immediately offered to loan us his own money. The hotels (Chez Pierre and Dar Chanaa) were of high quality and our night in the desert tent was actually quite comfortable. The tents were made of carpet-type material and were very warm. The washrooms were of the chemical toilet type and very clean. We had a delicious dinner in the desert, vegetable soup, chicken tagine, and sliced oranges. The camel trek was somewhat uncomfortable, but the desert scenery was worth experiencing. Authentic tours were prompt and efficient to deal with, and the SUV used for the tour was new and comfortable.

AWESOME OPTION FOR A DAY TOUR. I was in Marrakech last month on a group trip, and we wanted to take a day trip to see Ait Benhaddou. We found this on trip advisor and I must confess I was afraid it wouldn't achieve our expectations... I was firstly impressed at how quick Jaouad responded to all my messages, always with great info and excellent service. On the scheduled day, our driver Mohamed showed up on time, and I must say that all the trip was EXCELLENT. I was really glad that we had booked with him!!!The atlas mountains are beautiful and Ait Benhaddou is impressive!!Thanks a lot, it as an excellent experience.

Waterfalls day tour. My boyfriend and I were booked on an Atlas mountains day tour. Our driver Brahim arrived at our Riad early and was friendly. We got underway in a lovely 4x4, until our road through the mountains was shut as there had been too much rainfall and the way was too dangerous. Brahim offered us two alternatives - we could go to a fishing village for the day or go to see some waterfalls. We chose the latter, and by the time we arrived at the waterfalls (which were spectacular and torrential with the rainfall!) he had arranged a private tour guide for free, lunch and 10 euros off the cost for the change of tour, even though it was completely unavoidable.I would not recommend going to the waterfalls without a guide, we were taken to all sorts of little places, including to see some wild monkeys. He took pictures for us and took us the safe route (some other guides were going on paths which looked way too steep!). We also chatted a lot about Moroccan customs and way of life, we just had a brilliant time. Lunch was at a great little restaurant, and even though it was a cold day they seated us near the fire for extra warmth. We had bread, olives, water, soup, tagines, fruit and mint tea for a set price of 100 dirhams, about £7 I think. The staff were running round keeping everyone happy and still smiling!I would definitely recommend this company, they made a real effort to save our day for us and we had a great time. Also communication beforehand was excellent.

Excellent tour. We had a great week in Marrakech over x-mas. 4 nights in Marrakech at the Pullman and then we did the 4 day /3 night tour to the desert. We stayed in beautiful hotels and one night in the desert, Our guide, Mohamed Fadli, was excellent and every question before our trip was answered timely by Hasna. We all had a great time and felt very safe with our guide. Highly recommended trip, we really got to appreciate Morocco and will defintely come back..

Excellent tour of Marrakech and the dessert.. I was gladI contacted this agency. They are very professional.The first day we did a tour of Marrakesh. Our guide Mohamed knew a lot of history and didn't try to take to us shops. We concentrated in historical sites - as we requested.The 3/4 day we took a 2 day tour to the Zagora dessert. Omar was our guide - very friendly and professional.

Fantastic best way to see Morocco. This is the best way to see Morocco in your own 4x4 with your own local driver/guide. Our guide Mohammed was the best guide we could ask for, looked after us so well. He iskind, friendly knowledgeable, he can speak english french German, Berber! The accomadation organised for us was top class in fantastic locations all with great service. Mohammed also took us off the beaten track through passages you would never see without a skilful driving local guide, there we met Berber nomads who live in caves! We spent New Years eve at Erg Chebi Sahara & that was the highlight of the trip for us. Authentic tours had organised a special evening for us & there was a banquet & fire & music all night. We highly recommend Authentic Tours to anyone wanting to experience Morocco in its most Authentic way and our Driver Mohammed is the best tour guide we could have asked for

Waterfalls trip. I order trip to waterfalls, very quick response by email, paid by paypal. I had private driver arriving in time and in very clean and comfortable car. Driver was very nice, he even made a named bracelet for my son while was waiting for us. Local guide was also very nice. Everyone speaks good English. Enjoyable. Not expensive.

Ourika Valley day trip. We booked a private day trip to the Ourika Valley for two people. Email response was quick and friendly, internet booking was easy and our driver and guide, Mohamed, was on time, helpful and charming. He took into account my sister's limited mobility, and despite the weather deteriorating during the day, we had a great time. We stopped at a Berber house for mint tea en route to the head of the valley, and after a bracing walk - on the flat - had lunch in a restaurant before returning to Marrakesh. It was great to be out of the city for a while and to see a little more of the country. I can recommend this organisation and our guide highly.

Amazing. From start to finish the best tour I've been on.We booked via the website, communication was perfect, payment easy.We done 4 days and 3 nights Marrakech - Draa Valley - Zagora - Merzouga Dunes.Everything was beautiful and the accommodation was very impressive. Our guide Fetah was the real highlight of the 4 days, he was friendly, engaging, polite and took us off the beaten track when wanted, he was very well informed on his country and a passionate advocate of travel...thanks Fetah.Hope to travel with again!

Best way to experience Morocco.. Whilst on our honeymoon in Morocco we booked a 5 day / 4 night tour with Authentic Tours. Our driver Mohamed Fadli picked us up from our Riad in Marrakech and from beginning he was the most amazing guide.Giving us all the inside knowledge on Moroccan culture / heritage as we made our way to our first stop.On our Marrakech to Marrakech tour we stopped at some amazing sights, and Mohamed gave us plenty of time to soak them all in. The highlight of the trip was the desert visit, but also we cannot speak more highly of our guide Mohamed. We have been on many guided trips in many countries, but this on was hands down the best we have been on.Great value for money also, we chose to upgrade as a part of our trip and everywhere we stayed was amazing!Thank you Authentic Tours, and thank you Mohamed.Alysha and Jacob

Customized Six Day Tour – A Great Adventure!. When we started making our plans to visit Morocco, (9 months before our trip,) like everyone we read numerous articles and TripAdvisor reviews of tour agencies. There are so many of them to choose from! It can be like throwing darts. Fortunately we were right on the bull’s-eye when we choose Authentic Tours Marrakech (ATM). They proved themselves to be professional and reliable from the first prompt emails with Hasna. Messages flew back and forth with lots of questions and answers. Finally we agreed on a semi-customized six day tour that started in Essaouira (we stayed there 3 days before the start of the trip) and ended in Chefchaouen, via Meknes. After seven days in Chefchaouen and Fez on our own, we used ATM again for the transfer from Fez to Marrakech and later for a day tour of the Marrakech medina. We had a wonderful adventure with Omar Ait Khouya as our driver and guide. Always friendly, upbeat and concerned for our well-being, he enthusiastically shared his knowledge of his beloved country and family. He graciously answered every one of our questions, and really helped us to understand the history of the places we visited. He was always willing to stop for photo opportunities, which was very much appreciated, because I’m sure it made his days longer than usual. Omar was conscientious about wearing seat-belts, never exceeded the speed limit and was a very skilled driver. He took us through snow-covered mountain passes, flooded roadbeds, and incredibly tight city streets, without ever losing his temper or his control of the vehicle. After two harrowing Grand Taxi experiences (on our own), safe driving is really valued. We thoroughly enjoyed his company and could not imagine our Moroccan experience without him.Everything was first-class with ATM, starting with the new Toyota Land Cruiser we used to cross snowy mountains, riverbeds and deserts. All the hotel options were wonderful. Kasbah Tebi in Ait Benhaddou has no electricity so all the rooms and stairways are lit by candles, and there was a stork’s nest right above our room (a good omen for our trip.) The stars in the night sky were so brilliant you could see the Milky Way. This was one of the highlights of our trip, along with the camel ride from Auberge Du Sud into the Sahara and having breakfast for two served in the sand dunes just outside camp. The cave hotel, Auberge Festival in the gorges, was also excellent and very enjoyable. In hindsight, we should have done a few things differently. The ride from Essaouira to Ait Benhaddou was too long (this was at our request) and I would suggest starting from Marrakech so you can really enjoy the old caravan route. Essaouira is very nice and deserves more than a day trip from Marrakech though.We only stayed in Meknes one night, but should have stayed two in order to have had a full day to explore that interesting city. Again this was at our request.We thought our customized tour was very well priced and an extremely good value now with the lower dollar/euro exchange rates. We like to linger when we travel and this tour worked very well for us. It was cold traveling in mid-January (from 70F to the low 30’s), but much less crowded, which was very nice. Be prepared: bring thermals, gloves and a hat, and wear layers. A head lamp and toilet paper will also come in handy for camping in the desert and at Kasbah Tebi. (Ladies, check out Urinelle funnels. They are very useful when you encounter a Turkish toilet.)On day two we stopped on the road to take photos of nomadic shepherds in the gorges, who were far away across a dry riverbed. Moments later several young children had run down to our SUV. The oldest did not ask for sweets or money. “Do you have any clothes or shoes for children?” he asked. Unfortunately, we did not. Just an idea, maybe take along a small bag of clothes and shoes to leave behind.

Best way to see Marrakech. It was an amazing 3-day-trip to the berber villages and Ait Benhaddou in the Atlas mountains and the sahara desert. Our guide, Abdullah was really nice and shared a lot of interesting information about berber lifestyle and the culture with us. I highly recommend it!

Surprisingly good!. We took the 3 days tour from Marrakech to Fes with one night in the desert. The trip was great, mixing amazing landscapes with unique experiences such as the night spent at a Berber camp in the desert.But with no doubt Mr Omar, our guide for the 3 days, made the difference. He is a great professional, always concerned with our well being and with a great cultural background about his country and people. Thank you Omar!Luis and Herbert

2 day trip to Zagora dunes . I used authentic tours for a 2 day tour . Our guide and driver Mr Omar was brilliant with full of info on the Berber ways and in general about Moroccan culture . I recommend authentic tours and Mr Omar if you are planning to visit Marrakech .

Best way to see Morocco. This was a great tip! Although on the expensive side for what is included, all of the companies offering this trip are priced out similar. The guide we had was great, he had a lot of knowledge and was a great driver. Definitely a good travel companion to have. While you are traveling remember that you will need to bring toilet paper, don't go without it! For the camel trip, it was absolutely spectacular! We couldn't believe how freezing it got in the desert, so please remember to bring clothing to layer, hats, scarves, gloves, socks and warm shoes. This was the best thing we did during our trip in Morocco and we definitely wouldn't have been able to see the country like we did had we planned this on our own.

Ourika Valley. Me and my dad went to Morocco for the Club World Cup and we did the Ourika Valley day tour going through the Marrakech desert and the Atlas Mountains. It was awesome and that was beacause our guide Mohamed was great. He was always telling us where we were going through and always very kind with us. He is a great guide. We spent a great time with him doing the tour.

Great trip to Ait Benhaddou. It was an amazing one-day-trip to the berber villages and Ait Benhaddou in the Atlas mountains. Our guide, Abdullah was really nice and shared a lot of interesting information about berber lifestyle and the culture with us. I highly recommend it!

A perfect way to see Morroco!. We recently had a week in Morroco based in Marrakech - we booked 2 day trips with Authentic Tours and had an amazing time. The first trip was into the Atlas Mountains and the second was to the coastal town of Easaoura. Both of our drivers were wonderful - professional, attentive and full of information about Morocco. We felt completely safe at all times and would definitely use this tour company again. Exceptional Service and Super Friendly Team. I can only say that Authentic Tours of Marrakech is exceptional in the world of travel. Incredible day with an exceptional guide!. My friend and I did a trip with Omar to Aït Benhaddou today, and we had the most spectacular experience - perhaps the best day of our Moroccan experience so far (and we've been here for two weeks)! Our guide went above and beyond what was expected of him, and at the end of our 10 hour day trip, when we were all tired, he stopped to buy us prickly pears (on him) from a vendor because he felt guilty that his energy was wearing thin. A truly unbelievable experience, riding in style in an SUV with moroccan carpets beneath our feet, eating a delicious lunch at a restaurant after our tour of the incredible town where various films have been shot, and all for a more than reasonable price. The rolling hills, the desert, the kasbahs, the afternoon mint tea - it is a royal Moroccan experience in and of itself, and with a guide as friendly, warm, and welcoming as Omar, we highly recommend this trip.Thank you for a day to remember and cherish!

Amazing experience...great guides!. First and foremost, Morocco is an amazing and wonderful place. It is hard not to fall in love with the people and the sheer beauty of the country. With that being said, I do highly recommend emplying the services of a guide and driver if you are planning to venture outside of Marrakech or any of the major cities. Since this was our first visit to Morocco, we decided to accomplish two main goals - explore the magical city of Marrakech and then to head to the Erg Chebbi dunes for the surreal (albeit a bit cliche) experience of a camel trek into the Sahara. Enter Authentic Tours Marrakech...I have used private guides in other countries (China, Greece, etc.), however, this agency exceeded all prior experiences. The reason was solely our guide--Ahmed--and driver--Abdul. They were both energetic, knowledgeable, and catered to our every need. We engaged in talks about politics, the arts, and everyday life in our own respective homes. They shared every bit of insight that they had at each stop. One of the big issues that these tours face is that they all have required vendors that they want to stop at to try and get the tourists to spend money on whatever item they are selling--since the agency/guides get a cut. Not once did I feel obligated to buy anything. In fact, when we wanted to buy a traditional Berber wrap for our camel trek, they took us to a small family's shop that had prices that were 1/3rd of the tourist trap locations. AFTER buying the wraps for approximately $4 each, they told us that the kids running around the shop were all orphans from nearby villages. A typical tour company would have softened us up with that news BEFORE we entered the shop. Regarding the sites...they were as advertised and wonderful. The camel trek delivered in a big way. I highly recommend this experience--it is surreal to be surrounded by the beautiful dunes and sitting atop a camel. My negative comment is that that lunch stops are definitely "safe" choices. I get that not every tourist loves Moroccan food--however, the lunch restaurants were quite bland and geared towards not causing digestive issues with little ol' blue-haired grandmas visiting from Florida. I would have loved to have a bit more adventurous culinary choices--but I just saved those for our nights in Marrakech. Overall, my final recommendation is to request AHMED and ABDUL as your guide and driver...they are wonderful!

We Couldn't Have Been Happier. This review is long overdue, but we enjoyed our tour so much that I had to write it. My husband and I did a week-long tour around a large portion of Morocco. The price was very reasonable and the experience exceeded our expectations in all aspects. Mohammed was a terrific driver and guide. He gave us great recommendations for food and took us to interesting locations. He made sure to stop if we wanted to take photos, go to the restroom, or get something to eat. He is friendly and very knowledgeable. We learned so much about culture, religion, and history in Morocco and Mohammed was happy to participate in an exchange of perspectives. The overnight trip in the desert was one that had been on my bucket list, and the experience was truly incredible (although camels aren't very comfy to ride and I wouldn't recommend going any longer than a couple of hours on a camel). My husband and I have traveled a lot, usually by ourselves, but this tour was by far one of our favorite travel experiences. My husband had been a little nervous about visiting Morocco because he didn't really know what to expect, and he ended up loving it largely due to Mohammed making us feel so comfortable and well-informed.

Amazing experience. My boyfriend and I went on this trip and had a really great time. The main highlight was the Sahara desert which is outstandingly beautiful. If going on this tour I would advise you bring some change for water as you are travelling for most of the day and change for toilets which usually cost about 2dh.Thank you for having us!Charlotte and Ryan

Great 3-Day Trek into the Sahara!. We booked with Camel Safaris as Ali was very responsive and detailed with his communication. Our driver Ibrahim was also very fun and accommodating. Trip of a Lifetime. Booked a 4 day 3 night tour from Marrakech to Fes thru the company's website. Best tour ever!!. My husband and I went on a 3 day 2 night Sahara desert tour to and from Marrakech with Camel Safaries. Very reasonable price for the value you get. "Sa Ha"

Small Group 2 Night Sahara Desert. Camel Safaries lead our 2 Night Sahara Trip from Marrakech. Our guide Mustapha and driver Hassan were outstanding and excellent. They organise other trips around the country.

Amazing but a few hiccups . We were two families - 4 adults and 4 teenagers. They truly care that you have a great experience and are flexible to make that happen. I have only great things to say about Camel Safaries. Great Trip. Had a most enjoyable trip with my partner .... The trip took us through many beautiful oasis and the Sahara dessert. One of our best vacations ever!!. Camel Safaries far exceeded our expectations. Our guide spoke excellent English and we were thoroughly entertained even on the long drive thru the Atlas Mountains. Great 3 day trip to Sahara desert and surroundings. Mustapha and Hassan took care of my daughter and I on a three day from Marrakech to the Sahara desert and surroundings! They were very courteous, engaging and well versed in the culture, history ,people and religion of Morocco! The scenery of Morocco is amazing. Winding roads, thru high mountains followed by fertile valleys rich in agriculture made for great contrasts!I would not Hesitate any trip with these two gentleman! Amazing, beginning to end!. First things first, Camel Safaries is excellent from beginning to end...and the fact that the trip had to end was the only down side. Short version of our trip...book it, request Mustapha, enjoy and make many memories. The long version follows:My first point of contact was Ali through the company email. He always responded quickly and answered all of my questions. Since we (married couple in our 50’s) had never visited Morocco or used a private guide, we had lots of questions. I’m sure Ali was sitting back thinking “make this stop”, but he was great.  At first I thought the price was a little on the high side, but once we finished our trip, we felt like it was more than worth it! We did the two nights, three day private trip Marrakech to Marrakech. We were met right on time at our riad in Marrakech by Mustapha. He has a great personality and speaks English very well. Throughout the trip he gave us information regarding the area, the customs and lifestyle of the various regions and even shared information about himself and his family. There are designated stops, but you are also welcome to ask to stop to see something that interest you along the way. At every stop, both Mustapha and the driver were there to open and close our car doors...gentlemen!Each time there was a view or site that took our breath way, we didn’t think it could be topped...until the next stop. Our trip through the Atlas Mountains was unbelievable. We made many stops along the way to the Sahara. We paid a little more to have a couple of extras with no regrets. Our stop for the night at Dades was at the Kasbah Xhaloca. We usually stay at mom and pop type of places, but wow, this was amazing. Once we arrived at the Sahara dunes, we were able to relax before our trip into the desert for the night. The camels were an adventure of their own traveling the dunes! I don’t know that I have ever experienced a more serene trip, it was so quiet and beautiful. Two guides led us and a few others to our bivouac where Berber tents were already set up. The food, music and company were excellent. It was a really hot night and we pulled out mattress out into the sand for the night. The next morning we rode the camels back to meet Mustapha and our driver for the long trip back to Marrakech. Although it was a long ride, we still made a few stops and Mustapha was a true guide to the end.

Amazing tour, highly recomend Camel Safaries and Abdoul as your guide. So me and a group of friends did a 4 day / 3 nights tour from Marrakech to Fez, passing through the desert. They picked us up at our riad in Marrakech and dropped us at our riad in Fez. Hassan was our safe and friendly driver and we really enjoyed meeting him. From driving through the mountains, to meet small villages, and the beautiful desert. I'm glad we chose to go to Morocco and decided to book this tour, it would've been our loss (a big one) if we haven't done it. Don't hesitate to book!

Amazing time in Sahara. We really have a great travel with Mustapha and Hassan, they are both responsible and funny, we talked a lot during the trip. Wonderful time in Morocco. From the first contact with Al to organise our trip to the final sad goodbye with Mohammed we could not fault Camel Safaris. Spectacular Sceneries and Friendly Tour Guide. It was the first time we traveled to Morocco and surely it wouldn't be the last time! Camel Safaries offered a full yet comfortable routine. 4 Day Desert Trip. Great trip arranged through Camel Safaris. Ali responded immediately when I first made contact and was able to answer all my questions.
