Our time in Morocco was fantastic.  Liz Williams and her staff did an outstanding job of making it such an enjoyable trip.  Our driver really exceeded our expectations.  He spoke english very well, was knowledgeable about the areas that we drove through, and the customs of the people in the areas.  He accommodated our needs and maybe unusual request (finding an ATM, taking us to a grocery store, just to explore what was there....).  He made the trip the success it was.  In addition the riads that we stayed in and the proprieters were all very nice and helpful.  We liked that they were in the medinas.  The rooms and meals were very nice, and they provided maps and suggestions on places to eat.  All in all it was a very good trip.

Trip of a Lifetime. I'm so glad that I happened upon Authentic Morocco. Seriously, I never book vacations through companies, but my husband and I were short on time and decided to do so this time around. Best decision ever.Liz did a great job communicating with me before the trip, trying to decide what kinds of things we would want to do and what kinds of places we would want to stay in. I think she hit the nail on the head for the most part. We enjoyed seeing and staying in Marrakech, but also loved traveling with Abdul to the Atlas Mountains and then to the Sahara. The perfect blend of experiencing both the city and the rest of the country. The desert camp we stayed in was beyond breathtaking, and it's only available via Authentic Morocco, so that was super cool. The only suggestion I have is to warn people more about how much money to bring. With all the tips and the entrance fees to museums, we underestimated how much we would need and ended up having to go to the ATM several times.

Amazing journey, great food, good fun. Just back from our second tour with these good people, and if anything, travelling about was even more enjoyable. Liz and her team do a great job, and it was good to meet up again with Abdul who did an amazing job driving us across the snowy mountains, allowing us to see some very spectacular sites. Very much enjoyed the stops during the day for coffee and lunch at interesting locations, getting the chance to interact with charming courteous people. Having travelled quite extensively across the world, I think the Moroccans are among the most well mannered, friendly and respectful, and importantly, possessing a good sense of humour. We particularly liked Bab Ourika, just an hour or so away from Marrakech, and set in a stunning location. If you go, try the Berber omellette for breakfast. Riad Dar Zitoune down in Taroudant is one of the most enjoyable places I have ever stayed at, where Monaime and his team provide stunning food in a beautiful setting. Next time we plan to stay in one of the Berber tents. Our drive north over Test-n-Tizi was one of the best I have ever had, and having lived in Norway for some time, that is saying something. After our 5 days travelling around, we were a wee bit sad to depart from Abdul, but, inshallah, we will see him next time.

The perfect trip of a lifetime. I first contacted Liz in the summer inquiring on rates for the New Year's Eve desert camp experience for 2 nights. She was so flexible and helpful for months. It was not until October when we finalized the details, especially when coordinating our trip back to Fes, which at the time, the rest of the group was returning to Marrakech. Planning a trip abroad and sending someone all your money is a scary feeling. Having never been to Morocco, I was worried about getting ripped off. The fact that Liz's company is certified and accredited by the Moroccan tourism agency and other travel associations such as Travel Trust Association gave me enough peace of mind. When I met Liz and her team, I knew instantly I made the right choice.First and foremost, do not underestimate the cold in the desert. High temps were 75-80s F and lows were mid 30s F. Pack for four seasons. If you need sunscreen, pack your own. Morocco does not sell sunscreen from what I've seen. The luxury desert camp was so incredibly worth it. I'm not quite sure what we would have done had we not had the heat generator and in-suite bathrooms. The rooms were so incredibly clean. Food was phenomenal and well balanced. The food menu had vegetarian options. Service was unparalleled. Liz did a great job merging the group and making sure we felt welcome and had the absolute best experience possible. Liz and her staff certainly delivered a first-class experience and an unforgettable one at that. I commend everyone for their wonderful hospitality and am eternally grateful for the best experience I could have imagined.Tips: Take out enough cash before your trip to tip the staff. Customary tips range from 12-25%. 200 hundred dirhams per car for the driver. Also the alcohol served is a la carte. For the luxury suite, there were ample amounts of toiletries, toilet paper and the shower pressure. I can't really speak for the regular camp but we had packed a mini sleeping bag, mylar blankets, and a neck lamp just in case.

Best trip EVER. We were fortunate enough to find Liz Williams through a friend. This is a highly personalized, professionally managed boutique travel experience which, as an aside, we found surprisingly affordable. Liz is your Morocco concierge. Our itinerary was carefully planned with our wishes foremost. We travelled to all four Imperial cities (Rabat, Fes, Meknes, and Marrakech), to the Sahara, and across the Atlas Mountains. Our driver was calm, cool, and steady on paved and unpaved roads and off-road. I can't find enough good things to say about our guides. Friendly, charming, highly knowledgeable, and flexible, I had the sense that their top priorities were showing us a beautiful country that they love, and ensuring our comfort at every opportunity. The riads (traditional Moroccan hotels--look it up) where we stayed were magnificent--rose petals in the toilet magnificent. Breakfast is included every morning, and dinner many evenings. If you want anything special, Liz and her staff arrange it. Moroccan cooking lessons? Got it. A visit to a hammam (traditional Moroccan sauna)? Done. New Year's Eve party in Fes? Done. I always felt we were in the best of hands. I went with my two children, who are in their early 20's. We all agreed it was an adventure of a lifetime. If only Liz arranged travel to other places! I'd never use anyone else.

Marrakesh. We were very lucky to have met Liz thru a friend of ours. She made our short time in Marrakesh memorable. Liz is passionate about the country and its people which helped us experience the trip thru her eyes.

A Name you can trust!. We had a wonderful experience with Liz and Authentic Morocco. Our trip went from Marrakesh to Fez with a lovely stop in the dessert- 4 days in total. This was a great way to also travel city to city...Being in the dessert is a Morocco highlight that one should NOT miss. Authentic Morocco will lead the way and ensure you are in great hands... Dont think twice...

Totally seamless . Liz was incredibly helpful in organising a 4 night trip for 5 of us: 2 nights in Skoura, 1 night in Erg Chebbi and 1 night in Ait Benhaddou. Accommodation was great everywhere, Kasbah Ait Ben Damiette has the most delightful owners and Mohammed was a great host in the desert. But the star of our holiday had to be our driver/guide Abdul, knowledgable and calm he has a superb sense of humour and we're missing him already. We could have probably booked the trip and driven ourselves but going through Liz completely took the stress out of a fairly late booking and we'd happily do it all again.

Wonderful trip - highly recommend Liz and autentic Morocco!!!. We just got back from a trip of a lifetime and it is all due to Liz and Authentic Morocco! We made our own trip (Rabat, Fez, Cascade d'Ouzoud, and Marrakesh. Liz took care of everything - the riads, tour guides, drivers, sites, food, and overall experience was magical and not too be forgotten. The people of Morocco are the best part - kind, welcoming, fun (especially the shopkeepers in the souk's trying their best to sell you something). Bring your haggling skills for that (sometimea at 20% of what they tell you is the price). Have a great time and work with Authentic Morocco for no worries.

Highly Recommended! Authentic Morocco made my trip planning easy!. I emailed authentic morocco 2-3 weeks prior to my trip to get a quote. Liz quickly responded at all hours of the day regardless of the time difference. She was very knowledgeable about the cities and what to do and where to go and whether or not I needed a guide and how I can go about on our own. Liz was flexible with deposit and payment and planned my entire itinerary based on the cities and places I wanted to visit. They provide in depth details such as hours of traveling, where we'll be stopping etc. Finally during my trip we met our guide Mohammed, he is very punctual, knowledgeable and entertaining. Our entire trip was a breeze and we never felt unsafe or worried. Morocco is actually very developed compared to other countries. We visited all over including Marrakech, Casablanca, Fes, Rabat, Chefchouen, Ouzzarate etc. Mohammed helped up negotiate with souvenir shopping and gave us a list of places to visit that he recommended on the last day. Our driver for the first 6 days was a professional. His driving skills made us safe and relaxed. Most highways in Morocco are one lanes, so you have to be skilled to pass cars at the right time. Without Authentic Morocco, I would have not be able to plan this amazing Christmas trip for my BF and I. Its a very beautiful country and rich in culture. Book with them and you will not be disappointed. Request Mohammed if possible, he was a great guide to have around!

Perfect Experience. From the moment that I sent my first inquiry email to the end of the trip I could not have been in better hands. Liz, one of the principals at Authentic Morocco, responded every single one of my dozens of emails instantly. No matter how big or small — my questions were answered in total detail. I changed our trip itinerary several times— no problem for Liz. She was incredibly patient. Her goal was to always make sure our trip would be amazing. She even took care of booking a wonderful Riad and transfer in Tangier that was not even part of the tour. She suggested the best travel insurance. I had a total and complete comfort level of this tour right from start that began with a google search.  When our driver Ari arrived, I felt like we were welcomed into the family of Authentic Morocco. This is a solid team that has worked together for years. Ali was totally accommodating in every way. He had an intuitive sense and knew instinctually how to be available for every need, without being intrusive. Our drive from city to city was filled with many learnings — from the history to the current life in Morocco. We got into very interesting conversations about culture and politics. It was fascinating. He suggested the very best restaurants. He knew the best times to drive to experience the full effect of the beauty of the land. He showed us the best places to shop. He was happy to step into any negotiations that would be helpful to us. When I wanted to change our itinerary at the very last moment to stay an extra night in the mountains, Ali burst into action. It was a Sunday afternoon and team Authentic Morocco made all the new arrangements, immediately.  In addition, each city tour guide was knowledgeable, flexible and personable. Each guide picked up on our interests. Plus, Ari also knew exactly when jump in to support and provide texture to the experience.  And finally, each Riad was simply wonderful— exotic palaces with impeccable service. The food was just amazing.  We felt safe and secure the entire trip— which was really important to us. This trip was perfect — from start to finish.

"Authentic Morocco" Lives Up to Its Billing. Authentic Morocco came to our attention highly recommended by friends. For our trip in March 2015, we received quotes from Authentic Morocco as well as a few competitors. Authentic Morocco’s price was mid-range, but what sold us was Liz’s responsiveness and flexibility in customizing an itinerary to our desired point of entry, our goals for the trip, and our timeframe. We met our driver, Ali, at the port in Tangiers. Ali had an easy smile, cheerfully answered our questions, and charmed our children. It was our first time in Africa and we felt immediately at ease.Our A-to-B route took us by car from Tangiers, to Fes, out to the sand dunes, and then to Marrakech with scenic stops along the way. Liz and Ali incorporated a few hidden gems (some planned, some ad hoc) that ended up as our most salient memories: the beautiful French casbah in Skoura, feeding apples to the snow monkeys in Azro, an impulsive visit to a beautiful hammam with the children in Marrakech, and a last-minute market tour in Risane, Ali’s hometown. The north-to-south road trip, as we traveled from Tangiers to Marrakech, brought to life the diversity of climate, geography and growing areas. We were fortunate to cross paths with Liz in the desert. She is full of life and stories. Liz has an amazing history and facility with the country.We would absolutely book with Authentic Morocco again and recommend Authentic Morocco to friends considering a trip.

Best Guide Ever!. We booked a guide for a 3 day, 2 night trip from Marrakesh to Fez. Mohammed was everything one could hope for: charming, knowledgeable, flexible. He took us to a couple of off-the-beaten track places which were incomparable. When the restaurant he wanted to take us to for lunch looked too crowded with tour groups, he found us a quiet place with excellent food around the corner. When we wanted to go shopping, he took us to a wonderful place in Ouarzazate. By the end of the trip, we felt like he was part of the family. I highly recommend him and Authentic Morocco.

First trip to Morocco. I enjoyed my trip to Morocco! I used Authentic Morocco to see Marrakech to Fes Luxury Desert Trips. The trip was a three day experience two days driving to the desert but don't be turned off by the travel because you get to see so much of the county and culture. What made the trip great was Abdul! He was a great driver and tour guide! Myself and two other ladies decided to take a trip to Morocco not knowing what to expect when we arrived. Abdul was very helpful and knowledgeable, he was patient and answered all our questions about the culture and people of Morocco. Along the way he pulled over and let us take pictures and gave us history on every location we stopped at. I travel a lot for my job, not often do I get to travel for pleasure, it was great to have someone who loves his country and people and so willing to share his experiences. Abdul was one of the best tour guides I have had in a very long time. At the desert site the staff was great and friendly making us all feel welcomed. The food was great and all the staff was kind and attentive. Thank you for hiring such great employees! I will forward your company to my co-workers and friends who are interested in traveling to Morocco. My three trip was the second week in November 2015 the weather was great!Sharon

Truly an authentic visit to Morocco!. Traveling solo I wanted to visit the Imperial Cities of Morocco to see the historical sights and stay in riads within the medinas. However, I only had a week and knew some guidance was needed. Plus while I realize public transportation is available, I wasn't ready to tackle that aspect of travel with no language skills and being of a certain age!!! I contacted various agencies, but found Liz Williams of Authentic Morocco the best fit. Liz was very responsive to my numerous questions, and her agency holds pre-paid funds in trust until the end of the trip, which I felt was a valuable feature. She recommended an itinerary that stayed within my timeframe and budget (though I might have adjusted it for a few splurges in lodging!), and arranged my transportation with a driver from her in country staff. In each city (Rabat, Meknes, Fes and Marrakech) guides were scheduled (all outstanding), and my driver (Abdou) for the entire period was both a safe driver and personable. Really enjoyed staying in the riads suggested by Liz (see separate reviews of riads and hotel in Casa, my last night before flight heading towards home), and each provided an evening meal at extra cost in addition to the included breakfast. All meals were delicious! I'm already planning a return to Morocco in a few years, and have alerted Liz to this new trip!

Thrilled we chose to work with Liz. We spent a wonderful 2 weeks in Morocco in October with our two adult children. I found Liz by googling best travel agents for Morocco. She was mentioned in a few sites and I checked her out on tripadvisor! I was impressed by her knowledge and directness when I spoke with her on the phone and we decided to use Authentic Morocco and are very happy with our decision. Liz was very responsive to all my questions/emails. We were extremely happy with all the riads she recommended and the itinerary she suggested. Our driver was great--friendly, informative and helpful--even when we had to buy clothing for our son whose luggage never arrived. The car was large and comfortable for all 4 of us. The guides were good. All the riads had advance notice from Liz of our food allergies and accommodated us. We had a medical emergency--luckily in Marrekesh where Authentic Morocco has its office--and Driss came immediately to our riad and accompanied us to the hospital. We recommend Authentic Morocco without hesitation.

Amazing trip in Morocco thanks to Liz and Authentic Morocco!!!. Working with Liz to create and book my trip was so easy and the outcome was amazing! Liz is extremely responsive and takes the time to answer each and every question... and I had a bunch!The tour that she planned for us took us from Marrakech to Casablanca to Rabat to Meknes to Fes and back to Marrakech. All of the riads where she placed us were terrific (I highly recommend La Maison Arabe in Marrakech) and our driver, Alli, was excellent. The guides that she set up for us spoke fluent English and were very personable and knowledgeable.Don't hesitate to use Liz and Authentic Morocco to set up your trip. You will not be sorry. I can't wait to go back!

Honeymoon tour. We decided to honeymoon in Morocco for five days and did lots of research before deciding we were going to do a tour rather than explore on our own and we found Authentic Morocco.Our first touch point was with Liz who continuously replied promptly and helped tailor a trip to what we wanted. I made lots of changes and Liz was very patient and helpful. In the end, we decided to do a 4-day tour. Day 1Fly into Fes, we met our two guides.We did a brief city tour for the afternoon. We were showed around by Ali would was lovely, very informative and even gifted us something in congratulations for our wedding. Day 2We drove to the Sahara and did the camel ride and luxury camp. Breathtaking. A must-do! Probably our favourite part was seeing the desert. Mustafa, the camp host was lovely!Day 3Drove to Skoura. Stayed at L'ma lodge. This was our favourite place, Vanessa was lovely and we had time to unwind and recoup from a few days in the car. Day 4Marrakech. The drive was long, a little sickening due to windy roads but totally worth it. The following day we didn't do a tour of Marrakech, we did that on our own which is perfectly fine and easy enough one you've been in Morocco for a few days. Although we drove anywhere between 5-8 hours each day and spent a lot of time in the car, which at times was painful, we're so glad we pushed through and chose to squish everything we wanted into our time there. Plus you're always stopping along the way at traditional Berber villages and to have lunch. Our driver, Rasheed, was quiet but still fun. Our guide Abdul was informative, honest, professional and genuine. Every time I had to use a bathroom he walked me right to the door and ensured I felt comfortable and safe all day. We were sad saying goodbye to Abdul as he became more like a friend than a guide by the end of the trip. We loved how we listened to authentic music in the car along the way and the boys made our drive much less painful. We felt comfortable and they looked after us very well. We had an amazing honeymoon and the tour just added to our wonderful holiday. I recommend Authentic Morocco to anyone who wants to do a tour throughout the amazing country!

THE BEST TOUR COMPANY. Just returned from a great week in Morocco. We could not have done it without Liz's help. The staff was extremely professional and made our trip totally enjoyable. You can depend on Liz to give to quality and dependability when planning your trip. They are definitely the best

Excellent Customer Service, Experienced Company. I can't say enough amazing things about the amazing customer service I received from Liz when planning the trip. We changed our itinerary and dates several times, and Liz changed our itinerary each time seamlessly. I had a million questions and she was more than happy to answer all of them in a very timely manner.Also, since we'd never been to Morocco, we essentially let her pick everything for us and she did an amazing job. The riads (boutique hotels) were unbelievable and made the experience so authentic. And our guides were all very professional, experienced and extremely wonderful to be around. Our day guide in Fes was especially great, and he was so precious. Also, the meals she picked out for us were out of this world amazing (not all meals were planned).In 3 days, we fit in Chefchaouen, Fes and a little of Rabat, and had an unforgettable experience. Morocco is magical on its own but I don't think it would have been nearly as great without Authentic Morocco. They made it all seamless and wonderful. Highly recommend!

Excellent experience - 3 day, 2 night Marrakech to Fes. Our pre-trip planning experience with Liz was super easy, and the whole trip went off without a hitch from beginning to end once we got there. Our driver and guide were perfectly on time in picking us up from our Riad in Marrakech. The guide Ahmed was well spoken in english, was extremely knowledgeable about Moroccan culture, history and the landscape, and went above and beyond to accommodate our every request throughout our entire journey together. The driver, Mubarak, was extremely skilled and knowledgeable of the route, and trust me when I say, not enough can be said about that part. The roads of Morocco, particularly through the High Atlas Mountains can be extremely challenging to navigate. We got to see everything we had been promised, and then some. The highlight of the trip was definitely the evening spent at the luxury Berber camp. The meal we were served was incredible and sitting out under the stars in the Sahara desert (Erg Chebbi) was something we won't ever forget.

Brilliant Tour. we visited in Morocco as a family with two boys of 7 and 10 and really wanted to se something other than just Marrakech and Essaouira. The reason I chose Authentic Morocco in the first place was that they use local people and places and that the communication I had with Liz from the first enquiry was excellent. I always knew what was going on and I could always feel I could ask questions and would understand things.I was able to explain the types of things we would like to do and Liz listened to these and made sensible suggestions. I am glad I listened to her suggestions and we got to see some amazing sites because of this without too long days.So alas for us four weeks before departure my son was ambulanced to hospital and needed major abominable surgery which meant that at one point our travel plans were very undecided but Liz kept in touch and we made some adjustments to our intinary to accommodate this. We were sorry to miss the deep dessert experience but our luxury camp was excellent.The stops were perfect for our family of four (Skoura, Todra gorge, Erg Chebbi and Ait Benhaddou) and our driver Esham was excellent.The places we stayed were chosen brilliantly and suited us perfectly and those places could not do enough for us. We stayed in some fantastic accommodation where the people really cared and ate some fabulous food.Our driver went out of his way to entertain the children and keep it exciting for them and we saw some things we would never have done had we travelled independently. I would recommend them to anybody and this was the highlight of our Moroccan adventure.

Perfect custom experience between Marrakesh and Fes. Very good communication with Liz in the months prior to the trip to setup our perfect 4 days trip between Marrakesh and Fes. The stops proposed were perfect for our family. The itinary (Dades gorges, Ait Benhaddou, Todra gorges, Erg Chebbi desert, etc) was excellent. We particulary enjoyed our driver and guide who were very very dedicated to make our trip perfect. We felt very safe all the time. The hotels chosen were excellent. We specially loved our night in the luxuary camp in the desert!

Outstanding Planner!. Worked with Liz at Authentic Morocco for a 7 day trip -- Fes (with a Day Trip), Marrakech, and Rabat. She set up Lodging, Transportation, Guides and it all worked out great.
Did a "Cookery Class" in Marrakech and one of the highlights of the trip!

Custom Tour of Morocco - Fes to Marrakesh. Liz and her team at Authentic Morocco helped me and my husband create the perfect trip across Morocco. She helped us build a custom itinerary that covered all the attractions and sites we wanted to see and included her own personal recommendations. The result was a perfectly balanced trip full of top attractions and great local recommendations. The itinerary was well planned and paced taking us from Fes to Marrakesh over 5 days. The tour guides and drivers were personable and knowledagble. The accomadations were nice, clean and comfortable with welcoming staff and delcious meals. Liz and her team took care of all of the logistics and it made our whole trip a pleasure. We were able to truly relax and enjoy every activity because we knew Liz and her team had everything covered. I highly recommend booking a trip with Authentic Morocco. They did a wonderful job and our flexible working with any time frame and budget.
trully authentic morocco. very good tour agent as it covers all the sights in Morocco and can tailormade to your liking. the driver was also very good and guides given weer all very knowledgeable

Excellent custom itinerary. Liz was great in working with us to create an itinerary which included two nights in the desert as well as transportation with sightseeing stops from Marrakesh to Fez. The desert experience was extraordinary and the guide and driver were very professional and knowledgeable. The food was excellent and more than ample. Would definitely recommend Authentic Morocco.

Amazing 3 day/2 night trip from Fes to Marrakesh via Sahara desert. Working with Liz and her group was easy and stress free. Liz was great at putting together an itinerary for a group of 6 females. We could not have asked for a better trip through the countryside and into the desert. Despite the long drives, the stops were perfect, the accommodations were excellent, and the scenery breathtaking. The desert camp we stayed at was an incredible experience. It was my birthday the day we got there and when they found out, our guide had his wife make a cake, and they got some bottles of champagne to pop. We invited everyone to join in on the festivities. Our guide was Ali and we can not express enough our praise for him. He was the best guide. I can only imagine the patience it took to deal with 6 females, but he was great. We struggled to put into words what we could say about him because the only thing we could say is that he is amazing! I highly recommend Authentic Morocco. And I recommend you request Ali as a guide.

Amazing trip. Working with Liz and Authentic Morocco was the most stress-free, easy, well-planned, amazing travel experience. Traveled with my college aged daughter and every suggestion and accommodation exceeded expectation. We felt extremely well cared for, safe, and happy throughout the tour. Liz's knowledge and love for Morocco was very evident in the entire process. We saw other people in our travels who were not satisfied with other tour agencies. Highly recommend.

First rate start to finish. From my first contact with Liz through the final "so long" with our driver Ali, Authentic Morocco delivered top notch service. We were three women with a very ambitious itinerary and only 6 days to accomplish it, but AM pulled it off. Coordination with Liz was seamless, and every accommodation was beautiful and unique.We started in Marrakesh and after introductions to Ali, had no trouble finding our way (on our own) from Ksar Anika to and around the Jma al-Fna. Though we were a bit jet lagged, this first night was a good way to get our Moroccan bearings. The next day began a 3-day drive to Fes, with one night in Skoura at Dar Lokum and the 2nd night in the desert "glamping" at Erg Chebbi, then on to Fes, where we spent two nights at Riad Kettani (my personal favorite). The return to Marrakesh and Ksar Anika included a quick stop in Rabat to tour the Roman ruins and the Mohamed V Mausoleum.It was a lot of driving, but there were enough stops along the way to break up the trip, and Ali was so very gracious. It is clear that he and Liz have invested a lot of time and energy into developing relationships at each of the important sights. Ali seems to know someone in every town.Fes was the unanimous favorite. I agree with others who posted that the old city of Fes is too complicated to take on without a guide, unless you have a lot of time to spend finding your way back. Speaking French would be helpful as well. We had a city guide and though I was hesitant to get hooked into a glorified shopping trip, it wasn't like that at all. Our guide Khalid was clearly very proud of his city and its history / heritage, and like Ali (who also accompanied us) was a gracious and patient host. We did end up buying carpets (among other items) with Ali's help, but didn't feel pressured one bit. In fact, the haggling was part of the fun of it.We all thought the trip was too short, and spending more time in Fes as well as a full-on desert trek with multiple nights out would be top on our agenda for our return. When it is time, I will most certainly write Liz to make the arrangements!

Tour with Authentic Morocco. This is a high recommendation based on a great trip arranged by Liz of Authentic Morocco. Our trip was a tour from Rabat, to Chefchaouen, to Volubilis (fantastic Roman ruins), to Moulay Idriss, to Meknes, and on to Fes. Overall, I can only conclude Liz has an incredible network and a lot of experience that allows her to pull this off. She has great contacts in every city. We especially liked Rose, who hosted us for lunch on the top floor of her riad in Moulay Idriss. She is an entrepreneur from Australia who bought and is remodeling a riad. She set a colorful table and served delicious food to wonderful excess in gorgeous Moroccan pottery.  Our driver was a total peach and accompanied us for the whole trip! Ali was not only an excellent driver, but a great guy. We had one gentleman who did not want to join us for some of the walking and Ali was so sweet to him, entertaining him while we did some strenuous climbing. Ali knows the true meaning of the hospitality industry and of kindness. I would put my life in his capable hands any day. He did everything from tying the larger suitcase on top of the car, to navigating difficult roads, to answering tourist type questions, to attending to our needs for coffee breaks and food, to helping to negotiate rug prices, etc., etc. etc. He is just wonderful and talented in languages, especially English. Then, in each city, we had a city guide and they were excellent. They were all extremely informed, well dressed, and articulate. They really knew their stuff!  Liz arranged for us to stay in or near medinas in riads, which I highly recommend. So much more fun than Americanesque hotels. Casa Hassan in Chefchaouen was adorable and included a very nice breakfast. A wonderful place for dinner was just across the street and to the left, and the food was to die for.  The riad in Fes was also really interesting. Incredibly, we had the whole riad to ourselves for the evening. Dinner was included and they set up a table in the center of the lobby. We bought 3 bottles of wine and consumed an amazing (included) dinner by candlelight. Magic. Then we had an included breakfast on the roof -- lots of food and a great atmosphere. They say one should not attempt the Fes medina without a guide and that is absolutely correct. One can figure out Chefchouen no problem, but one would get hopelessly lost in the Fes medina without a guide. Wear your walking shoes! Some of the climbs around the medinas in various cities were steep, but doable. All in all, I really did not want to leave. If I ever get to go back, I would call Liz and tell her to find Ali! AND -- all of my people on the tour were happy -- the best part of all.

Recommend!. We greatly enjoyed our 8 days trip around morocco which was organised by authentic morocco. Everything starting from helping to plan our itinerary ending with farewell taxi ride to airport was professionally organised. Liz helped us to plan our visit the most efficient but not tiring way. She suggested several options describing pros and cons of each of them and then different options in terms of the budget. We stayed in amazing riads and hotel on the Atlantic, all were suggested by Liz. The car was very good, the driver and guides were excellent. I highly recommend authentic morocco if you want to have professionally organised tailor-made trip to this beautiful country.

First rate company. We spent one week in Morocco. It was very easy interacting with Liz by email as I tried to decide on our itinerary. She is excellent in responding promptly to messages, in answering questions clearly, and in providing information. The online payment system was also easy to use.AM provided everything that they were supposed to provide. Although I had read in the pre-trip information that drivers do not necessarily speak English, I had forgotten that during our first day. Although Hicham was an excellent driver and a very nice person, his English was very limited. The first day proved frustrating until I realized that we should not have expected him to provide much information. It did detract from one of our sightseeing stops. It was more important to us to have a competent driver and we felt comfortable with Hicham who was a cautious and competent driver.The vehicle itself had clearly seen significant use but it was comfortable. We did not have a guide riding with us in the car but had city guides in three cities. It is not clear to me whether AM has any control over which city guide they use or not. All three were fluent in English and easy to understand. The first guide was fine, the second a bit distant (personally and physically) and the third unpleasant. There was no shortage of information. Again, I don't know if the local AM representative has any choice among the city guides, but my guess is that they did. The riads which Liz recommended and reserved were all excellent and we were very happy with them.I became ill on the drive to Marrakech and had to make a minor change in our itinerary. Driss, the man in charge of the AM office in Marrakech, was terrific. He assisted us in finding lodging for the night that we were supposed to be elsewhere, took us to the new lodging on that day, and arranged to pick us up again when we resumed our regular itinerary. He also rearranged our schedule in Marrakech until I felt well enough to do a bit of walking. He was excellent and I really appreciated his concern and his help.Liz was also extremely helpful in completing the forms that I needed to send to my insurance company to try to recoup the added costs that we incurred. I am sure this is never a favorite activity for travel companies but Liz was very prompt and always positive in her messages. I was grateful for that.In summary, everything was excellent with the exception of the guides and the limitations of the driver, the latter being announced ahead of time. I have traveled in many countries, mostly independently but sometimes with trips worked out with local companies, and am aware of the many things that can go wrong. The problems that I mentioned were minor compared to the rest of the trip and thus I rate Authentic Morocco as excellent.

Amazing trip from Fez to Marrakesh. We took four days to travel through the desert and mountains of Morocco, and it was phenomenal. Liz was very helpful while we were organizing it, and everything went smoothly. Our driver, Hishan, was very friendly and knowledgeable, and was always quick to offer suggestions of great places to take pictures of or walk around. Highly recommended!

Our tour guide was great!. We booked a two day one night in the desert tour through email with Authentic Morocco, not really knowing what we were getting ourselves into. Our driver Amine was great, he spoke fantastic English was an impeccable driver. No car-sickness! and stopped at spots a long the way so we could take pictures. The night in the dessert that they had booked for us was charming! a pleasant surprise with bathrooms, showers a beautiful dinner and breakfast. Everything was better than we had hoped! We would definitely recommend using these guys for your sightseeing needs.

GREAT ORGANIZATION AND RECOMENDATIONS. We had a great time> the places chosen great, the hotels to our standards and our style, the staff very professional, cordial, polite, punctual. Even the little mishap with our city guide was handled professionally from Driss .would recommend Authentic Morocco any time

Superb trip in southern Morocco. After comparing four private tour companies, we chose Authentic Morocco for a one-week private trip from Fez to Marrakesh via southern Morocco and the dunes at Erg Chigaga. Liz was meticulous in recommending the details of the trip, responding to our preferences and making useful suggestions. This is a highly professional company, offering extensive notes to help trip planning. The choice of driver and guide were both excellent. We were fully confident of the driving skills of Adele on the off-roads through the mountains. Marouane, our guide, offered insight and thoughtful observations on Berber life, without overloading us with information. We would not hesitate to highly recommend Authentic Morocco: it offered a view of Morocco that would have been very difficult for us to get on our own.

A spectacular trip into the mountains. We booked this day trip with very little notice - we were already in Marrakesh and knew we wanted a day trip to the mountains, so I dropped an email to Authentic Morocco just two days in advance of the trip. Liz got back to me straight away (despite being away in the Sahara!) with some numbers to call. I arranged to visit their office near Bab Doukalla, where I explained what we wanted to their helpful staff and they set everything up very quickly and smoothly, despite the short notice. We particularly wanted to visit the Glaoui Kasbah at Teluet, and so we were delighted to learn that this was possible in a day trip from Marrakesh. Our driver, Othman, came to collect us from our accommodation and proved to be an excellent driver, making us feel completely safe whether we were on winding mountain roads, bumpy desert tracks or in the Marrakesh traffic! The trip through the High Atlas was spectacular, and Othman was great at finding places with incredible views to stop for photographs (as well as the very important toilet/coffee/mint tea breaks). He also told us (in very good English) all about the local people, the villages and the landscape that we were passing through, and after we'd seen the amazing crumbling kasbah at Teluet he took us to see a series of other kasbahs in the area, via some of the most beautiful (and ever-changing) landscapes that we've ever seen. The only small criticism that we might have is that we were hoping to learn a bit about the local animal and plantlife of the area. We saw various interesting plants and birds on our journey but this didn't seem to be an area that Othman knew much about. However, this is only a small thing and perhaps we should have booked rather earlier if we wanted a specialist wildlife guide.All in all, we had an amazing day and would definitely recommend Authentic Morocco and Othman! The price (2000 Dh for four people) was higher than some of the less reputable tour companies might charge, but we felt it was absolutely worth it as we felt completely safe and well-looked after from start to finish.

Wonderful Sahara Experience!. I spent two days at Erg Chebbi seeing the Sahara with Authentic Morocco. It was a wonderful experience. I highly recommend it to everyone! Liz runs excellent trips. She's very knowledgeable about Morocco and has a wonderful staff! My camel guide Ahmid was great and very professional. As a woman traveling by myself I really appreciated how comfortable all Liz's staff made me feel. I did the overnight in the deep camp - an unforgettable experience and one I highly recommend. I also stayed in one of the little cabins at the dunelines camp. It was a wonderful place to stay, right there in the shadow of the great Erg Chebbi dunes. It was clean with comfy beds and nice hot showers. All the meals were excellent. I highly recommend Liz and her company. Use them to book all your travels in Morocco!

All over Morocco March 2015. It was amazing! I booked through this company as I knew careful attention would be paid to every single detail and it was. I stayed in wonderful riads and saw such a variety of scenes. The driver, Abdul, was very friendly and Rashid was an excellent driver.

Unforgettable experience!. We have never had a holiday such as this! We indulged in a customized vacation: SUV, driver and guide plus local city guides. Not too expensive. We began at Marrakech, drove to the High Atlas, spent a night at a comfortable desert camp, with breakfast amidst the dunes of the Sahara, and played in the snow of the Middle Atlas. The cities we explored were evoked wonder for their history and cultural richness: Aït Benhaddou, Ouarzazate, Fes, Meknes, Rabat, Ifrane, Casablanca and finally, Marrakech itself. The arrangements were exceptional - from booking to feedback on life in Morocco. Hats off to Liz Williams, the organizer, the ever-smiling Driss and their colleagues! There are so many things to experience - the richness of the country's geography, the wonderful people, not least the food and the music. There's too much to tell - you must try it yourself!

The best of the best!. We went on a 3 days 2 nights camel trek trip from Fes to Marrakech with Authentic Morocco in January and it was absolutely amazing and memorable. Liz is so professional and was being very helpful with everything since before we traveled to Morocco. She nicely responded to every email and gave us extra advice when we asked about the mobile usage in Morocco. On the first day of the trip, Abdul picked us up from our hotel in Fes on time but unfortunately, it was snowing very heavy in Ifran and the road was closed making it impossible to continue along that route. We discussed with Liz about the situation where she offered us two options; one is to cancel the trip and they will take us back to Fes while another is to continue the journey but with a different route which is much longer than the planned one and could probably take 10+ hours to arrive Merzouga. Of course, we took option 2! We had a very long journey but Abdul was very nice and friendly and his driving skill is very good. When we arrived Merzouga, our luxury tent blew us away! It was so lovely, warm and cozy. The dinner under the candle light was very sweet and the food was delicious. The local staff is very fluent in English and is packed with interesting details and he talked us through details for the camel trek trip to see the sunrise on the next day. The sky was very clear on that night and lit up with million of stars and our local staff taught us about stars as well as how to use them as navigation and also about the nomad and the culture.We were supposed to have the camel trek trip to see the sunset on the first day but due to the situation that made us arrived very late, we missed it but the compensation was that we got two treks on the second day. One for the sunrise and another to the near village before we leave. The sunrise in Sahara desert is our once in a life time experience and will always be in our memory.I definitely recommend Authentic Morocco!

Amazing Trip. We will never forget Morocco. We were picked up at the train station after a long delay and long travel day. Driss was very accommodating and did a great job of making us feel welcomed. Our day trip with Abul was a great way to get to know Marrakech, the food, the sooks and how to get around. We really felt oriented and ready to explore after our first day touring with him.Simone took us on an overnight tour to ait ben haddou. The stops for pictures, interactions with the local people, and the overall tour was great.The love and knowledge for their country make everyone we met with Authentic Morocco truly great. We'll definitely work with them again if we make it out to the desert.

Go With Authentic Morocco!. My husband and I have just completed our 9 day tour of Morocco with Authentic Morocco. We can give it nothing but rave reviews. Liz, the head of the company, was fabulous at putting together our trip, answering every question right away, and making great suggestions. Each driver and guide was knowledgeable, calm, patient and able to answer all of our questions. The Riads we stayed in were terrific- and all planned activities were great. There was also a good balance of activities, so that we had time on our own. In truth, it was a trip of a lifetime. We heartily recommend that Authentic Morocco be the way to travel. We are already thinking about going with them to the Moroccan dessert- and we have yet to return home!

Absolutely Amazing!!!. I did a 2 week tour vacation with 3 friends at the end of 2014 and into 2015. Liz was amazing with putting the entire trip together, making sure that we saw all of the amazing areas of Morocco. Her communication with me (and the rest of my group) was very good and she was able to answer any and all questions that we had, no matter how petty they may have been.We started out in Cassablanca for a day and then made our way to Rabat and Meknes. From there, we traveled to Fes for several days and then made the drive to Erg Chebbi for an amazing night in the desert, where we took in a beautiful sunset and sunrise, along with a short camel ride. From the desert, we traveled to Kelaa Mgouna and Ait Benhaddou. Our final destination was in Marrakesh for several days.Our driver was Abderrahim (Abdo) and he was wonderful. He is extremely knowledgeable about his country and all the history and culture that it holds. Even though English is not his first language, he was able to hold conversation and answer all of our questions that we came up with. He became part of our group as we traveled and it was sad to see him leave us at the end.Liz did a very good job picking out riads and kasbahs for us to stay at. All of the employees were helpful and the places were very clean and accommodating. They were all so different from each other, that it really added to the uniqueness of the vacation. I would stay at any one of them during another trip to Morocco.This was my first trip to Morocco, but it definitely will not be my last. I am thrilled that Liz was able to put together such a wonderful vacation. I know I will be returning in the near future and I won't hesitate to contact Liz when I do. I wouldn't go with any other agency!

Excellent Trip. We worked with the company through Liz who answered clearly to all our questions and catered to our needs from the wonderful choices of Riads to the transportation among cities and other tours, inlcuding the new year camp and the walking tours.Would definitely recommend Authentic Morocco if you want to plan your trip.

Wonderful trip!. We did the 5 day New Years tour in the Sahara from Marrakech. Liz was fantastic, answered all of our questions (and we had many) very promptly. She helped us with our stay prior to the tour in Marrakech with recommending and booking a Riad for us, recommending restaurants and ideas of how to plan our stay. The tour itself was great - I don't generally travel with tour groups and this one was perfect. We drove for 2 days into the Sahara, with many stops along the way which I never would have done otherwise. Sahara itself was absolutely amazing. We upgraded to the luxury tents and couldn't have been happier. It's still camping, but I am not a camper and I was perfectly comfortable. Hot water, clean sheets, wonderful breakfast, camel rides at sunrise and sunset. We took a quad tour in the dunes which they arranged no problem. New Years campfire with a DJ and singers and dancers. It was brutally cold at night, but they really made us very comfortable. The staff was fantastic, and I very much recommend this company - they really went out of their way to ensure we were all happy, saw everything we wanted, and I was very pleased. Thank you!

3 days tour Fes- Marrakech . We departed from Fes on the 2 nd of January traveling through the Atlas, Erg Chebbi and the Gorges arriving to Marrakech. We enjoyed the whole tour, especially the nights in the deep camp and Skoura Oasis (Dar Lorkam). Thanks to Liz for the competent organization and our driver Ali for guiding us through this adventure. He is an easy-going and friendly person.Marco and Valentina from Florence

Fez to Marrakech Desert Tour with family. We just returned from a week long trip organized through Authentic Morocco tours. We were travelling with two adults and two children age 6 and 12. Every aspect of the trip was well thought out and lodgings were selected with care. We were provided a car, driver, guide and city guides as well as a short camel excursion. Over the course of the week, all breakfasts and four dinners were included and we were responsible for lunches. The restaurants we ate at for lunch provided food to the driver and guide as well. We were grateful for Liz's advice to stay in a lodging with heat in Merzouga rather than the desert camp due to the cold December temperatures. Authentic Morocco Tours offered a solid tour at a fair price. I would not hesitate to recommend them if you are considering a visit to Morocco.

American Berber, Fadima and friends tour Morocco. First, the planning experience. Liz was prompt, thorough and eager to provide us with an experience that met the desires of two well-traveled couples. We spent many months reading, watching films, talking and emailing Liz and enjoyed the process of putting this trip together. We spent 11 days in country: Fes, Middle Atlas, Erg Chebbi dunes, Dades Gorge, Skoura oasis, Ait Benhaddou and Telouet through the High Atlas to Marrakech. Second, Abdul (not his Berber name :-), our driver/guide. We had such a wonderful time with this bright, articulate, well-educated, funny young man. He represents this company and his country so well and made our 7 days with him a delight. He was always professional, yet personal and accommodating, even managing to get us in to visit an excellent school in Skoura and have lunch prepared and served by a lovely lady in her home in the oasis. Our discussions about modern-day life in Morocco, family structure, city vs country living, education, medicine, and Moroccan and American politics and economies made our lengthy drives interesting and fun. There is a fine balance between professionalism and friendliness and Abdul has found that balance. We missed him a great deal when he left us in Marrakech.Third, the tour itself. Morocco is a world unto itself. Spending 3 nights each in riads in the Medinas of Fes and Marrakech were excellent. We stayed at Riad Fes Kettani and enjoyed the location, accommodations and hospitality. We, unfortunately, do not speak French and found communication a bit difficult, but appreciated that WE were the visitors in their country. The Fes medina is a wonder and we walked, and looked, shopped our way around it with our mouths open. It truly feels like a way of life that we didn't think existed today. We had a day to explore outside the medina and although it gave us a taste of modern/city life in Fes it was a day we could have missed. The Museum was a huge disappointment.Our desert experience was too short. We arrived just before sunset and after a very brief camel ride and climb to the top of the dunes the sun was down. The next morning was too cloudy to really appreciate the sunrise but the quiet and beauty of the desert is always a thrill. We wish we had had more hours (possibly 4-wheel drive vehicle) to take us further out for some additional exploring. The luxury camp was excellent, great candle-lit dinner for the four of us. Mohammed was a generous host and provided a superb traditional dinner and breakfast.Arriving in the Dades Gorge to the Hotel Chez Pierre on a cool, rainy late afternoon we were greeted by a cedar fire and hot tea, charming rooms ranging up the hillside, and one of the finest French meals I've experienced. Totally unexpected. Three brothers run this great hotel, one is the chef. Wow. We drove and walked through the gorgeous gorge the next day and again appreciated the skills of our driver Abdul as he negotiated the twists, turns and elevation of this wild road. It is truly spectacular.Skoura Palm Oasis and the Kasbah Ait Ben Damiette- Abdul told us to be prepared for wonderful hosts and food and we were not disappointed. Colette and Yanik greeted us as treasured friends and provided beautiful rooms, dining spaces and gardens and perfect French food. We were again wishing we could speak French but with the assistance of Abdul we ordered wine and communicated adequately. The day we spent walking and biking the oasis, eating lunch with Fadima in her traditional mud and straw home, touring the ancient Kasbahs and visiting the school were memorable. We finished up our tour driving over the High Atlas from Skoura to Marrakech. Jaw dropping elevations, beautiful little villages nestled into gorges, families walking the roads with their animals. Life appeared to these western eyes to be simple, quite beautiful and very hard.Marrakech- A very different medina experience compared to Fes. Much more commercial, busier, noisier, more fun. We stayed at Riad le J (only 4 rooms) and enjoyed our Italian host and his uniquely decorated riad. We ate at excellent restaurants (Nomad and Le Jardin) explored and people watched. The La Maison Arabe Cooking school was a true highlight and I'd recommend it highly. Very professional and held outside of the medina at a country club with gorgeous grounds and gardens. The tagine we prepared was the best we ate in country probably because we could add extra spice and not cook it too long. Also fit in a traditional hammam visit for a scrub and massage.Morocco is a very welcoming country, safe, stable and unique and we loved our time there. Suggestion: We covered a great deal of the country over the road and found the driving times much longer than we'd expected. We would not have missed out on the experiences or places we visited but would have liked a more accurate time frame. The city guides truly are merchandise peddlers ( a fact we were made aware of in advance.) We did make some purchases we are happy with but the bartering and pressure is something I do not like and will not do again.....ever.....anywhere. Just my personal opinion.Thank you Liz for your company, employees and love of Morocco.

short trip to Marrakech, Erg Chebbi and back to Marrakech. We changed our minds and decided one day before our holidays started to go for 5 days to Morroco. Liz was very helpful in arranging a trip for us in no time. Our guide Khalid was very supportive and explained almost everything about Morroco and its history, culture etc.. We also felt safe. The recommended hotels are really recommendable. We enjoyed our stay and this tour from minute one till the end.

Felt like a National Geographic assignment!. We had a wonderful tour with Authentic Morocco! Our driver Hicham was professional and safe, helpful and accommodating. Although English was not his strongest language we found his efforts commendable and wish we understood more Arabic and French! We travelled from Marrakesh to Fes via the Sahara over 3 days. Our camel ride and desert camp experience was extraordinary. Sunset and sunrise were perfect and Ali and Saiid made certain we made the most of our time. All our meals and accommodation were suitable. We employed our driver for a further 5 days of our stay as we found travelling with him more efficient and enjoyable. We are 3 females, 23, 24, 50... I highly recommend Authentic Morocco as an easy to deal with and value for money tour company.

Wonderful experience - highly recommend. We are experienced travellers and this tour from Fes to Marrakesh via the Sahara was truely memorable. It was better than we expected with a great careful driver, Hassan, and knowledgeable and very nice young guide, Hamid. We stopped where we wanted and when. They assisted us fully including some bargaining tips and were a delight. The Riads we stayed in were all exceptional and we felt like royalty. I've read a negative report seemingly based on the same trip and found none of this applied to us, we had a great experience that we felt was AUTHENTIC rather than being mollycoddled and pampered tourists. Liz and her team put together a great itinerary that exceeded our expectations. As retired Australians we expected and were prepared for a tougher trip but this certainly wasn't the case. The desert camp was fun with great delux tent accomodation, with double 4 poster bed, hot shower, best targine in Morocco and fun entertainment with local musos. Highly recommend this company.

What a neat experience!. An experience ill never forget! Our driver, Ali, was professional and knowledgeable making the half day drive informative and comfortable. Ali was easily able to accommodate my Fiancee's pescetarian dietary preference in the stops we made for food. The only negative i can think of was the restaurant we stopped at last before the camp, Bab Sahara, was a little expensive and the food was pretty mediocre. Our camel ride was short, total of about 2 hours but was very exciting with incredible views. My fiancee and I stayed in the luxury tents hosted by Mustafa. Most Moroccans are pretty hospitable but Mustafa is so genuine that I felt like I was with family! I think the luxury tent upgrade is more than worth the value. Its not much more and its so special. I was really surprised the attention to detail that comes in the luxury upgrade and would recommend authentic morocco tours. Thank you Liz for making our experience possible on really short notice.

Regret hiring Authentic Morocco. Authentic MoroccoWe chose Authentic Morocco for a tour between Fes and Marrakesh, during our two week trip to Morocco, based on TA reviews, Authentic Morocco's website info and email contacts with the company. We came to regret this decision. I have given details below, or you can jump to The Bottom Line at the end for a summation.The DriverOur driver seemed to be a nice man. He was polite and courteous. He was very prompt. He drove with skill between our accommodations on all types of roads. We felt safe at all times. Our driver was on his first assignment with Authentic Morocco. He was not one of the names mention in glowing terms in some TA reviews, or prominently displayed on Authentic Morocco's website. Our time with him was nothing like those described rich, learning experiences. Our driver speaks French and Spanish, in addition to his native Berber and Arabic. His English was better than any fragments of a second language that I have, so it is rather embarrassing to say we had trouble communicating. Over four days we got better at understanding his English. In the beginning of the trip, we tried to show our enthusiasm for learning about Morocco, but answers were very short, or unrelated to what we were trying to ask. Eventually we slowed in asking questions, and mostly drove from accommodation to accommodation in silence.Our driver told us to ask if we wanted to stop for a photo. By the time we got through the communication process so that he understood we wanted a stop we were usually well past the photo subject. He was always willing to go back. When it was safe to do so, we could reposition for still-life photos, but for anything with a moving subject (ie camel) the moment was generally lost. We tried taking photos out the window as we drove along but got few quality photos this way. As a result over four days we have a series of panoramic vistas, a few kasbas, and little else.The RouteAuthentic Morocco calls their trips tours. This implies more than we received, so we have described it as our route. We chose to extend the three day Fes to Marakesh trip to four days, based on Authentic Morocco's info that this would allow a slower, more relaxed pace. This was a mistake. We interpreted this as slower paced on the road portions, with more time to see things. It actually meant a lot more down time once we arrived at the evening accommodation.Day One we drove from Fes to our desert camp. The desert camp was the one highlite of our trip. The camp is actually very close to the centre were you meet the camel driver. The camel ride takes you into the desert and circles back to the tented camp. The tented camp was was an evocative experience described later.Day Two we left shortly before 10:00, drove directly, with a lengthy lunch break, and arrived at N'Kob. We were left on our own at 14:30. We are experienced travellers so we were fine to explore on our own in a place where we attracted a lot of attention. The town was very small, so we finished wandering quickly, and spent the afternoon and evening reading books.Day Three our notes advised us to pack a picnic lunch for our off road day through Tizi-n-Tazzazert. Our guide did not seem to understand we were to get picnic items, so we showed him our schedule. We went to the market, bought bananas and oranges. The market was a fascinating mix of color, costumes, people and goods. We would love to have spent some time there, but it was not on our schedule so we headed off on the road. The trip through Tizi-n-Tazzazert is serious second gear, 4 wheel driving for much of the way. It is stark mountain scenery. We were through the off road portion and traveling through towns on a good highway by 14:00, so we asked when we stopped for the picnic. Our driver was surprised we wanted a picnic, but pulled in to a restaurant where we ordered coffee and gave a substantial tip to sit on the patio and eat our picnic lunch. Clearly, we failed to understand why our trip details had instructed us to pack a picnic lunch if we could have just ordered from the restaurant's menu.Day Four we woke up realizing we had made a mistake in contracting with Authentic Morocco, and were anxious to get to Marakesh and travelling on our own. This day was marginally better as we had two scheduled stops to view kasbas on our own, or hire local guides, and an additional stop to see a cooperative selling handicrafts. We were dropped off in Marakesh at 18:00.The AccommodationsThe desert camp was a group of large tents, with board floor, around a central open area. We had a large, raised very comfortable bed. The cold water shower was challenging in the morning chill. Dinner was served outdoors in a wonderful setting. We ate privately near our tent, as did other guests. Dinner was a very nice variety of tajines, with meat and vegetables. It felt decadent sipping wine in the desert. The wine was basic and passable. The Moroccan musicians added to the ambiance.Kasbas Imdoukal, in N'Kob, was a large, very basic room. AC was good. The bathroom was large and clean. The shower had a very weak spray, and little hot water. We were asked for a choice of dining times and given a good choice of dinner options. Dinner and breakfast were both good.Dar Lorkam, in Skoura, was a very isolated place, several miles from the town site. Our guided had not been there before, and it took some time to find it. The room was spacious enough, very nicely designed, and very comfortable. The building design, and cool evening made a wonderful sleep. There was no AC, but it may never be necessary, given the design of the building. Shower had good spay, but ran short on hot water. The grounds had a lovely garden, pool, and seating areas. This was good as with the isolation meant there was nowhere to go to, so we just read books until our assigned 20:00 dinner time. There was only one choice for dinner, a tagine of ground beef. As Abdullah (see lower in Authentic Morocco) had insisted we should not eat ground meat while in Morocco, we just ate the soup and asked for extra bread. Better to go to bed hungry than risk stomach problems. Breakfast was a nice change, crepes with two jam spreads.Authentic MoroccoLiz Williams was very good in answering all our emails with questions about Authentic Morocco. The payment procedure was efficient. We very much appreciated the concern Abdullah, Authentic Morocco's local representative, showed when I became ill on the way to the desert camp. I had vomited on the highway and again just before our camel ride. Abdullah arranged that we could ride camels in the morning when I felt better. While the sunset ride would have been nicer, I really appreciated Abdullah's flexibility. Abdullah also gave me a large spoon of cumin and hot water to help my stomach. In the camp, he emphasized not to eat ANY yogurt. Probably the sealed, safe-looking yogurt I had eaten was the problem. He also advised no ground meat, and no vegetables not peeled or washed in mineral water. Abdullah gave me rice and a few vegetables with cumin, instead of the usual supper. For breakfast, Abdullah gave me bread and a drink of hot lemon juice with cumin. I do think his medications help me recover sooner.There were some concerns with Authentic Morocco. Our Fes riad owner tried to arrange an efficient morning pick up, but was unable to reach Authentic Morocco at the numbers we had. He told us he was going to try phoning the UK number. Later in the evening he informed us he had reached Authentic Morocco, but our driver was as yet unknown. In the morning, the Riad bell boy took us to the meeting point. The driver did not have the Authentic Morocco identification documents our info said he should. The riad bell boy insisted on making some calls before he was sure we were in safe hands.Our driver apparently had little time to be familiar with our route, or trip plans. The first three days, at times he asked locals for directions. In addition to the the picnic day mix-up mention earlier, on Day One we were concerned our driver was taking us to the regular desert camp. We finally asked him to pull over and insisted he look at our documents. He then seemed to understand we should be going to the location for the Deluxe Desert Camp we had paid extra for. We did then get to the correct place.The Bottom LineWhen we agreed to the Fes to Morocco 4 day trip, Liz Williams sent us a document outlining the trip and the conditions. It was stated in the documents we got a driver, not a guide. We did get what the conditions outlined: a driver and pre-booked accommodations, including dinner and breakfast. We have no complaints that Authentic Morocco met their contracted obligations, but that was all we got. We are experience travellers, who have been in a number of different cultures and travelling conditions. While we usually travel independently, occasionally in locations such as Ecuador, Tanzania, Cambodia, and recently Cuba, we have chosen a private or small-group tour company to learn as much as we can in a short time. We had hoped for this from Authentic Morocco, based on TA reviews and testimonials on their website. Unfortunately, during our 4 days with Authentic Morocco, we learned little more than what we could observe through the car windows as we were driven from accommodation to accommodation.We would recommend getting a company that provides a guide, if you are looking for more that private transportation and pre-booked accommodations. Or you could travel on your own. We spent an additional 11 days in Morocco, travelled on 1st class buses and trains. We journeyed from Tangiers to Fes, and after our tour from Marrakech to Essaouira and return to Tangier. We stayed in accommodations at least as good as the better of the Authentic Morocco places. We hired local guides. Overall, the total cost on our independent 11 days was about the same as the cost of the 4 days with Authentic Morocco. The difference being we learned FAR more about Morocco than while with Authentic Morocco.

Outstanding Tour Organization. Look no further for a great tour outfit in Morocco. I searched the web, plus asked friends, and found Authentic Morocco. Could not have had a better experience! We were met at the Casablanca airport and taken to Fes. Spent several days on foot in the Fes Medina, then drove to the desert (Merzouga / Erg Chebbi) with the same Authentic Morocco gentlemen (Hassan, our driver, as well as another Hassan, our licensed tour guide - this is required by law in Morocco). We were even taken to the home of Hassan our driver, and his Mother, sister in law, and niece and nephew were delighted with visitors. Berber culture is so warm and hospitable.We continued our driving tour and ended up in Marrakesh at the end of the trip. The owner, Liz Williams, was very helpful in arranging a tour to meet the time constraints we had (9 days). She was patient with me when I asked for a few recycles on the riads (hotels) she suggested. Liz is extremely conscientious and had every detail of our trip worked out. She is also the founder of a non-profit helping children in the region. You want to spend you money here. Very reasonable prices - you will not get a better deal.We were three women (two in our 40s and my 84 year old Mother In Law). We were comfortable and felt safe at all times. Trip of a lifetime. Highly recommend Authentic Morocco.

Brilliantly organised trip to Fes and the desert. The whole trip was brilliantly, very impressively organised, and the itinerary was spot on. We thoroughly appreciated the care and attention to detail in both the planning of our holiday and also in looking after us while we were in Morocco. Highlights included the Riad Salama in Fes which is a gem of a place. Deeply civilised, an oasis built with flair, style and expertise. Lovely staff and delicious food. Michel went out of his way to advise us and to help arrange our stay with him.  Camel trekking and the deep desert camp - an amazing experience - the children loved the desert playing on the dunes, even our near teenager! The luxury camp is beautiful, we loved the way the tents were furnished. Abdul was a fantastic host. The children just didn't want to leave the desert. The staff at the Dar El Janoub were charming and the food good. But can we suggest they put a cover on the swimming pool at night as the water was freezing?!? Ali our driver was super. He looked after us so well, was great with the children, and a good safe driver. Attentive, thoughtful, professional. We seemed to be the only family with young children touring Morocco, which is a shame as it is a fantastic experience for them. Thanks to Authentic Morocco we have had such an adventure and experience as a family, way beyond our expectations or even hopes when we booked. The children went back to school still wide-eyed at their own experiences.

Great Experience. My 18 year old daughter and i just returned from a fantastic trip to Morocco. Liz and everyone at Authentic Morocco did a great job in providing us with a truly unique, fascinating, and effortless experience. My brother and his daughter had traveled to Morocco two years ago and he highly recommended Authentic Morocco to me. We had never been to Africa and really needed assistance. Liz selected great hotels, a perfect camel trek experience in the Sahara, and a great driver and guide (both named Hassan and both were extremely professional, nice, friendly and very helpful). She provided many options for us and everything worked our perfectly without a hitch. We went through Marrakech, Ait Bennadou and the High Atas Mountains, Dades Gorges, Fes, and Chefchouen - all were fantastic in their own way. Great experience.

Amazing 6 day trip. I found Authentic Morocco via this site and thought I'd feed back my experience.I was amazed how quick Liz responded to my enquiry - we went back/fourth a few times about amount of days I could fit in and she made up an itinerary for what I asked - I really wanted to hit Fes, the Sahara, and also do a cooking class, and she proposed something that sounded great.Everything went amazingly smooth. The driver and guide I had were friendly and we got along really well over 4 days from Casablanca till Marrakesh. Fes blew my mind - what an amazing place, and the city guide was excellent. Be careful of the rug store there though, I suspect they trap and rip off a lot of tourists who don't realise you can barter down a lot or just walk out.The Sahara was amazing, and trekking through a camel through a sandstorm to a desert camp, cooking and eating a tagine in the dark and trekking back in the morning with a clear sunrise will be something I'll always remember. All the riads were very nice and the owners very friendly, food was often very good, and the same applies for the stops on the way. It's beneficial to know some basic French, so maybe good to brush up before heading over. Other than the cooking class, which was excellent, I didn't enjoy Marrakesh very much, at least after seeing Fes. So one recommendation would be to add more days in Fes as opposed to Marrakesh. It just didn't seem as friendly, didn't have that special "wow", the city guide was very average, and so on. Certainly worth the visit but also quite touristy and everything that comes with that is there.All in all an amazing experience, Liz runs a great outfit, and I'd certainly recommend this to everyone who plans to go to Morocco.

Great Tour Company. My husband and I just returned from Morocco and our tour with Authentic Morocco was fabulous. Liz was a great communicator from day 1 - always responding within a few hours of my email. Given the number of days we had (6), she put together a great tour starting in Fes and ending in Marrakesh by way of the Sahara dessert. We thoroughly enjoyed our driver,Alli. He was knowlegeable, professional, and a courteous driver. We stayed in some great riads and Kasbah's along the way and the desert camp she recommended couldnt have been nicer. We had a short (25 min) camel ride to our camp via the sunset, and then enjoyed the candelight dinner and quietness of the desert. Both the sunset and sunrise over the dunes was spectacular. Highly recommend Liz and her company!!

Excellent Moroccan Tour. Authentic Morocco have been a joy to deal with from the beginning! Liz is an extraordinary coordinator and her communication skills exemplary! We planned a tour to our satisfaction and thoroughly enjoyed our time with driver Idriss who became a friend! Touring Morocco can be daunting but wit Authentic Morocco all the drama is removed! Would I use them again? In a heartbeat!

Private Day Tour to Casablanca - Friday 10th October. I booked a private tour from Marrakech to Casablanca during my recent trip to Morocco and although it might have seemed a little pricey it was worth every penny.This company provided excellent service before the trip, providing me with all the information I needed to decide exactly what I wanted to see in Casablanca; the driver was extremely courteous and made sure my mum and I were comfortable the whole way and, even though his English was limited, he was able to communicate lots of information about the different sites we were seeing on our way. We couldn't have completed the journey we did on the train and we felt safe the whole time. The 4x4 was also nicely air conditioned, very important when travelling 3 or more hours.I would recommend and I would book with this company again if I went back to Morocco.

Once in a lifetime experience. This tour truely exceeded our expectations. It was a once in a lifetime experience I will never be able to beat. Company was so helpful through the entire process and our tour guide was extremely knowledgable with the country, culture and every other questions we had to throw at him. I would highly recommended this tour.

Top class. It was our first time in Morocco and we decided to take a private tour (over 8 days thereabouts). The tour was extremely well-run, every detail sorted out and we were very impressed. During the tour, we spent a night in the desert and a night with a nomadic Berber family so that was rather off the beaten track. Our guide spoke excellent English and we also had a safe driver. It was one of the best holidays we've been on, fuss-free and all.

First class service. My wife & I have just returned from a trip to Morocco.Basing ourselves in Marrakech, we used Authentic Morocco to arrange our side trips to the High Atlas, the Skoura Palm Grove and the Erg Chebbi dunes.I cannot praise Authentic Morocco and its owner, Liz Williams (based in Bristol, UK), highly enough. As someone else has commented, she tirelessly replied to all my pre-travel enquiries, however trivial, as though she was working purely on our little trip. Such a refreshing change in today's world of pre-canned customer non-service.The recommendations she made concerning accommodation, locale, & tours were excellent. Value for money & quality were first class.I gave a word of mouth recommendation to a friend based purely on Authentic Morocco's pre-trip service and will unhesitatingly do so to anyone else who asks me now we've actually done our trip. We are seriously considering returning to Morocco in the near future, and will go straight to Liz for our needs.

Great adventure. I do not want to repeat a lot of what many of the reviewers have already said. We met Mustapha, our guide, and Mustapha and Hussan, our drivers, in Marrakech. They came to our riad, collected our luggage (there were eight of us) and got us loaded up into their SUVs. It was immediately apparent that they were all great at their jobs. As one reviewer mentioned, Mustapha, our guide, had an encyclopedic knowledge of Morocco. Some of the people in our group are “fact finders” so we knew that his information was indeed accurate. He was funny, too, so we spent a lot of time laughing as well as learning. Hassan and Mustapha, the drivers, noticed if we were missing our camera, purse, or whatever we normally carry and made sure we did not leave valuables behind.
