Our trip took us through the Atlas mountains, off road to visit a nomad family, and of course, into the desert on camels. A few comments about this FABULOUS adventure: 1) If you cannot climb stairs or walk on uneven terrain, then the trip we did would be very difficult for you. You should probably ask the ever-accommodating Liz Williams to tailor something around your needs. 2) The hotels ranged from fairly nice to clean but nothing fancy. There were no elevators in the hotels, but the guides and hotel staff got the bags to our rooms. 3) We did the overnight camel trek, and two of us had camels with extra bony humps. We managed to figure out where to sit. It was COLD at night (we went at the end of March 2014) so be prepared for the season. The blankets were warm enough but I had my jacket wrapped around my head to keep warm. Dinner was provided at the camp, but not breakfast, so bring a granola bar and some water for breakfast. I thought it was great fun and I do not like to camp. Remember, there is no running water, so bring some hand sanitizer. 4) The visit to the nomad family was wonderful but we went a long way on rough terrain with no bathrooms. Also, we did not know before we left that the nomads could use things like warm glove and jackets. We could easily have brought some things with us. Ask Liz what is appropriate.As with all tours, we stopped at several shops to buy local items, but I was happy with our purchases. One place shipped items so I sent a couple of larger items by mail and received them about three weeks after our tour. There were so many beautiful, handcrafted things to buy in Morocco. Next time I will plan my luggage better. Our group ranged in age from 50s to 70s, and we all were able to do the trip without any problem. We REALLY enjoyed our tour with Authentic Morocco and all of us would highly recommend them.

Excellent arrangements. We used Authentic Morocco to help arrange our recent trip and were pleased at every level. Dealing with the owner was pleasant and easy, as she had seemingly unlimited time to reply to all of our (often redundant) questions, as well as a great understanding of how to translate our needs and desires into a meaningful experience in Morocco based on her knowledge. Our guide, Ali, was first rate and a real pleasure to spend time with. The facilities were all excellent. I would not hesitate to recommend Authentic Morocco.

Don't book with anyone else!. I'm a little late in my review, but my wife and I booked with Liz for our honeymoon in September 2013. Since this was a big trip for us, I put a lot of effort into getting multiple prices, talking to various companies on what they offer, etc. Knowing exactly what we wanted to see and do, Liz was very accommodating in arranging all the logistics and was SUBSTANTIALLY cheaper than all the other places we had priced out (for the exact same tours). She was very, very thorough in arranging all the small details. She even showed up at one of the Riads we had booked halfway through our trip to see how everything was going! There's A LOT of driving to do in Morocco, and all the drivers she had given us were fantastic. All were extremely friendly and knowledgeable, had a lot of insight you could only get from someone who had lived in the country their entire lives.I highly recommend Authentic Morocco. Do your research on different companies as I did, but know that Liz has an incredible network of hotel/Riad accommodations along with fantastic drivers...and chances are you will be very impressed!

Fantastic experience for my first trip to Morocco. I went to Morocco for the first time with my sister and on a friend's recommendation, we decided to organise our trip through Authentic Morocco. Liz was wonderful - very responsive throughout the whole process and she helped me to plan a private tour based on the number of days I had and cities/areas I was interested in. We visited Marrakesh, Essaouira, Imlil and Toubkal National Park in the High Atlas Mountains.Our driver Dris was great and all our transfers between cities and riads were seamless. The accommodation was fantastic - all in great locations in the medina (for Marrakesh and Essaouira) and very clean and comfortable (I told Liz my desired budget during the planning process), Liz also provided background information on Morocco i.e. dress, etiquette, which as first timers, we found very helpful.Thanks to Liz and the team at Authentic Morocco for making our first trip to Morocco such a great experience!

Excellence from start to finish. Before planning our trip to Morocco my wife and I spent several days reviewing the options available and wrote to several companies with our requests. From the very start, the service we received from Authentic Morocco surpassed the other companies, and we had no hesitation in going with them. We were not disappointed. From start to finish the service and attention to detail was excellent, and we felt that our experiences in Morocco were enhanced by the fact that we knew at all times we were in capable hands. We were able to relax and enjoy every moment. I should add that I have been to Morocco before, and we are not usually ones to work with travel companies. This time we decided to change our mode of travel, and were not for a moment disappointed with our decision.

absolutely wonderful - organised to perfection. During our recent travels in Morocco we decided to use Authentic Moroccon tours - it was truly amazing and organised to perfection. Our driver and guide were such great company, helpful, obliging and so much fun - ......Liz has a great knowledge and understanding of the country and we had such wonderful experiences with the accommodation, food etc. We would have no hesitation in recommending Authentic Moroccon Tours.

Honeymoon to remember in Marrakech. I have added the feedback that I provided to Liz at Authentic Morocco. Liz, our holiday, planned by you, in Morocco was outstanding! Everything was at and mostly above expectations. Every single person connected with our holiday in Marrakech, the Atlas mountains or Essaouira were superb and were terrific ambasadors for Morocco and Authentic Morocco. A special shout out to Dris, thank you so much. The accomodation you selected for us fitted exactly with our hopes, a truly Moroccan experience. Quality was exceptional, the hosts were marvellous and their staff were great. Many of they became friends, whom we hope to keep in touch with and hopefully meet again. Dris did a wonderful job, everyone that we expected to meet us was on time (ahead of time which was a great comfort) was very good at playing their part and completely managed that part of our journey so much so that there was far less for us to worry about presenting us with even more time to enjoy our time in Morocco. We put our trust in Liz and her team and they excelled. A honeymoon to remember for a lifetimeGlen & Kay

We usually travel independently, but loved this experience !. My review is a copy of a letter I sent to liz Williams....Just a quick note to thank you and your team for making our holiday in Morocco truly memorable! Both Mustafa and Omar were fantastic. Mustafa has a passion for history and a desire to learn and his English was fabulous. Omar was kind, and even though he doesn't speak a lot of English we were able to communicate through mustafa or by charades! He even invited us into his village home where we met his mother and cousins and had mint tea. The conditions for the Sahara were harsh, as it was hot and there was a sand storm. We felt the camel leader Amed, and Mohamed at the hotel really didn't communicate with us what was happening, or what to expect. The camp was spartan. The next morning was beautiful, still and cool. So, despite the above comments we all enjoyed the experience. It could have been better with more communication, and more of a welcome! ( perhaps a woman's touch ? )The hotels were all delightful, and great choices. We certainly feel we got to see many different aspects of Morocco and thoroughly enjoyed it.Again we can't express our gratitude enough to Mustafa and Omar who really went beyond their duty to make our time with them special.Thanks Liz, we really appreciate all the help you gave us formulating the itinerary Sent from my iPad

Best trip I've had in years. Authentic Morocco created a tour for our party of 6 friends in early March 2014. Our experience was excellent and I agree with many, if not all, of the positive sentiments expressed in other "excellent" reviews here.Liz Williams was indeed "extremely responsive, attentive and informative" (Michelle M), with a highly professional attitude but a personal and human touch.The guys who took care of us in Morocco were also very good, including our driver Hicham, guide Mustafa and their boss, Idris. They did everything they could to ensure that the tour was as we would like it.The tour itself (7/8 days) was well organised, and the accommodation was very good - there was one place (Chez Pierre) which served us a very nice dinner and breakfast, but the room I was in really needed some upkeep. Having said, that, the rooms that my friends had were fine. Everywhere else was superb.Additionally, and this is important, the whole trip was very good value and exceeded our expectations.I have since recommended Authentic Morocco to my friends, some of whom have gone and done the same trip and are equally pleased.

Amazing Moroccan adventure. We have just returned from an amazing 3 weeks in Morocco of which 9 days was organised by Authentic Morocco, a decision I'm so pleased to have made. Right from the outset I found Liz William to be extremely responsive, attentive and informative, nothing seemed to phase her, no question or enquiry too difficult tto answer. She certainly knows Morocco! Following a couple of days on Fes, we were collected by Omar (driver) and Ibrahim (guide) and spent our time in the desert with Amed (our guide/cook) and completing an Atlas Mountain trek with Abdul (guide) and Ibrahim (cook) before finishing our time with in imlil and finally Marrakech. Overall the experience was faultless, all members of the Authentic Morocco team were outstanding, always going above an beyond! I would highly recommend Authentic Morocco for your Morocco experience.

Honeymoon in Morocco. Just returned from a honeymoon trip in Morocco organized by Liz Williams with Authentic Morocco, an outstanding experience starting in Fes and ending in Marrakech via Ifrane, Midelt, Merzouga, Todra and Dades Gorges, Ouarzazate, and Ait Benhaddou. Liz is exceptionally responsive, both in the planning stages of the trip and during travel...I never waited more than 24 hours for a response to emails, and usually much less. My wife and I were able to plan each detail of our trip as we desired with our own driver, something impossible if you go with a "big box" tour company. The guides and drivers are carefully selected for their reliability...for a nation known for its laissez-faire attitude toward punctuality, all of our guides and drivers were always on time or early to meet us. I was originally nervous about visiting Morocco for a cultural adventure, having read tales of late transportation and unreliable infrastructure. Thanks to their long experience in the country, Authentic Morocco is able to short circuit all those risks and provide a hassle-free experience, something that was very important to me and my wife, being on our honeymoon. If we travel to Morocco again, Liz Williams will be the first person we contact.

Amazing Adventure. To celebrate my 50th birthday and as part of our annual vacation we decided to travel through Morroco. As independent travellers we have never used a tour company before. After exhaustive research I decided upon Authentic Morocco as I knew I could design my own program. Liz Williams owner/operator from the start was fabulous, responded to all questions promptly and always willing to help. We had flown into Casablanca and then flew from there to Marakesh - after a few days there we were collected from our Riad by Hachim our driver. From the word go Hachim ensured we were having a good time, he was able to answer all our questions, and we learnt a huge amount along the way. We visited numerous places but stayed in Skoura, the dunes (camped overnight) Ait Benhaddou, Imlil and Essaouira . We really felt we were able to experience a lot, valley, desert, mountains, and coastal! Would recommend all locations. As for our Riads and Villas all accomodation was absolutely superb no complaints whatsoever. We had 2 other drivers for our transfers who were also very efficient and professional. The vehicles used were comfortable and modern. Would definitely recommend anyone considering travelling through the countryside of Morroco to use this company. It was certainly a great way to celebrate my birthday.

We had high expectations, and Authentic Morocco exceeded them all. My family and I recently returned from a tour of Morocco organized by Liz Williams and operated by Authentic Morocco, and I must say that it was one of the best travel experiences we have ever had. During the months between when we booked the trip and when we touched down in Casablanca, we had built up very high expectations, in no small part due to the extremely high Trip Advisor reviews of Authentic Morocco. To make a long story short, all of our expectations were not only met but exceeded. Over the years we have been fortunate to travel around the world and visit many interesting places, but our time in Morocco was certainly one of the best trips we have ever taken. Not only because of the people and country itself, but because of the itinerary Liz set up for us and the guides she employed. Our main guide, Ilyas, and driver, Omar, were extremely professional and knowledgeable, and they did a wonderful job. Although we were in a very foreign land, they both made us feel like we were among family. They did not just simply explain the significance of every site we saw, but they were also eager to answer each and every question we had about Moroccan history and culture in general; no question or request was too small for them to answer or accommodate. Additionally, every local tour guide we had was great, and we especially appreciated our Rabat tour guide – Fadin. Finally, I must comment on Liz Williams herself - she was a real pleasure to deal with. I emailed her dozens of times with random questions and requests in the weeks before our trip, and she always responded to me in an almost unbelievably quick and detailed manner. Although I'm sure she was juggling many different tours and groups at the same time, I often felt as if she was my private travel agent because of the attention she gave my family and our questions. I will gladly recommend Liz and Authentic Morocco to anyone considering a Moroccan adventure.

Amazing Morocco Adventure. Our Authentic Morocco tour was amazing! We are so grateful to Liz Williams for arranging such an excellent experience. Every detail was handled with perfect professionalism and we never had to worry about a thing during our 6 day tour around the country. I also appreciated that she communicated with me directly about everything and answered all my questions promptly and efficiently.We are especially thankful to Liz for providing us with a fabulous guide and driver. Both were exceptional. They were professional from start to finish. Achmed's knowledge of Morocco is fabulous and in addition to the information normally provided, he answered every question we asked..and believe me, we had a lot of them. And Omar was a fantastic driver. In many areas the roads were often narrow and curvy and at times congested but he always handled our vehicle with the utmost poise and precision. And the drive he took us on around the dunes was phenomenal. We are in awe of his talent. I can't say enough about how much we appreciate both these gentleman. They were always on time, always helpful, and they went out of their way to make this a wonderful journey for us. Our trip was marvelous in large part because of both of them. We also enjoyed the Ryads we stayed at (especially La Salama in Fez!). I wondered if I should book my own accommodations (which I did in Marrakech at the end of the tour) and I am so glad I did not do this and let Liz handle this. She is a terrific job of selecting ideal accommodations that were beautiful, clean, well maintained, professional run etc.Also our city guides in Meknes and Fes were excellent.  We thoroughly enjoyed the camel trek into the desert and the overnight camp. Our only real down side was how discouraged we were to see so much litter in the desert and especially around the camp site. We took seriously and really agree with the point we read to bring out what you bring in and it was disheartening to see so much trash strewn about (toilet paper, tampon applicators, water and wine bottles, plastic bags).Overall we highly recommend Liz Williams and Authentic Morocco. She is a consummate professional who knows her business.

Couldn't Have Had A Better Tour Of Morocco. My husband and I just returned from a fantastic tour of Morocco with Authentic Morocco Tours. From my first contact with Liz Williams in October until we said good-by to our driver and guide on the last day of our ten day tour in late May, we felt very cared for by an extremely professional and knowledgeable tour company and staff. Liz was extremely helpful in planning our trip with me, made some great suggestions and promptly answered countless e-mails from October until the tour began in mid-May. Her understanding of the culture, geography, sites, places to stay, and driving time and distances, is outstanding and helped her create a perfect itinerary for our tour.  We were picked up by our driver Hassan and guide Mustapha at the ferry port in Tangiers and our wonderful journey began. We visited Chefchaouen, the roman ruins at Volubilis,Meknes, and Fez, crossed the Middle Atlas mountains, saw the Ziz Valley gorges, spent the night in a tent in the small dunes, visited Skoura, the Todra Gorge, rose valley, visited Ait Benhaddou, the Ounila Valley, crossed the High Atlas mountains and spent our last few days in Marrakesh. From the beginning Hassan and Mustapha were fantastic travel companions. They were both friendly, helpful, polite, and extremely accommodating to our requests. It was such a pleasure to spend time with them and learn so much about just a dramatically different and interesting culture. They were always prompt and very thoughtful . Mustapha always accompanied us to the riad where we were staying and made sure that we were properly settled before leaving us and always told us to call him if we needed anything. The added bonus is that both are also very funny and lots of fun to be with. The riads we stayed in exceeded our expectations. They were lovely, served great food, had very attentive and friendly staff and were well located. We couldn't have asked for more.  In short, we had an amazing tour of Morocco and highly recommend Authentic Morocco to anyone who plans a trip there.

Authentic Morocco. We just returned from a 10-day trip throughout Morocco that we booked through Authentic Morocco. It was wonderful! We had both a driver and English-speaking guide (Hassan and Mustafa) and visited Rabat, Fes and Marrakesh, along with a lot of smaller cities and spent one night in the desert. We really enjoyed not being part of a group, but instead could get to know places more intimately. Mustafa and Hassan were very attentive and flexible about our interests and what we wanted to see. They didn't rush us anywhere and we weren't stuck on a tight timetable like the typical tours.Liz at Authentic Morocco was very responsive to my requests and worked with me to craft an itinerary that worked for my husband and I. We really loved the riads we stayed in. They were beautiful, very attentive staff, great food and close to everything. Overall, it was a fantastic trip and we highly recommend Authentic Morocco!

An Amazing Visit to the Desert. Our excursion to the desert was absolutely wonderful! Liz was so helpful in designing the excursion that we envisioned for our first trip to Morocco and the desert. Everything was perfect and our guides were so nice, helpful, accommodating and informative. I highly recommend sleeping in the desert with a nomadic Berber family--it was just my girlfriend and I and our guide with the Berber family and the enormous majestic sand dunes all around us. We trekked to the "camp" by camel, spent the hot part of the day under a tiny oasis of palm trees, and then climbed 45 minutes to the top of a biggest sand dune we could find for a spectacular sunset and a breathtaking panoramic view of the Sahara desert. I will never forget that day, and Liz made it happen. I highly recommend Authentic Morocco for your unforgettable visit to Morocco.

Great Services & Attention to Detail. 4 day private tour - Marrakech - Desert - MarrakechWe started planning our trip about 4 months before we left. We dealt with Liz via email and she always responded so quickly and with all of the information I requested. Liz was fantastic throughout the entire tour, ensuring we had everything we needed, payment was smooth and easy and no email or question was ever a bother.We were picked up promptly on time and the tour started. We unfortunately had no guide on our first day due to his mother being in hospital - these things can't be helped. Our driver, Omar who spoke no Engligh was fantastic. He made sure we stopped at all of the right places to get great photos. He made sure we were looked after at lunch and meet our local guide at our stop. We were met by our guide on day two and the tour went on as planned. The accommodation that was booked was lovely - comfortable beds, large rooms and nice bathrooms.Our night in the desert was amazing - met by our local guide who took us in to the desert - cooked us dinner and made sure we were looked after.There is quite a lot of driving - but this is to be expected and is very clear in the itinerary so shouldn't be a shock. At times, our guide was difficult to understand and it was difficult to have a conversation with him. This was communicated back to Liz after the tour. It was the first time this particular guide was used (as our original guide couldn't make it as his mother was in hospital).Liz followed up after the tour to ensure everything was to our standards.I would recommend using Authentic Morocco - from beginning to end, it was a pleasure dealing with Liz.

Should be called Perfect Morocco. Liz Williams and her team made a lifetime's worth of memories for our family. We booked a week long, private tour from Fes, to the desert, back over the mountains and eventually to Marrakech. Every detail was coordinated flawlessly, making the drive time seem like nothing, while showing us all of the beauty and hospitality of this wonderful country.Liz worked within the budget that we set up for the beginning and incorporated some of the most beautiful hotels we have ever seen. Our guides, especially Mustapha and Hirchim, made this trip. They were incredibly friendly, knowledgable, and warm to our children (ages 5 and 10). And it was uniquely authentic. In one town, we were stopping for lunch, but as we drove in, we passed all of the other tour busses and 4x4s parked at the same big restaurant, took a left and enjoyed a private lunch in a home. Wow.I would (and have) recommend Authentic Morocco to anyone who will listen. It is the way to see this country.

Amazing Desert Tour. We loved the trip. Hassan and Mustaffa, our driver and guide, were prompt, polite, funny, helpful, and thoughtful. Hassan is a very good driver and always tried to limit bouncing in the back of the car. He handled all traffic issues perfectly and we never felt concern for our safety on the roads at any time. They always found bathroom places when needed and were always engaged and willing to take pictures etc. Both are very proud of their heritage and that was lovely lesson for us.We liked all of the places we stayed. Chez Pierre was delightful and the food delicious and a nice change of pace. The camel ride and tent stay was amazing! It was far more than we expected. Both young men were gracious, thoughtful, charming and helpful. We would recommend this trip to anyone. It was the highlight of a very fun and interesting 3 weeks in Morocco. Thank you so much for all of the help in planning and for creating such an fabulous experience for us.

The only Morocco is Authentic. If you are planning a trip to Morocco there is only one choice for booking arrangements: Authentic Morocco. I am an experienced traveler and this company was the most responsive, supportive and expert I have ever used in 40 years of journeys. This company approaches each client as though they are the only one. No question, or request was too great or outside the paid plan. The driver stopped wherever, whenever we wanted: totally at our disposal. Very expert and considerate driver Arnaud and guide Radwan made us feel totally comfortable, at ease and well informed. Driss is an excellent coordinator and director that sets the tone for the staff. The Riads used were fabulous. The company was flexible anytime we wanted to make a change or add a request. There is only one company you'll want to book with and this is it. Authentic Morocco.

If you want to go to Morocco book with Authentic Morocco.. First, if you are thinking about going to Morocco, go. Now that you're going, book with Liz and Authentic Morocco. I am glad I did and will again when I head back to Morocco.I wanted to go to Morocco, but not on a group tour. Being a woman traveling with two other women, I was not comfortable traveling on my own. Fortunately I found Liz and Authetnic.Liz was able to put together a fantastic itinerary and was very responsive to my questions and needs for the tour.We were met by Idriss in Marrakech who was incredibly helpful getting us to our Riad and helping us by SIM cards for the trip. He even coordinated with the airline/airport since we arrived without our bags!Radwan and Arnot then picked us up and drive us around Morocco for the next 5 days. They were incredible! I saw things I'm convinced no traditional tourist would ever see. They were polite, friendly, helpful and showed me the beauty of their country.I'm so happy I found Liz and Authentic Morocco!

Authentic Morocco. We booked the Fez to Erg Chebbi sand dunes to Skoura to Marrakesh trip. You can do this in 3 days but we elongated to 4, stopping the first night in Midelt. The extra day really helped the two children (aged 10 and 8) - otherwise day 1 would be really long and you would miss the opportunity for lovely stops along the way. The 2 hotels we used (in Midelt and Skoura) were lovely, and our guide was terrific. The camel / sand dune experience was tremendous - it's rewarding (if strenuous) to climb the dune for both sunset and sunrise. I would recommend Authentic Morocco to anyone wishing to embark upon this adventure.

Fantastic Experience!. My two friends and I booked a three day trip from Fes to deep desert and back to Fes. Our guide and driver were absolutely fantastic- they were fun, helpful, and very knowledgeable. We could not have survived in the desert without them! Liz coordinated every detail of our trip, from our pickup in Fes to what we'd be doing on our free day. Every second was planned and we were so grateful. The price for our tour could not be beat. At times it felt very touristy, but I feel like that's probably the only way a non-Arabic/French/Berber speaking person can get through a trip to this region.

Authentic Morocco Great Tour. We did a five day Authentic Morocco tour from Marrakech to Fes through the Atlas Mountains, and the gorges on the other side, a world heritage site and overnight at a deep desert camp.The desert camp at Erb Chebbi was my favorite part of the trip with the camel trek and the dunes.Authentic Morocco arranged everything with great B&B's along the way providing breakfast and dinner. We also asked Authentic Morocco to arrange stays for us in Marrakech and Fes and the Riads they chose were excellent and beautiful. We thoroughly enjoyed our visit to Morocco.

Authenic Morocco. Authentic Morocco made our tour of the country stress free and fascinating! Liz, with great efficiency and ease, turned our bare bones outline of a trip into a specific plan including a 5 day tour from Marrakech to Fes. Additional very reasonable add-ons for our independent time in the cities [recommendations for excellent riads and 'meet and greet' at airports/train stations to ease initial confusion] were well worth while. Highlights of our time: experiencing Marrakech, our day long city tour of Fes, the overnight in the Sahara nomad camp complete with a campfire, tent and stars. Morocco is a country of wonderful people and a dramatically different and ancient culture; supported by the staff of Authentic Morocco, who live and work there, we were able to feel comfortable and totally enjoy our time in Morocco

Pretty good customized trip. We were looking for a customized trip from Fes to Marrakesh that would involve sightseeing, day hikes and an overnight camel ride. Liz was helpful in putting together the itinerary in order for us to have time to do the various activities we wanted, suggesting different options given the length of our trip. When we were actually on our trip I realized her concerns about length of time to travel to different places because the posted distance often seemed to take longer to drive than one would surmise given the posted speed limit that our driver would be going. Our camel trip was touristy (I am not sure how this sort of thing isn't a little kitschy) yet still loads of fun, and we loved watching the sun both set and rise over the dunes. While our driver spoke Arabic and French but no English, our guide spoke English passably, and both were interested in showing us things about the local culture and places. For example, we wanted to learn how to cook tagine, and our guide and driver both helped us to do so over a portable gas stove along the M'Gouna River with meat bought from a local butcher and vegetables, spices and a tagine from the local market. We stated up front we were not interested in shopping and were not steered into any shops. Our guide and driver were courteous, prompt and approachable. Our guide sought feedback often to assist with planning for the next day based on our itinerary. We learned a lot and had fun. Thanks for a great trip!

in the hands of local experts. We have just returned from a trip to Morocco organised by Authentic Morocco.They used local knowledge and local guides to make our trip incredibly special. Their suggestions for places to stay proved spot on. We indicated our preferred budget and they found perfect boutique accommodation. We wanted some adventure and they advised a stay in the Atlas Mountains in the most beautiful Kasbah imaginable. We trekked in the mountains and the guide they arranged was from a nearby mountain village. He spoke excellent French and English and we felt safe in his hands. All transfers were efficient and drivers spoke good English.The whole team really knows its stuff.We would not hesitate to use them again and certainly would recommend them to anyone who wants an experience with the benefit of local knowledge.

The perfect tour in every way. Our tour with Authentic Morocco could not have been better. From our wonderful driver who picked us up in Fes, to the incredible guide who took us on the camel trek into the desert for an overnight stay - everything was handled with utmost professionalism, care and consideration of our needs. The experience was intimate and felt very much authentic. I cannot recommend the tour highly enough for those looking to do an overnight desert stay for a taste of Morocco.

Everything we were looking for. My wife and I chose this company largely based on the reviews that we had read on it. We were looking for a driver and car for the majority of our tour in Morocco (about 10 days), that was reasonable. Authentic Morocco was all of that and more.My first and main contact was with Liz Williams, the manager. She was timely and responsive to all of my inquiries and also offered helpful and candid suggestions (eg. is it worth visiting the Tin Mal Mosque? --- No! Unless you want to add 4 hours to your journey - the photographer side of me is still kicking myself for not doing it, but the rest of my body and my wife are thanking me for not having had to sit through a longer car ride).The price that she quoted I thought was very reasonable for what we were asking for.All of the accommodations that were booked were excellent, and we had absolutely no qualms with any of them. They met or exceeded our expectations. For the first part of our trip (Fes to the desert to Marrakech), we had Ali as our driver/guide. He was friendly, punctual, knowledgeable, spoke very good English, accommodating to any requests that we had (eg. stop here for a picture, bathroom stop etc.), and a safe driver (the car was also clean). After Marrakech (Marrakech to Tiznit), we had a combination of a driver (non English Speaking) and a guide (Englsh Speaking): Mustapha and Mustapha. While I would have preferred to have had Ali throughout, both Mustapha and Mustapha were very good also. (I think that the change was done due to scheduling and due to the knowledge/expertise of different guides in different areas of Morocco).I would happily recommend them to anyone looking for a travel company in Morocco.We traveled in Morocco with Authentic Morocco from approximately Feb 17-26, 2014.

Outstanding. I read many reviews prior to selecting Authentic Morocco tours as my tour of choice. To say the least, all the other reviews were correct. EVERYTHING you planned and all of your staff were outstanding. From the moment I arrived at my first hotel until I left Ali I was in the best of care. Each guest house was outstanding. Because of spending several days in Fes I was able to enjoy the home and staff to the point where I felt like family. I was able to join in conversations in the evening, from the cooks to the house staff I was able to enjoy what felt like genuine love and laughter. While not everyone would enjoy such fellowship, I must say traveling alone, I enjoy the opportunity to meet new friends and have joyous conversation. Each tour guide went out of their way to give me amble time to enjoy each site and yet provide guidance when it was time to move on. I found it most interesting that one guest house could recommend another and I certainly enjoyed each guest house where I lodged. In terms of Ali, I could not have had a better guide. I have been blessed to have traveled in many countries with many guides and by far, Ali was one of the best, most helpful and attentive guides I have ever enjoyed. Being alone on the tour certainly enables me to have a closer relationship than some may be able to enjoy but Ali clearly learned what was important to me, would recommend places for photography, NEVER rushed me(which has happened on some tours) and in general made me laugh a great deal. I found Ali to be a great friend. In all of my ramblings, I would simply say what your other reviews have said, You and your team ARE THE BEST. Thank you for making my first visit to Morocco and outstanding experience. I hope I will one day enjoy a different part of the country.blessings to you in all you do. Thank you for providing a wonderful, experience, the integrity of your service means so much.Sincerely,R. J.Fisher

Well organised, efficient and friendly. We had a week in Morocco organised by Authentic Morocco. Everything went exactly as planned, and Liz was extremely helpful throughout. The local drivers and guides were all very helpful and more than willing to adapt to our timings and needs. We had a day trip round Marrakech and the Majorelle Gardens, and another up into the Ourika Valley - both were just what we had wanted, and our driver more than willingly turned into a guide to escort us up to the first cascade. We'd be pleased to go with Authentic Morocco again.

A Great Experience. My husband and I just returned from a trip to Morocco where we did a three day trip with Authentic Morocco from Marrakech to Fes. Liz Williams, the owner of Authentic Morocco was wonderful to work with. Each time I reached to her, I received a prompt response. She is very friendly and considerate and ensures that you will have a good experience. Our tour guide was fabulous as well. Informative, kind, considerate and went out of his way to ensure we enjoyed our trip. Ditto for our driver. The desert camel ride was amazing! The Sahara dunes are outstanding. Our camp was better than we expected as well. Great dinner and fun around the fire afterward. The sleeping conditions were completely adequate considering you are camping out in the desert. They even had a port-a-pot! Although there is a lot of driving, seeing the countryside of Morocco was fascinating. I would, however, recommend doing this trip over 4 days instead of just 3. It will break-up the long drives. If we return to Morocco, we will definitely consider another trip with Authentic Morocco!

Fabulous trip organized by Authentic Morocco. My daughter is a teacher and had seven days to spend in Morocco. Given the number of cities that we wanted to visit and the distances to cover, we decided to have Authentic Morocco organize the entire trip for us. It was six days and seven nights and Liz quickly responded to my initial email with two different itineraries for that time period. We selected the Fez, High Atlas, Skoura, Marrakesh itinerary and other than paying for the trip, our parts of the planning was done! We were picked up at the Casablanca Airport and driven to Fez for the start of our adventure. We have Mustapha the driver and Mustapha the guide and both could not have been nicer, more helpful, etc. Mustapha, the guide, knows so much history of Morocco and he was such an asset to have during the car rides between locations. Both men went out of their ways to make our trip very special. The hotels were wonderful, the landscape beautiful, the desert overnight incredible etc. The only downside of the trip was our last night in Casablanca at the Hyatt, which we had booked on our own. It was a rude re-entry into typical customer service after being so well taken care of by Authentic Morocco. I would recommend this company to anyone looking for a well organized, comprehensive tour company for Morocco.

Exceeded our expectations!. We were hesitant to book a three day tour from Marrakesh to Fez, but we are so glad we did thanks to the outstanding work by Authentic Morocco. This is the company to use when booking a tour. Liz is very attentive to customer needs. She was in constant contact with us to ensure that the trip was planned with our plans in mind. We were hesitant to book a quick tour- afraid that it would feel like a package where we are shuffled to shops and stops. Liz made sure to adapt the itinerary to our needs and in the end, we got to do exactly what we wanted. Our guide, Samir, was outstanding. As was our driver, Hassan. You will be lucky if you have them. They tailored the trip to meet our needs and answered all of our questions.The only draw back were the lunch stops. All were at high priced, mediocre meal, tourist bus restaurants. It was our fault for not researching and choosing lunch stops- you should choose your own if you book with them!

Amazing Morocco. I recently returned from a 10 night trip to Morocco - 4 nights spend on a tour from Marrakech to Fes with Authentic Morocco Tours. The driver and tour guide were delightful and very helpful! The accommodation was extremely authentic and we loved the whole trip! I could highly recommend this tour as a great way to see Morocco!

An Unbelievable Well Planned and Organized Adventure!. I cannot say enough good things about Authentic Morocco and Liz Williams. Liz was wonderful about communicating and paid great attention to every last detail tailoring our trip just as we wanted (important to a family of six with four teenagers!). Our driver, Khalid was prompt, looked after us, drove exceptionally and spoke very good English. Camel trekking was a highlight but so was getting to see and experience a Morocco we would have missed if we stuck to the main roads. Liz and Authentic Morocco were the best!

What an amazing experience!. We used Authentic Morocco this past January 2014. I found Liz and the company online and used trip advisor. Everything was perfect! I would say we are a pretty well traveled group and have a high aptitude for all things service - hotel, restaraunts, etc. Everything met our expectations. Working with Liz was very pleasant, she listened to my needs, desires, offered in put and we built out a great itinerary for what we needed. We were meeting frinds in Marrakech so only needed guidance a short time (Monday - Wednesday). Our drier Ali was the best!!!! So nice, sweet, totally understood our wants and desires and executed. He was helpful, resourceful, had a great sense of humor, was respectful, and I appreciated being in his care. It was like travelling with a big brother, friend, expert, etc. 3. The car was lovely and everything went off without a hitch. All the accomodations were up to par, and the service was great. Morocco is a great country! I would use Liz and this company in a heartbeat. I was able to have the trip I wanted and see/experience what I wanted to do.

Memorable Trip. My family and I went through Marrakech, Fez and Rabat. Including berber villages and the desert. We thoroughly enjoyed Morocco through the riads, food, medina, and most of all the desert camp. We didn't want the typical touristy trip, so we chose authentic morocco because I felt as if you get a REAL experience of Morocco. Liz created the custom trip exactly how we wanted it and we loved every minute of it. The hosts at the riads were so warm and hospitable, it felt as if we were right at home. Everyone was so nice and welcoming, even the locals we ran into on the streets. All our tour guides were knowledgeable and very informative. Also the driver was great and got us from one place to another safely even if there was bad traffic. My grandparents had trouble walking and the company provided wheelchairs for us, which I thought was very nice of them. Liz and her staff are amazing! I would definitely recommend them!

Authentic Morocco = Best.. I have nothing but the highest praise for this tour company. Every person I dealt with exhibited nothing but 100% professionalism, responsiveness and kindness – including Liz (with whom I communicated via e-mail prior to, and during, my trip), Mustafa #1 (my guide), Mustafa #2 (my driver), and Driss (who dropped me off at the airport on my final day). I was a solo female traveler to Marrakech for 4 days, and I was slightly trepid about the whole thing, but once I got there, I quickly realized I had nothing to worry about. Liz and her folks took very good care of me, made me feel safe, answered all my questions, and entertained my off-the-path requests. Specifically, I had planned a day trip to Essaouira and a half-day hike at Toubkal National Park, and both excursions were on par with excellence. And this whole trip was accomplished neatly within my budget! Authentic Morocco exceeded all my expectations - and then some. Look no further for a touring company!

An Exceptional Company. We used Authentic Morocco to organise our recent visit to Morocco. They arranged a 3 day visit to the deep Sahara, walking tours in Marrakech and Fes and a return trip by car from Fes to Marrakech.The entire organisation of the trip was excellent. As nearly all reviewers have noted, Liz Williams did an outstanding job on answering all questions, making recommendations and general advice. All the local staff we met were professional and competent. A special mention for Adil (our driver) who was outstanding on some very hair raising and long drives, and Mustapha (our guide) who, besides being charming, had an absolutely encyclopaedic knowledge of his country. There wasn't a single question we fired at him that he couldn't answer. We would also like to thank Bakkar, our camel guide, for all his assistance in the deep Sahara. We are specially grateful to Liz for organising a car back from Fes to Marrakech at very short notice. We had meant to take the train but my husband fell ill and we had to unexpectedly hire a car and driver. We made a single phone call to Liz and a few emails later, it was arranged. Again, we were provided with a Toyota Land Cruiser and a great driver. It must have been arranged under difficult circumstances as there was a film festival on-going in Marrakech and our driver said that transport vehicles were scarce. It was great service. We would also like to comment on 2 very special aspects of the company not generally noted in the reviews. First, this is a company with a social conscience. The Children of the Sahara a foundation established by the company raises funds for project and programs for the nomadic Berber children. Mustapha explained some of the fund raising efforts undertaken and highly commendable projects supported. Second, it is a company run with integrity. When initially organising the tour, we asked Liz for a recommendation on hiring a car and driver through the company or taking the train back from Fes to Marrakech. Rather than choosing the first option which would have benefited her company, she recommended the train at a fraction of the cost. In a highly competitive travel industry, such advice deserves a lot of respect. We hope to return to Morocco again sometime in the future. All our travel arrangements will, of course, be done by Authentic Morocco. We have no hesitation in recommending this exceeptional company to all fellow travellers.

Best way to go over the Atlas Mtns. We paid for a one day private tour to Ait Benhaddou. Trust me...don't drive in Morocco...it's a zoo! We had originally planned to hire a car and I am glad we didn't. Our Authentic Morocco driver knew all the 'hidden' sights to see and we would have never found them on our own due to the poor signage in Morocco. Our driver was courteous and safe. He didn't take any chances over-taking other vehicles. The car was clean and roomy. He arrived on time and had us back at our hotel on time. Highly recommend.

Authentic Morocco was first rate. Four of us booked our trip through Authentic Morocco. We were impressed with the detailed support we got from them in the planning stages. We found our driver a fantastic blend of excellent driving, flexibility and patience and information here and there. His english was fine. Guides in the cities were great. The hotels and riads and casbah we stayed at were a wonderful part of the experience. Liz of Authentic Morocco was always available by email and phone and thoughtfully answered questions and adjusted our trip if we needed to make a change. For instance, when I realized how much of a role bread plays in the diet, I wrote Liz and asked for suggestions for my gluten allergy. She promptly notified all the places we were staying and thought of strategies for me to supplement my diet. We couldn't be happier with this organization.

A Fun,Interesting,Personable,Diverse and Safe Tour. We would highly recommend Liz Williams and her company ‘Authentic Morocco’. All our queries were answered promptly by Liz who has a wealth of knowledge about all aspects of travelling in Morocco. Our guide Mustapha was knowledgeable and personable and our driver Anwar was a friendly and very safe driver. Two cities that you should not miss are Chefchaouen and Fes. Meknes, the old imperial city often overlooked, has several wonderful sites and is worth a visit. We like seeing vanishing cultures so our camel trek and camping in L'Erg Chebbi dunes with the Berber Nomads,as well as visiting Berber Villages in the High Atlas, were great experiences. Many of the places in the High Atlas we had all to ourselves!

We had a day a great day out of the city with Authentic Tours. Because of all of the reviews on this web site, we booked an 'Authentic Tours' trip from Marrakech to Ait Benhaddou & Telouet. This was a one day tour and it was great.. the driver Ibrahim picked us up early from our Riad and he spoke good English (which was a big plus as we don't speak Berber!). From the start he made us feel very welcome.. he also made us laugh a lot and engaged all of the family (6 of us!)The van was new and was really comfortable (I was expecting a truck!) and it had air con.. as it was nearly 40c on the day, this was much needed! Maybe more importantly, we felt safe with the driver (a big plus for anyone who knows the roads there!)Ibrahim checked in with us during the trip to make sure we were all OK and he was happy to stop for us to take photographs.. he was also very informative about the sites and the region. I know it sounds cheesy - but the trip was the highlight of our holiday !

Authentic Morocco Best Tour company. Marrakech, Morocco is a destination and Authentic Morocco tours is 5 stars.My sister and I visited Marrakech for a week in May and had the best experience.We felt completely taken care of by the arrangements and itineraries we worked out with Liz, the owner.It was easy to finalize plans beginning with a guide from the airport to our riad, then a half day tour to get our bearings in the area, and two days later a drive over the Atlas Mountains to Ouzazzarte and a night along the caravan trail. The guides shared a wealth of the Berber culture when asked, and this is what we wanted.Learning the history by being there. A great trip and tour company.Highly recommend.

AMAZING trip!. Spent 6 days in Morocco with my family using Authentic Morocco. Liz was amazing from the very beginning- responded to my emails immediately, helped plan out the perfect itinerary for us and was very personal and flexible. In fact, during the trip itself we asked to change the itinerary a bit- all it took was one phone call and things were settled.All guides and drivers were extremely knowledgeable, nice and courteous. They spoke English well and answered all our questions patiently.The riad chosen for us was beautiful, in a great location and an amazing staff.Throughout the trip we felt cared for and secure. We learned a lot and enjoyed every minute. Already planning our next trip!

Authentic Morocco rocks!. Liz was fantastic and helped us figured out exactly what we wanted to see and do, and then worked with us to come up with an itinerary that covered everything that we wanted to do without burning out the kids. We were a group of 4 adults and 2 kids (ages 9 and 11) and spent 7 nights in Morocco. She was polite, patient and offered some really good advice, which could only come from experience. I felt that together we were able to tailor an itinerary that was perfect for us. And for that kind of service – the price was right!The trip itself was wonderful. We couldn't have imagined a more perfect trip. Omar was great - he was patient with us, even with our numerous questions and stops for shopping. All the riads we stayed in were fabulous - small, family owned and gave us a real taste of Morocco. The deep desert camp in Erb Chebbi was such a surreal experience that will stay with all of us forever - it's highly recommended. We met lots of great people, ate some really good food and experienced a trip of a lifetime. We would not have had the same experience on our own, without the services of Authentic Morocco. We’re already talking about where we would like to go when we visit next time....whenever that may be. If we ever do, we will definitely be contacting Authentic Morocco to help us arrange our next visit.

Great trip to Morocco. We had 5 nights and 6 days in Morocco most spent with our happy and very accommodating guide,Omar. LIz was great with the organisation and Morocco was a wonderful surprise for my husband and myself. We wanted to vist the countryside, but not the desert. We were collected from the ferry at Tangier and then through the Rif Mtns to Fes, on to the waterfalls at Ouzoud and through the Middle Atlas to Marrakech. The Riads were fantastic and so was the food. We found Casablanca an interesting mix with the flash new tram way and the old medina. The Mohammed V Mosque was also interesting. Would very happily recommend Authentic Morocco to anyone. Being able to plan just what you wanted to see was just perfect.

Dependable, Reliable, Affordable, Honest, Excellent Guides!. Liz, the owner of Authentic Morocco definitely has the travel industry figured out! She quickly answered my emails and prepared the best vacation for myself and my 10 year old daughter. We were taken care of every step of the way. We were offered a local guide at every city which was fabulous! Each guide was knowledgable, respectful and happy! We used Mustapha and Hamza and we could not be happier with their service, our car and the recommended Riads. Thank you Liz and employees of Authentic Morocco. I am a seasoned traveler and I never do tours but I will contact Authentic Morocco in the near future as I am not finished with the wonderful country of Morocco! Inshallah.

Top Quality service. Liz and his local team are amazing!!! Liz is so kind since the very begining, giving you advices and tips that you won't find anywhere else. She is like your private guide in Marocco. I was confused about wich cities were the best ones, how we could get from one to another and Liz made all the plans right away, indicating the best places to stay and to eat. I had the chance to meet her twice and she is so gentle you think she's a distant relative that you do like, but you don't see very often. We visited more than 4 cities in 8 days and had no relevant problems at all. All the transfers were on time (except the train we lost due to Marrakech trafficc), all the local people (driver, guides etc) were kind and collaborative. Some minor problems that I related to Liz (and I'm sure she is working hard on that) included: a very bad restaurant indicated by his guide on Meknes and a guide in Fes that was a bit "pushy". Overall, if you do business with Liz and her Authentic Morocco, we'll be in very good hands. Just have fun in Morocco!! (and DO consider Liz's tips about hotels and restaurants!!)

Top Notch Tours and Service. During a recent tour to Morocco and Marrakech my wife and I used Authentic Morocco to arrange some local tours for us, both in the cities and outside. Arranging the tours and doing the planning was superb -- Liz was helpful in recommendations and extremely responsive. She took the worries out of dealing with a foreign company. Each of the tours was excellent, but we particularly enjoyed the tour to the desert and to Tin Mal and Imlil in the High Atlas. The drivers/guides were absolutely fantastic -- spoke good English and were very knowledgeable. The vehicles were well maintained and comfortable. I've used many guides, agents, and agencies over the years to arrange day tours and provide guide services. Authentic Morocco goes to the head of the class. I highly recommend them. If you would like more details just send me a message on Trip Advisor and I'll get back to you soonest.

Great way to see Morocco. We are just back from 10 days there. Liz and Authentic Morocco were as good as everyone here says. We did Essaouira, Marrakech, Ouzoud, the Atlas Mountains and Fez. We had two different guides/drivers because we did several days in Marrakech on our own - we like to get to cities and experience them that way. Yet in Fez we spent the first day with a guide provided by Authentic Morocco who was marvellous. A two or three hour tour turned into nearly six. He, and the two guides/drivers, were all a real pleasure to be with. We learned so much about the Berbers and their history. On travel days we asked to stop a lot. I shot about 2,400 pictures. At one point we stopped near a shepherd who was quite happy to let me see what he was up to - even posed for some great pictures. Liz did a great job with our itinerary. The riads were terrific. This is a brilliant way to see Morocco. Lahsen and Ali, if you read this, THANKS!!! It was great to get to know you. We plan to come back to see the dessert.

Authentic Morocco Tours = Authentic Experiences. I have never taken a tour and usually don’t engage guides but happened upon Liz Williams from Authentic Morocco and had the time of my life.Before arriving in Morocco I raised money to drive a micro-financing project for rural Berber women. The project provides goats and is supporting the women in setting up a community based project producing cheese and thereby providing them with a sustainable income. I did this with the help of Liz Williams, a founding member of Children of Sahara, a Foundation that cuts out all the middlemen so that there is no money wasted - that is, we bought the goats ourselves and delivered them directly to the women in the village. Liz Williams is also the brainchild of Authentic Morocco, a private tour operator in Morocco, so we were able to merge the two experiences into one - contributing to the local community as we travelled through the south of Morocco.I was raptured by the experience - not just with Liz’s commitment to the Berber women, which is so commendable in itself, but also by the opportunity to contribute and experience aspects or the Moroccan culture not typically available to tourists.Liz and her wonderful English speaking driver Ali collected us in their new Land Cruiser. From the moment we took off there were zillions of lost photo opportunities as we travelled through extraordinarily beautiful places to visit a jumble of goat farms. Over two days we consumed enormous amounts of compulsory sweet mint tea, on which all consummate negotiations are based, whilst listening to an endless stream of good-natured haggling. Finally, with the goats purchased, we hired a van and made our way to the village where the women were waiting. The women agreed to give the first female kid back to the Foundation so that it can be allocated to another woman on the waiting list and thus the project unfolds. By way of thanks we were fed a wonderful tagine lunch and each presented with a 2 kilo bag of the freshest, sweetest almonds I have ever tasted.With the leftover money we purchased basic groceries such as sugar, tea, soap, rice etc and set out in search of nomad families to provide them with some winter-sustaining dry goods. We drove through the Dades Gorge into undulating hills of wild thyme passing only the occasional shepherd and his flock. Eventually, we came across a Berber nomad family living in their brown wool tent in the mountains.  At home were just three children - 9 and 7 year old boys who were caring for their 1 year old brother whilst grandma and mother were foraging and herding their goats. The children wore dirty, ill-fitted clothes riddled with holes and offered us to share their small tent that was open to the elements. Goats and chickens wandered in and out and the hordes of rubbish substituted for seating.With great pride (and some curiosity) the boys graciously washed glasses with tepid water from a bowl and made us tea on a campfire inside the tent. We played and chatted until Grandma arrived with a load of grass for the goats and wood for the fire. She thanked us for the groceries and asked if we would return with winter shoes and clothes for the children. She was lovely and watching her gentle and loving interactions with the children was very moving.The experience was truly remarkable and reminded us of how resilient people can be when living in abject poverty and conversely how spoiled we are in the Western world. I now try to wake up with a smile on my face each morning and remember how lucky I am. Note: Our project assisted women from village of Ait Ali Aisa (one of the several communities in the Toundoute area) http://www.saharachildren.org/wp/

Silence of desert. I booked one night in desert with Authentic Morroco. I really enjoyed the night under stars, in the berber tent. Everything was as planned, the guide was waiting for us, the mint tea was the best ever in my life, the tajine cooked in the desert was as tasty as food in the mountains, the full moon and sunrise was awesome. I recommend them: they offered good price, interesting information about berbers and touaregs, safety advices. Enjoy Morocco!

Thank you Authentic Morocco. We would like to say Thank you to Liz and to the Marrakech team, and to our driver Lahson,– everyone. We had a wonderful time; indeed our Morocco trip was outstanding. Ryad Nora was excellent in Marrakech. A lovely ryad, with the best meal we had in Morocco. Lahson our driver for our desert tour tok us on the best roads for us to see the scenery. A very careful and competent driver. He stopped for our million photos, told us bits and pieces about the countryside, the history, the people, the way of life and so on. He gave us insights into the Berber culture and we met gypsies and went to wonderful caverns that were decked out like Aladdin’s cave. Les Jardins de Skoura in The Valley of a Thousand Kasbahs was exceptional. Thank you for recommending and organising our overnight stay there. The desert was wonderful, our camel trek excellent, and we couldn’t believe the attention we received in our grand tent - drummers, and a delightful fellow who hardly left us alone but meant very well, and yet another chicken tagine.Ryad Salama and Fes were the perfect end days for such a holiday. Fes was full of life, beautiful and also overloaded with wonderful crafts, colours, smells. Moroccans seem very clever and hardworking people. It was a pleasure getting to know just a little bit of their lives. Thank you Liz and all the Authentic Morocco team for organising such a wonderful trip for us.

This is a good tour company. We booked our Sahara portion of our journey with Authentic Morocco. We found them online and contacted the owner in London and all was handled through her. We booked a private vehicle and driver. It turned out we had a driver and a guide which made for crowded and uncomfortable conditions for the three of us (myself, spouse, and adult daughter) in the backseat for 3 full days of driving. We had thought there would only be two of us in the backseat and one in the front. If you have a choice - we didn't know until they picked us up and it was too late to do anything about it - only two to the backseat - the trip is too long and rigorous to be so uncomfortable. She made all arrangements for lodging and we paid through a wire transfer prior to our arrival (funds were held in escrow until our trip was completed). Our guide spoke excellent English and was full of information about all of the sites we were seeing along the way. It was a good experience, but I might reconsider spending so much time driving - though we got to see the Sahara in all its blowing glory, had a camel ride, saw nomadic peoples, and Ait Ben Haddou. I thought about it many times since our return home and can't figure out any better way to do it. There isn't much to do out there and I wouldn't have wanted to spend any more time along the way. Planes would help but I couldn't find any to get us there or back.

Great way to see a lot in a short amount of time. Of course seeing a lot means a lot of time in the Land Cruiser, but we really enjoyed our time. The tour company was well prepared, did a great job communicating and was accommodating. I wish we would have had more time to take a longer tour.

Ait Benhaddou and Essaouira with Authentic Morocco. We had two separate outings with Authentic Morocco this week and both were fantastic. The highlight for us was probably our trip to Ait Benhaddou with Khalid. He took us across the Tichka Pass (very impressive and scary views!!) and then on a rough road (i.e., no tour buses there) to the Kasbah at Telouet. It was so cool to walk through the Kasbah, and Khalid was great at explaining it all to us. There seemed to be no one else there at all - definitely felt like we were getting a unique experience. And the countryside was gorgeous. Views, culture and history aside, he also knew where all the good bathrooms were - very important ; ) And he had a wonderful sense of humor as well. Really fun with him. We also went to Essouira with Omar, and the highlight there was our camel ride along the beach. We went much further than I had thought we would go - and, again, it was very empty there, so got some great pics of the ocean and the castle in the sand - very much reminded me of Shelley's Ozymandias poem - http://www.poetryfoundation.org/poem/175903 Great experience and so much history in Morocco. We want to come back and see Fez and would definitely call Liz again if we did.

Life amongst the Berbers. Thanks to Authentic Morroco I was able to spend a oversized weekend with the Berbers in Telouet with the congenial "family" that is made up of Tabha and Ali who provided a welcoming and jovial spirit. I was given the chance to meander in the town of Telouet and its beautiful positioning in the Atlas Mountains. No hitches. The experience is just what I needed and wanted.

Kathleen. We were lucky enough to have found Authentic and everyone involved with this agency.Grandmother,daughter and 10 year old had the assistance of the best guide(Khalid).He assisted us in every way including our memorable Camel ride on the beach! We learned so much about this country and this tour company is responsible for our need to return to Morocco.

Warm and Inviting - Never to be forgotten. I would like to thank-you for a very memorable trip by van up the coast of Morocco. Everything was way beyond our expectations. We loved the little villa on the coast. The dinner was so tasty and the rooms were charming. Ali’s care and concern for my family was very thoughtful, especially given his fasting throughout the days of Ramadan. He went far beyond in making sure we were well cared for. I so enjoyed sitting and talking with him as we made our way up the coast. Please express my sincere appreciation to Ali for making our trip so special. All the best. Kim

Amazing Day Trip Experience!. Some friends and I did the one day trek to the Okuira Valley and Waterfalls - and it was amazing!!Planning - Liz at the main office was a delight to work with! She was great with constant communication and multiple options for payment. She helped to answer all of our questions, and was very accommodating when plans were altered slightly.Pick up/Transport - our guide was wonderful. took us to a store to get food, was very knowledgeable and personable, and we all got along with him great.

ALL AROUND AMAZING!. Two of my friends and I just came back from Morocco we loved our tour and our guide it was definitely an amazing experience. Khalid was so courteous we could not have asked for more.

One of our best holidays - ever!. Thanks you Liz and the team at Authentic Morocco. We have travelled the world over and this was our first time to Morocco, and it turned out to be one of the most exciting and fun trips we have ever made. Before we planned our trip we did a bit of research but still didn't know how to distribute our time in each place. After asking us questions about our likes/dislikes the recommendations from Liz were spot on. Her knowledge of the areas to visit and the amount of time to spend in each place really helped to make this a fantastic holiday. Khalid, who was our driver for 4 days was excellent company, and the Authentic Morocco team were always on hand if needed, especially on arrival and our last day when they made special arrangements for us in Marrakech. From the hustle and bustle of "exciting" Marrakech, to the desert camel trip, and the beach atmosphere of "cosmopolitan" Essaouira we would recommend getting in touch with Liz if you are thinking of visiting Moroccao. Many thanks Liz and the team for some great memories!

Steer Clear. Awful from the beginning, our non-english speaking driver managed to be more courteous and attentive than our so called 'english speaking guide' who could barely get a sentence out... he did not understand us and it was horrible. It was obviously his first time as the driver had to tip him off whenever he should be speaking and wasn't. Even then he would read straight from his booklet, word for word.I would have preferred us just travelling with the driver as the guide was unknowledgeable, uninspiring, flat, just an all-round awkward trip.complete waste of money

The whole trip was magical!. Organization: Authentic Morocco/Liz's organization was 'spot-on'. We did not have a single glitch with reservations, meeting drivers or guidesat any point in our 1000 mile travel. This allowed us to focus on the joys oftravel and not worry about any logistics.Mustafa the Driver: Mustafa was extremely courteous as well as attentive to his driving.We always felt very safe with him at the helm. He took the driving very seriously whichwe greatly appreciated!Mustafa the Guide: Mustafa was an outstanding guide. Always pleasant and extremely knowledgeable, he was on top of every activity and completely flexible to any alterations in plans. We felt that he truly cared about our well being and wanted us to really see and experience everything. We could not haveasked for a better guide!Thank you for everything Liz, I cannot think of any way you could improve your services!

Essaouria Day Trip. Through Authentic Morocco we organised a day trip to Essaouira. We booked in advance and the contact Liz was super prompt and really lovely at answering all questions and booked our tour in minutes, it was very easy and hassle free.Our Driver was a lovely man, soft spoken - he left all the speaking to our guide who was a very intelligent and knowledgable man. He imparted a lot of the regions history and answered any questions we could throw at him. At our request he also played music from Berber musicians on the return journey!Essaouira was great to visit for a couple of hours, but the journey to and from with great local company was the highlight.

A fantastic trip. We recently spent a fortnight in Morocco with our adult sons (early 20s). Liz at Authentic Morocco put together a superb itinerary for us and suggested a variety of riad accommodation in various cities, all of which proved to be top-notch. The Moroccan tour company with whom Liz works provided us with an excellent tour from Fes to the desert, then Skoura and finally to Marrakesh; our driver Ibrahim and guide Mustafa were a pleasure to travel with. In the weeks leading up to our trip Liz was always available to give advice to us, and the professional way in with Authentic Morocco made our trip go without a hitch made the holiday a truly memorable one. Morocco is a vibrant, colourful and fascinating place to visit, and Authentic Morocco made it a holiday to remember.

Fabulous Trip, Made Even Better By Authentic Morocco. We travel quite a bit, but almost never use the assistance of a tour operator. We were unfamiliar with Morocco and elected to use Authentic Morocco. From the beginning Liz Williams was very patient with us, helping us to design a tour that met our needs. Once we arrived in Morocco, the staff was superb. Even though my wife's luggage didn't arrive and we were somewhat perplexed how to handle the situation, the station agent for Authentic Morocco assured us that he would handle the problem, and within 24 hours, our bags arrived. He picked us up after our first day tour and took us to the airport for our bags. Although we may have been able to recover our bags, his calm demeanor certainly took the edge off our concerns. The tour guides were superb, providing excellent advice and always interested in making this exotic country a tourist delight. Our only regret is that we didn't stay longer. Definitely going back.

Fantastic, Professional Company. Hi, This is the tour company you want to use. Authentic Morocco was amazing. We went on a tour to the Atlas Mountains and the tour was fantastic, we had a brilliant english speaking guide who answered all of our crazy questions regarding not only the Atlas Mountains and the Berber people but everything about the culture of Morocco to their school system, Health care, etc.The highlight of the tour was lunch in a Berber Village. We saw all the other tour companies stop at the same restaurant, which maybe was fine, but we were fortunate enough to actually go into a Berber family home, where the grandmother and granddaughter made the meal and honestly it was so authentic and lovely and totally amazing, truthfully it beat any five restaurant we ate at during our holiday. Not to be forgotten the lady that runs Authentic Morocco is amazing and professional and will help you with any problems or questions that may arise. We will definaly use this company in the future. Thank You!

An Amazing Adventure!. My wife and I are independent travelers who typically book our own airfare, hotels, ground transportation, meals, etc. We generally only use tours in places where we need vehicular ground transport and the local knowledge of an experienced guide. Liz Williams at Authentic Morocco immediately illustrated her ability to work with independent travelers by providing us a customized quote including a detailed itinerary for a 3 day trek from Fes to Erg Chebbi dunes, ending in Marrakesh. She was always prompt, consistent, professional, and thorough in her responses and given the financial backing and escrow service her company uses, gave us the piece of mind when paying a company overseas money up front to guarantee our reservation. EVERYTHING, went without a hitch. The professional guide, Ali, met us at our Riad in Fes precisely on time and was courteous and friendly. He was a native of the desert we were traveling through and had vast local knowledge, including details I asked about (and later verified online...since I'm a buff for random information on places I've visited.) The camel trek in Erg Chebbi must be experienced to be believed. Liz's description of the experience was spot on, and the overnight trek is definitely for those with an adventurous spirit. My wife and I loved it. Another highlight was staying at Dar Panorama in Skoura with the family of Mr Aziz and his son Ackmed...who were two of the nicest people you will ever meet on this earth. Our guide, Ali, also proved to be MAJORLY resourceful in quickly charting an off-road route around a small mountain range when the only road through the area was closed down due to local political protest. It was something out of Indiana Jones driving off piste in a 4 wheel drive vehicle through a dry riverbed and then through some small desert mountains and back to the main road. Once in a lifetime experience. Ali took it in stride barely fazed by the situation. All in all Authentic Morocco delivered, beyond expectation, an experience that was professional, full of adventure, local flair and culture, financially water-tight, prompt, safe, and incredibly prepared to deal with the trials and tribulations of the back-country of a developing nation. I HIGHLY recommend this experience to independent, open minded travelers looking for adventure and a once in a lifetime experience!

Authentic Morocco Camel Trek was awesome!!. We loved our camel trek with Authentic Morocco! Liz was responsive and helpful in getting our arrangements together. Our guide, Naim, was wonderful. -very patient and open to sharing a lot of insighful information about his native culture. The drive through rural Morocco was beautiful and fun; we had lunch in a local home, saw beautiful landscapes, and stayed in an old, quiet guesthouse one of the nights. The camel tour itself, with the Blue Man Group, was wonderful. The deep red Saharan sands were gorgeous, and it was surreal to be underneath so many stars that night. We sat around a campfire with a few other travelers and played drums, told jokes/stories, and had a really incredible time. It was a very unique, and unforgettable, experience.

a well organized and smooth experience in morocco. it was our first time in morocco and we wanted to see the dessert. we were picked up at our riad, punctually! the guide is fantastic, always opening doors for us (even for my husband) and he never failed to inform us when we entered a new region. the valleys are amazingly beautiful! loved the tagine prepared by our guide in the deep dunes of erg chebbi! i would definitely recommend and personally use authentic morocco again! thanks Liz, it was such a memorable trip.mery and andrea

fascinating day trip from Marrakech. Our day trip to Tizi-n-Tichka, Ait Benhaddou and Telouet was fantastic - and such a contrast to the city buzz of Marakech. Our driver was very proffesional and careful, which is essential on the hair pin bends! If you go on to the berber village of Telout - and its very worthwhile , do take up the offer of lunch provided by a berber family - they have a large airy room where they serve it and its a welcome break from the heat and driving, as well as being delicious - we asked for vegetarian and were served morrocan salad, vegetable couscous and vegetable tagine - both plain, simple and delicious - followed by fresh fruit and dates. The Kasbah el Glaoui is a magnificent palace slowly crumbling away at the edges, but the richness of the interiors still remain in some of the rooms, a total contrast to the village beyond its walls. We had a friendly, knowledgeable guide and all four of us had a really great day. Its a long trip but well worth it, and we would highly recommend authentic morocco - nice to have a good vehicle, not a saloon car. We left at 7 am and weren't back till 6pm, take sunscreen and comfy shoes as well as lots of water!

Our mini adventure. A friend an I wanted to experience the Atlas mountains and I came across Authentic Morocco online. Liz organised a three night say for us near Imlil. We had such a fantastic time, great guide and the walking was beautiful. We stayed in a lovely guest house above Imlil where we met others doing similar trips. It was a hassle free couple of days and all ran very smoothly, i'd definately recommend it.

Expectations exceeded throughout. Authentic Morocco quickly understood our requirement for a family trekking and coastal holiday, with adult children. Their proposed itinerary and programme turned out to be perfect in every respect. We were looked after locally by professionals with good spoken English, and the accommodation turned out to exceed our expectations.

As authentic as a Morocco can be. This company exceeded all my expectations at a great price too. My wife and I took a private tour from Marrakech to Erg Chebbi. We were met on time at the Marrakech airport by our awesome guide Hussein. Our driver was Abdele and he was an amazing driver. The amount of knowledge and professionalism displayed was spectacular. They took us to the coolest spots and told the story behind it as well. Hussein and Abdele responded to all of our requests and made our trip amazing and unforgettable. Liz Williams is the coordinator and she will tailor your trip inline with whatever you need.

Well organised and savvy local knowledge.
