Through Liz, on e-mail, we planned a week in Morocco, hiking up Toubkal and travelling through canyons and mountains to the Sahara to camel trek.We felt that the choice of guides and accommodation was always of a high quality. Our own personal itinerary, produced with Liz’s assistance, was made even more special with the local knowledge as we were taken to quiet spots and experienced local berber life. Would thoroughly recommend.

Great Day trip into Atlas Mountains. Did the day trip from Marrakech to Ait Benhaddou and Telouet on 4th Aug 11. Picked up early from our hotel outside Marrakech in a Toyota Landcruiser and set off over the Atlas mountains to the amazing town of Ait Benhdaddou. Lots of stops for photos, buying fossils from roadside stalls and mint tea. Very impressive scenery and final few miles off road so Landcruiser came into its own. Onto Telouet where we had a really tasty lunch in a Berber home and then a very intersting tour round the castle with the Authentic Morocco guide. Away for over 10 hours but with lots of chances to witness real life in Morocco, fantastic scenery and plenty of stops the day flew by. I would definately use Authentic Morocco again and it was a real bonus to be able to discuss the trips with Liz before we left.

Fantastic organisation. My booking through authentic Morocco was a little serenditpitous - ie, it was the first company I emailed and because of the wonderful response from Liz (sorry Liz but I don't remember your last name) I never felt as if I needed to contact another company. We were a mother and daughter travelling together and wanted to have everything organised for us. We chose the 4 day, 3 night, Fes to Marrakech itinery put together by Liz and it all worked perfectly. It's quite a long drive (500k on the first day and 300 something for the other days) but I can honestly say that I never felt unsafe with our driver, Mohammed. Not only that but he was really pleasant company as well as fluent in English, Arabic and French. We miss you Mohammed!

Fez to Marrakech - our private adventure. When planning our trip to Morocco, we knew we wanted something out of the ordinary. As a family, we were on a 5 week vacation, covering much of Europe and ending in Morocco. There are loads of tour companies promising unique Sahara dessert treks, but none as professional and helpful as Authentic Morocco. I sent an email to several companies, and Liz was very fast to respond.Liz worked with us to create a perfect itinerary for us that would start in Fes and end in Marrakech over 4 days. Everything ran like clock work. I was thankful that she gave us:- a detailed itinerary- tipping guides- packing guidesWe had a guide and a driver, both were very nice and very knowledgeable. Our car was a toyota 4 runner, which is a good choice for this much driving. Do keep in mind though, that there will be 3 adults across the back seat if you have a guide & a driver.The highlight of the trip was a camel trek out into the Sahara, with a berber camel guide to sleep in a berber camp. Riding a camel is a bit of an adventure, but you really need to do it! The camp is very basic & authentic (carry in your own water, no facilities, etc) but well worth it. Children and drum players came to our camp to sing and entertain - and sunrise was awesome. Our kids did some sand boarding (very tiring) and all in all it was a great adventure. I am not a camper, but really glad I did this!Packing Hint: Pack a small flashlight that you can wear around your neck (Brookstone makes them), and bring frozen waters.All in all, Morocco is a very cool destination. But I would NOT do it without a trusted bonded guide. Authentic Morocco is exactly that. We even made a few adjustments along the way - & it was no problem. Thank you Liz!

Brilliant from start to finish - Authentic Morocco is the way to go.. I visited Morocco last month with a group of friends (two guys and two girls). As twenty somethings, we were looking for a change from the usual raucous city and beach holidays, and were keen to catch a glimpse of a completely new culture. We decided to use a tour company to have better piece of mind and to avoid wasting precious time searching around for deals having arrived in Marrakesh. It was the right choice. Liz at Authentic Morocco was a great help right from the start, bending over backwards to put together a tailor made three day trip for us. We gave her our preferences and she pieced together a fantastic itinerary.Both hostels were fantastic. One was in Essaouira and had a beautiful roof terrace for breakfast. The rooms were very spacious and clean and the French owner very friendly (though she couldn't quite believe that two English lads were heading out for evening coffee rather than for a drinking session). One thing to note. The hostel is not actually overlooking the beach, as the photos seem to imply, but this wasn't an issue in the end. It was only a short walk to the beach and a stroll through the old town was never boring. The driver we had, Kalid, was very friendly and helpful, not at all sleazy. Not quite sure what the previous reviewer was going on about. He/she must have got out on the wrong side of the bed. My highlight was fist pumping to one of Kalid's 'disco CDs' for a good hour and a half. Rock hard, ride free! We gave him a small tip at the end of the trip (we all work in publishing!) and never felt obliged to do this.The B&B at Imlil was incredible. Perfect choice Liz! The staff were amazingly welcoming and treated us to mint tea and biscuits on arrival. The evening meal was the best food we had in Morocco and the surrounding mountains were very tranquil and good for body and mind. Though we didn't pack quite the right equipment, the half-day trek was also very enjoyable. Our guide, Rashid, was a legend and very chatty. He is young, so we had a lot in common. But note to other travellers ... bring good shoes. My feet were dead after four hours walking in Nike trainers. Titus!All in all, we were very pleased with Authentic Morocco and would not hesitate in recommending them! Thanks guys.Cheers,Chris

We thoroughly recommend Authentic Morocco. We are all over 60 and went as a party of 4 for 10 days to Morocco on a tour tailor made for us and thoroughly enjoyed it all. Everything went like clockwork. Mohamed our driver could not have been more helpful. It was great to have someone who spoke Arabic, Berber, French and English and could act as our interpreter, enabling us to talk to people we would otherwise have been unable to communicate with. We feel we got a better understanding of Morocco as a result. Hamid our camel driver was also a really nice guy, and we had an interesting evening in the desert chatting with him in our broken French. It was particularly good to get off the beaten track and see parts of the country that so few tourists reach. We were particularly keen to visit a nomad family and a rural school, and this was all arranged for us. Everyone we met was friendly, helpful and hospitable and we felt completely safe. We have spent quite a lot of time travelling in Central America and you have to be very careful all the time to avoid your personal possessions being stolen or worse, whereas in Morocco we felt safe at all times of the day or night - safer than in London!Sally and David from Devon and Paul and Pauline from London.

Fes-Desert-Marrakech tour. We had a wonderful experience with Authentic Morocco. Liz Williams was able to answer all of my many questions during the planning process and was always prompt in answering my emails. We took a 4-day trip from Fes to Erg Chebbi, through the south and ending in Marrakech. Our guide was friendly and professional. Hotels and meals were very good, all very comfortable accomodations. The vehicle is also very comfortable, which is quite important considering how much driving you do for this trip. The tour is very well organized. This is the first tour my husband and I have ever employed since we are used to doing our traveling on our own, and it was a great experience. I would recommend Authentic Morocco to travelers going to Morocco.

Authentic Morocco is absolutely incredible, they are dependable, flexible and responsive. Best trip ever!. We travelled with Authentic Morocco from July 10-July 17. Our driver met us at the airport with a smile and a warm welcome. We arrived in Casablanca, drove directly to Marrakech and our first night there we needed to ammend our travel plans. The manager from the Marrakech office met with us and made these changes easy and affordable. Our driver was absolutely amazing. He was always in the right place at the right time and his motto is "no problem"...as nothing ever was a problem. We traveled from Marrakech to Fes and saw everything and everyone worth seeing in between. The camel trek is a must (lifechanging), meeting with Berber families and sharing stories was a blessing, the local guides were informative and fun. The monkeys in the cedar forest were adorable. The Women's cooperative who makes the Argon oil products was fascinating. The World Heritage Roman Ruins site is very important and Meknes was quite magical. Everyone that Authentic Morocco chooses to do business with seems ethical and trustworthy, though you do need to learn how to haggle...it's part of the culture! Best trip ever!!!

High Atlas Trekking. My wife and I have travelled extensively and always independently but decided to book a short trekking tour during our honeymoon. We had our reservations as we have always enjoyed the freedom of dictating our own itinerary but having completed the trek we would have no hesitation in recommending Authentic Morocco as a tour operator.The trek was excellent and we had a very good guide - Personable, intelligent, knowledgable and attentive without ever being overbearing. There was nothing we could fault him on - He made a real effort and we didn't want for anything. His English is near perfect which is just as well as our Berber and Arabic are ropey at best (However - Insha'Allah - They did improve over the trek). The camp sites (Tachddirt & Oukaimeden) were perfectly adequate as was the guest house in Timichi - We were comfortable and as this was our first guided trek we frankly felt spoilt - We are used to heavy bags and a guidebook/map so a team of three to look after us both was a luxury! As an example of the consideration we were afforded - Our guide arranged for us to have lunch in a restaurant in Setti Fatma when we arrived instead of a picnic by the river as it had rained on-and-off the previous day and he was concerned about flash-flooding and the 1995 disaster there - A classy move that may have gone unnoticed except we had read about the '95 event and had been caught by an electrical/hail storm just over the pass of Tizi n'Ouhattar the previous day which feeds into the Ourika valley.Our cook/muleteers were both really nice guys and the food was excellent (We continually felt guilty in turning food away as we couldn't eat it all!). There were plenty of snacks and tea to compliment the meals (We drink a lot of tea) and there was nothing more we could have asked for. It was really special to be spend time with local people in their own back-yard so to speak - It never ceases to please/amaze us how attitudes, lifestyle and solutions to life in high altitude areas are similar across the globe - It is a beautiful thing and it is reflected in the characters of the people who live there.The countryside itself was a bit of a revelation - We expected the transition from lowland through Alpine to a more scrubby high altitude landscape and back but we did not expect the luscious meadows of wild flowers and orchids around Oukaimeden. This was a special treat as I am a qualified Ecologist and my wife a nature enthusiast - We had read there were orchids and flowers but we were really impressed by the bounty on show - Our hayfever kicked in and we happily spent hours sneezing through the fields taking hundreds of photos - We were so impressed. The walking was good - Just enough each day to allow for unforseen events (The electric/hail storm which blew in just over the pass of Tizi n'Ouhattar which meant we had to hunker down in a local home for a few hours before heading to Timichi for the night). By necessity we walked on roads at some points which wasn't very 'Romantic' but the views were so good we didn't notice the tarmac.In a word - Faultless. In some other words - Great value. The only thing we could have wanted for was more information on natural history / ecology but we knew this wasn't a specialist tour and we hadn't pointed out we were nature-geeks before hand so we accepted that we were asking a lot in this regard. To exemplify our satisfaction we left a generous tip for our three man team and had no hesitation in doing so.We would recommend Authentic Morocco to anybody thinking of arranging a tour in Morocco. From the initial tentative communications by email to arranging the detail of the tour to the actual tour itself everything has been faultless. All correspondence has been prompt, informative and clear and the physical tour was of a high standard, exceeding our expectations. We often didn't notice we were on a tour, we just felt like we were trekking independently with some new friends who didn't mind carrying bags, setting-up camp, cooking, cleaning and having a chat - That was priceless to us. We are sure we will return to Morocco at some point in the future and we will not hesitate to book another tour with Authentic Morocco.

Adaptable and incredibly knowledgeable. This was my second time with Authentic Morocco the past two years, and if the first jounrey with them had been bad, I would not have used them a second time. Both trips were two weeks long. Authetnic Morocco was totally knowledgeable about where I went including sites and shopping and were willing to adapt completely to my needs instead of rigidly following the itinerary for its own sake. Authentic Morocco, more than any other company that I have used anywhere, has the best after trip support, which can be necessary in order to find out wherher a store has shipped something, folr example. And if Morocco had experienced the same tumult as Egypt, I would feel especially safe in Authenic Morocco's hands.

Absolutely Super....!. My GF and I just copleted a self organized one week tour through Marocco. It was a packed week with a tight schedule to visit places like Meknes, Fes, Volubilis, Marrakesch, Thorda Gorge, Dades Gorge, Aït Ben Haddo and offcourse a night in the desert was on our wish list too. Authentic Marocco made this possibel fo us. After contacting them by e-mail, I received a quick response back that they would be able to arrange a camel trek that met our schedule. The price was reasonable. Maybe about 30Euro's more expensive, if you were to go to Merzouga and find a local camel driver there... With the possibility they are all booked, or you might have to wait till the next day. I paid a small deposit by Credit Card and paid the rest after meeting up with our camel driver in Marocco. Authentic Marocco had arranged to meet our guide in an easy to find location on the way to Merzouga. Because we were coming from Fes, the drive was long but Beautiful, with some amazing views of teh High Atlas mountains. The guide Yusef drove with us through the rugged terain to the Riad on the edge of the dessert. where we got a room to change if we wanted and store our belongings. We were treated to a nice cup of tea and got acquainted with our dromedaries, Bob Marley and Jimmy Hendrix, who would be our taxies into the desert. The weather was amazing.. though I did forget to put sun protector on my legs and one side of my calf got burned on the way out to the camp.Here we had another Moroccan tea.. and when the sun was setting lower a bit and the temperature was getting a bit better to handle, we climbed to the top of a 600ft sand dune... wow.Local dinner was prepared by our chef Ali, who we had the pleasure of being invited to his Tent as well to meet his wife and son... with another cup of tea. The night was short... for those who want to see sun rise... and back on the backs of Bob and Jimmy to the hotel for Breakfast and a well appreciated shower... :)I would recommend Authentic Marocco to anyone who wants to experiance a great Desert Trek. . Great thanks to Authentic Marocco, our terrific guide Yusef, the Chef Ali and our dromedaries Bob Marley & Jimmy Hendrix offcourse... Leon

Great Experience with Authentic Morocco. We just completed a 2-week tour of Morocco and had a wonderful time. There is great diversity and history in the country that makes Morocco a terrific place to visit. Our driver, Mohammed, was a local Moroccan native who lives in Marrakech and was a complete delight. He was very consciencious, always a gentleman, and gave us important insights into the country. We were very comfortable with him and he clearly valued our safety and enjoyment as his primary goal.. I should also mention that he told us he was paid full-time by Authentic Morocco and very much enjoyed working for the company. During the 2 weeks, we visited maybe 3 shops at his suggestion but never received any pressure to buy anything. These were first rate stores that would have been good places to purchase items had we been interested. I could not imagine a better driver with higher integrity, greater commitment to our safety and enjoyment and a wonderful representative of his country. Finally, the guides provided by Authentic Morocco at the imperial cities that we visited were all first rate. Their English was excellent, they were well versed in history, and they provided very interesting tours.Our 2 week trip to Morocco is part of a 9-month international travel adventure that is currently in its third month. We have visited 5 other countries and our Morocco experience has been right there at the top. I should also mention that Liz at Authentic Morocco provided us with excellent advice in planning this trip. She was always very responsive in our email excanges and this resulted in a superb itinerary and our having a wonderful time.

Authentic Morocco is fantastic. I am in the midst of the most wonderful trip I have ever taken in my 50 + years of life and I owe it all to Liz Williams, and her local partner Abdulla, and the local general manager, Irissa. We arrived into Rabat after a very long day from Portland Oregon to Chicago to Paris and finally Rabat. We were greeted by Irissa who took us to the wonderful Vllla Mandarine where we were able to get some badly needed rest. The next day, we met up w/a phenomenal local guide who has lived his entire life in Rabat. We saw the Roman Ruins, the King's Palace, a military training center, the final resting spot of a several kings, and an incredible neighborhood that splits Rabat from Sale. It was a remarkable tour. Once the 3 hour or so tour concluded, we traveled in a very nice Land Cruiser to Fes, a journey that took a little less than 3 hours. I am traveling w/my wife, our two kids, aged 20 and 16 and for more than 3 weeks so we have a lot of luggage. The Land Cruiser is a perfect car for this journey. It comfortably seats all of us and our luggage and has great big windows so everyone can see. Fes was truly unbelievable. We stayed at the wonderful 14 room riad, the Palais Amani and had an excellent tour of a medina by a guide who was born and raised in the Medina. One needs such a guide as the medina has 9400 streets most of which dead end. From there, a long car trip to the Sahara Dunes which had many highlights but the camel ride at sunrise was particularly sublime. We stayed at a very nice Xaluca property in Merzouga and had the place pretty much to ourselves. It literally sits on the Dunes' line and you can walk a few hundred yards to be amidst the dunes. Our trustworthy, honorable and thoroughly decent driver and the general manager of the company-which runs as many as 15 different, yet concurrent custom trips was born and raised in the desert and was therefore in a position to take us to see a wonderful community of local musicians that spanned 4 generations, and then off road to see a Nomad family in their "residence" where the family, who has nothing, offered us bread and olive oil and tea and watermelon and warm welcomes. Both were nothing short of life affirming experiences. Next up, the amazing village of Bourdain Dunes. Another stay at a Xaluca property, this one called Xaluca Dunes that was terrifically situated w/an expansive view over the village and the very fertile valley that lies at the foot of the village. I am writing this from the truly amazing Riad Kniaz which is over the top beautiful, w/phenomenal service. We will be here 3 nights and then we have one night in a High Atlas village and two on the Atlantic Coast before we return to Rabat for our return flight to Paris. To this moment, EVERYTHING has been absolutely first rate. The accommodations, the meals, the guides, the entire itinerary, for which I thank Liz Williams has been other worldly and made for a phenomenal trip. I would recommend Liz and her very hard working people to friends and family alike. One final thought: I read the recently posted remarks of a person named Adelaide. I suspect she was having a bad day when she wrote it. I have a problem w/people who say things like "I heard that XYZ" because it shows their personal lack of information. I can tell you that what Adelaide says she "heard" is utter nonsense. Idrissa has been w/Authentic Morocco for 3 years. This is not a wealthy country but he makes a decent living. So decent that he recruited two of his brothers to now work for Authentic Morocco as well. One does not hire their brothers to work for a company unless it is a great company to work for. Authentic Morocco is aptly named as it hires locals and pays them well and respects and honors their work and it shows in how the guides interact with their clients. Again, I would not hesitate to work with Authentic Morocco.

An Amazing Experience- all thanks to Authentic Morocco. Many THANKS to Liz Williams, with Authentic Morocco for making our vacation a truly wonderful experience. I visited Morocco for a week (May 31-June 5) along with my husband and 4 friends. The Riad's and Kasbah's were fantastic and the camel trek was amazing. Our driver Barack was very professional and a very safe driver. Our guide, Khalid was a bundle of knowledge and such a kind person - we will never forget him! Thanks again Liz for making our vacation one we will never forget! and if we ever visit Morocco again I can promise you will be the first person I contact!!

I use Authentic Morocco... every year.. Every year I travel to Morocco with groups of amateur photographers as a leader for the UK company Light and Land. Every year we travel off the beaten track in the mountains and in the desert, we shoot from dawn till dusk and cover huge distances, and my clients always have numerous questions about Morocco, the Berbers, Islam, local culture and geography. Every year my clients comment on how the drivers from Authentic Morocco go beyond the call of duty to look after them, not only being informative, friendly and courteous, but also helping with luggage and even running down a mountainside in the dark, un-asked, to look for a lens cap that a client has accidentally dropped. Incidentally, we too have had last-minute birthday cakes to organise. If this is the kind of behaviour that, every year, prompts my clients to ask if they can tip their drivers, then so be it. Note, a tip is neither asked for nor expected, but of course gratefully accepted... and I personally do not have a problem with someone getting a tip if they have earned it! Note also that Authentic Morocco IS a local company, with an office in Marrakesh (who sent a representative to personally seek out one of my clients in the hotel she had booked independently, to ensure her safety on the day of the 2011 bomb), with Liz who (entirely sensibly I feel) coordinates itinerary planning and marketing from the UK.Over the last 7 years I have met many of the drivers and had extentsive dealings with both Liz and the office in Morocco, and would recommend the company to anyone.

Do not use Authentic Morocco!!". After returning with a trip with Maroc Expedition I too would recommend them highly. They are local and are professional as was their driver. I can not say the same about Authentic Morocco which I swore I would never use again. I would like to warn other travellers to consider carefully what they support in Morocco. This is not a local company and my driver was sleezy, scammed the whole trip and it appeared to me that the camel driver had not been properly paid and I ended up paying him. The sad thing is that I am writing this review partly in response to one lady who said how wonderful her driver 'Kalid' had been because he got her a cake for her birthday (sounds like the same manipulative driver I had - he got me a CD music disc!). I wonder how much the tip was she gave him at the end!!!!! The problem is that many drivers in these companies, from what I have been told, actually are not properly employed and this is an agreement they are happy to undertake because they know they can make big tips from the tourists hence the emphasis on the scamming. It is important to ensure that we as tourists do not indulge in this type of behaviour at our pleasure. We need to go into Morocco and be responsible and support the right kind of tourism and local good companies. And to top it off Authentic Morocco never addressed my concerns and the trip had to be paid in full at the start. Satisfaction definitely not guaranteed.No such experience with Maroc Expedition. I paid a small deposit. They followed me up with an email to check how things had gone. There was not one place my driver detoured without my permission and no shopping side scams.He was actually properly paid by his company and any tip I provided was additional to that income.The riads were good quality and I could check them beforehand. And most importantly for a woman I felt safe at all times and I was treated with respect. Thank you Maroc Expedition!

A memorable experience. Liz & Rachid need to be congratulated for their pactience & professional attention to detail on what was a last minute & whirlwind tour of Northern Morocco.My wife & I spent 6 days & 5 nights on a delighful & interesting tour of Fes, Meknes and Chefchaouen.We would especially wish to thank Khalid, our tour guide / driver and new friend for what will be a life long memorable experience.

Professional and knowledgeable (and our guide bought me a birthday cake!). We spent 5 days and 4 nights with guide Kalid where he showed us the delights of the Dades Valley, Ait Benhaddou/Telouet and Erg Chebbi. Hotels were well chosen, food was good. Kalid was able to share with us what he knows about the area and about life in Morocco. THis was my first time taking such a small tour (me, my partner and our driver) and I was pleased that Kalid was excellent at being there when we needed him, anticipating our needs and also giving us our space. There is a lot of driving so, if you have time, I would do at least 5 days, and you probably will still wish you had more time. The desert trek was a highlight, but lots to see along the way. Information from head office pre and post trip was good and helpful. This trip was to celebrate a big birthday, we metioned this in passing and after dinner on my birthday a personalised cake appeared and, despite being the only guests at the kasbah, an impromptu party was assembled. We even had some berber dancing. Very sweet and a very nice touch!

Authentic Morocco made my experience in Morocco unforgettable. I was so impressed with Authentic Morocco from the start. The staff we worked with to book our camel trek tour through the Sahara Desert was incredibly friendly, professional and punctual. Liz Williams was so patient and wonderful in helping us navigate a design a tour in a country we had never been to, offering sincere suggestions to enhance our experience. Our tour guide/driver, Driss, was by far one of THE highlights of our 3 day tour. Though there was a slight language barrier, we developed such a camaraderie with him. He was professional, attentive and incredibly accommodating. I traveled with another female friend to Morocco and we felt so safe and in such good hands travelling with Driss; he took great care of us and our well-being. The entire tour from start to finish was punctual and incredibly easy. All the folks we met that were part of the Authentic Morocco group had smiles on their faces and were genuinely happy to help make our experience memorable. I highly recommend using Authentic Morocco for all your tours through Morocco. My only recommendation is that you work with Authentic Morocco to try and ensure you and your tour guide/driver speak the same language.

BEAUTIFUL, MAJESTIC PLACE. WONDERFUL PLACE TO VISIT, GREAT TOUR ....JAYS- SAHARA- TOURS GUIDES was very helpful and knowledgable, dleicious food, clean hotel safe enviroment, hotel accomaditions with all ameneties, COMFORTABLE AND RELIABLE TRANSPORTATION.......... I RECOMMENT THIS TRIP TO ANYONE i plan to return again later this year

Fantastic Tour!. My friend and I went to Morocco for my 25 birthday. Despite it being Ramadan and other companies telling us a camel Sahara trek was not possible, Authentic Morocco worked with us to put together an itinerary that worked! Our guide Abdullah was fantastic, very caring and knowledgable. I highly recommend this company!

Superb trip. We travelled from Marrakech, through the Atlas Mountains to the Sahara with Merzougatours. Everything that was promised was delivered. Our guide, Mohamed, was great - friendly, helpful, full of information and a great driver on those awesome Atlas roads. Accomodation was comfortable, clean and all with Moroccan flavour. The highlight was our night in Berber tents in the Sahara, 5 star experience. We visited in July - the hottest time of year with temperatures around 46C, so probably not the best time to go but one of our best trips all the same.

Magical and exotic place! . One of the best trips we have had as a group of friends! The city has a special vibe! The food is very good and the tour took us to the top places of the country including the desert, our friend Moha is the coolest guide and this is a trip that you are not going to forget!! My favorite place was Marrakesh!

Amazing experience . My sister and I traveled to Morocco with no expectations. We had no idea how much this trip would open our eyes into a different culture, language, and food. We also had the opportunity to have a very informative, funny and helpful tour guide- Mustapha. We were so sad to leave, so we hope to go back in a year or two and stay in Morocco longer and repeat the tour! I truly believe this is trip everyone must experience in their lifetime. You won't regret it.

Travelling to the desert. We went to the desert in the company of Mohamed, a great guide and great person.What can I say from the trip? I was with my family and we where treated with so much hospitality and care! They are very respectful for the space that we needed as family.Mohamed is also a great driver, we felt very safe in the roads of Morroco.We will definitely travel again with them!

Excelente!. If you go to Morocco, you have to take the Merzouga tours. The agency, timing, hotels, rooms, transportation and destinations of choice were he best we could have had. Memorable Trip in Merzouga!. My sister and I had a very memorable experience in the desert with Merzouga Tours! Our tour guide Abrehim was warm and friendly. He patiently answered all our questions re life in Morocco and he made us feel comfortable throughout the whole trip. We truly appreciated that we were invited to his home to have lunch with his lovely family (and his super adorable son). Our overnight stay in the campsite in Merzouga was truly the highlight of our trip in Morocco and it's definitely a must for anyone visiting this beautiful country!

I'd like to recommend Merzouga Tours!. I'd like to recommend Merzouga Tours. I've done the tour "5 GIORNI ATLANTE KASBAH E DESERTO" in December, and I have to say that I am completely satisfied with it. In particular, I'd like to highlight both the good sense of humor of the guide (Mohamed) who accompanied us and his excellent and professional way of driving on mountain roads (which I consider very important). Also, the timing dedicated for each activity was very well managed. I particularly enjoy the time in the desert. The contagious joy of the guides and the collaborators has surprised me very positively.

Together is better!. I went to Morocco for the second time of my life, to discover the wilderness of the pre - Saharian region, to reach the big dunes of Erg Chebbi and the big palms of Zagora. In the beginning I wanted to try this experience renting a car and driving all the way with my friend, but then we decided to ask Merzouga Tours to help us. Never better choice that that one! We had an amazing time in a private tour in 4X4 with our guide Mohammad and our driver, and for sure did a lot of things and experiences we would never be able to do on our own (for example the camel trek, the off road drive in the desert from Merzouga to Zagora...). Plus, I really think that going around with Mohammad, who is native from the desert, helped us a lot to get in touch with the local culture and people. The staff was very kind to listen to our needs (for example adding days and modifying the itinerary) and to take care of us.

Unbelievable time in Morocco. We went on the three day two night tour starting in Marrakech. We had Amar as the tour guide, and he was awesome. We went through Morocco and rode to the Sahara by camel and spent a night there. The tour was amazing and the our tour guide Amar made it even more fun!
ABSOLUTELY RECOMMENDED!!!. Amazing tour, have visited a lot of breathtaking places guided by Mohamed who was always available with us!!! Fantastic way to explore Morocco with its culture!!!

Beautiful trip seeing different parts of Marocco. Beautiful trip traveling in a bit crazy mini bus with the same-age young people, seeing different cities, towns, surroundings, famous places, eating in the traditional restaurant recommended by the tour guides (the choice was normally not optional and a bit expensive as for the young students, except Marrakesh), staying some days in Marrakesh.The hotels were pretty good.The guides were really kind and helpful trying their best in English and Spanish. Although not always totally corresponding to the program, we were taken to the beautiful places and a true local life was showed to us.The night in the dunes and the camel-ride was priceless and unforgettable!

Unforgettable tour!. Awesome one week experience with the local Berberian people. We got to experience how beautiful Morocco was, and the highlight of the trip was definitely camping out in the dunes! This consisted of a crazy ride in a 4X4, exciting ride on a camel, and also eating tagine&couscous as well as dancing along to live local music performed at night. Would definitely recommend to anyone who is keen to visit Morocco!

Breathtaking trip with Tenere Tours!. The trip was beyond my expectation. I made some last minute changes and that was handled by the stuff in a timely manner. The purpose was to visit historical places and learn more about the culture and people. Our guide was Hassan Ouaouich, very friendly and knowledgeable about places and events in each area visited. My favorite part from the trip was the Desert Camp in Merzouga. Tenere Tours is highly recommended! Certainly will use their services again.
Wonderful experience. We had a very nice trip！The guide is very friendly and humorous.We all recommend this group.we reviewed great sceneries on the road and in the desert .

With Great Tour Guide Comes Unforgettable Experience. 6 of us decided to go for a 9 day tour in Morocco. We had a few cities and sites in our mind and hence, we sent our requests for private customised tour via email to different companies. Tenere Tours responded in a matter of minutes, with the full itinerary with other must-go sites that we have missed. The most importantly, they offered a great price! Rachid was very helpful and quick in answering questions. With his help, our application for Morocco Visa went well. We arrived at Marrakech Airport on the same day but different time (5 in the morning and 1 in the evening), yet Rachid and Ali went twice to pick us all up to our riad and helped us in settling down. With a skillful driver (Ali) and a hospitable tour guide (Rachid), we travelled in a really comfortable way on a mini van through Marrakesh, Essaouira, Ouarzazate, Merzouga, Arfoud, Fes and others. They would tell us stories and histories about the cities, stopping at different spots for nice panoramic views and photo-taking session, and sometimes throwing us with jokes. The whole journey was full of laughter and we got close really quickly. Something worth mentioning was that, they would celebrate the Islamic festival (Eid Al-Adha) on 12th of September, 2016, and because of this, we had the chance to explore a few authentic local markets that were really busy with people trying to get ready for their big festival, buying and selling goats, sheeps and other spices. The stop at the market on our way from Marrakech to Essaouira was quite random, but in my opinion was the best part of the trip!! Buzzing through the crowd, observing the locals' way of living, their culture, religion, food... EVERYTHING! That was AMAZING!!Throughout the journey, I was amazed by the various landscapes in Morocco. Dry land with cactus; ground with troves of marine fossils; mountains of different colour (red, brown or black); Sahara deserts with shrubs; national park with trees just like those in tropical country (My hometown: Malaysia!). Moroccan cuisine such as tagine, couscous, zaalouk, b'stilla, all tasted amazing! They are not spicy and hence, no worries. Their mint tea was refreshing and I think I am addicted to it (they called it Moroccan whiskey with zero alcohol, LOL!!) Rachid recommended us to local restaurants with tasty food at a reasonable price. He even helped us to bargain as we do have language barrier with the locals. The accommodation arranged by Rachid was brilliant. The staffs at the hotels and haimas were all helpful and warming, greeting us with smiles and always welcome us with their mint tea. Breakfasts were included and the hotels are all at the right spots, allowing us to walk around and explore the town by ourselves. The night in sahara was lively with their traditional musics, songs and board game. Rachid was a really responsible tour guide. When one of my friends fell sick in Sahara desert (probably due to motion sickness after riding the camel, or maybe because of the heat), he rushed to us, took good care of my friend, and stayed all night with us. His sincerity in making friends and his generosity show us the best side and also the beauty of Morocco. Once again, thanks a lot for the trip of a lifetime!!!!! We highly recommend this company to anyone.  Tips: - Travel in a larger group comes a better price. - Ask for permission if you would like to take photos of their stalls, or else you might end up being scolded.

Best part of our trip. We travelled with our guide, Mohammed, for 3 days from Marrrakech, to Merzouga in near to Sahara, to Fez. We had a great time talking to him during the journey - he shared stories about life in Morocco and made some stops that were off the beaten path for us. We definitely felt like we were in good hands and were able to relax and just enjoy the experience. We covered a lot of ground over three days but it didn't feel like it because there was something spectacular to see around every corner.

9 day tour of Morocco organized by Rashid- guide Ali Ala. This review will be about the service and the experience we had with our guides. He introduced us to our driver Ali, who was responsible for taking us to our sites throughout the country. Ali was super friendly, knowledgeable, generous and most importantly accommodating. Authentic Moroccan Experience. We had a very good experience with Tenere Tours since we contacted them to start organizing our trip to Morocco. Rashid ( who helped us organizing and also was our guide for our 10 day trip), was extremely responsive to all our questions and flexible with our requests. We were able to appreciate and learn about their culture, way of leaving, religion, history and food. We drove a little less of 2,500 kms for 10 days. Their 4x4 SUVs are in good condition and they know the roads very well. Roads are a mixed of good highways and more local roads. We were 3 adults, and as we had a driver & a guide the 3 of us had to share the back seat, this is something to consider depending on who is traveling. We travel during the month of Ramadan. 2 advantages: first, you get to see in deep how they live this month and the importance of the religion in their culture; also, I understand is a less "touristy' time, so there is less congestion. The only downfall is that most of the good restaurants in the big cities are not open for lunch, and at night if you are an early bird (like we are), you have to wait after 8 pm to get served in many places. The only thing that I would do different, is maybe go a little more upscale in the hotels. In general they are decent and clean, good service and food, but having been there, I now think with a little more money is worth the upgrade. If you travel during the summer sunblock, sunglasses and a good hat is a must! We reached temperatures over 45 Celsius in the desert. Overall we had a great experience, and left Morocco feeling is a Country rich in culture and history, with very kind people that understand the important role that tourism plays in their economy. Both Rashid and Hassan were very attentive, punctual, organized. Always making sure we were having a great time! They are fun to travel with and very knowledgeable of their culture and Country.
